original: @36b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @36b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: na ya bindu t'i k'a /
analyzed: na ya bindu t'i k'a /
translated: NyƒÅyabindu·π≠ƒ´kƒÅ

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rigs pa'i thigs pa'i rgya cher 'grel ba /
analyzed: rigs pa'i thigs pa'i rgya cher 'grel ba /
translated: Commentary on the Drop of Logic

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, the youthful one.

original: skye ba'i gdung ba rgyun rab 'byung rgyu can //
analyzed: skye ba'i gdung ba rgyun rab 'byung rgyu can //
translated: The one who puts an end to the suffering of birth, the cause of continuous arising,

original: 'gro las rnam par rgyal ba 'dod chags las //
analyzed: 'gro las rnam par rgyal ba 'dod chags las //
translated: The one who conquers the world, the one who desires to be free from attachment,

original: sogs pa'i dgra ldan bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung //
analyzed: sogs pa'i dgra ldan bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung //
translated: The one who possesses the enemy of desire, the speech of the Sugata,

original: yid kyi mun pa spyod par mdzad pa rgyal //
analyzed: yid kyi mun pa spyod par mdzad pa rgyal //
translated: The one who acts to dispel the darkness of the mind, the Victorious One.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa brjod do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa brjod do //
translated: The expression correct knowledge and so on states the purpose of the topic of this chapter.

original: rab tu byed pa'i lus ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i lus ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The body of the chapter is twofold:

original: sgra dang don to //
analyzed: sgra dang don to //
translated: Sound and meaning.

original: de la sgra'i dgos pa ni brjod par bya ba bstan pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa de'i phyir de mi dpyad do //
analyzed: de la sgra'i dgos pa ni brjod par bya ba bstan pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa de'i phyir de mi dpyad do //
translated: Among them, the purpose of sound is to indicate the subject matter, not anything else. Therefore, it is not analyzed.

original: ci ste brjod par bya ba yang dgos pa med pa nyid yin na ni de bstan pa'i phyir sgra dgod pa'i rtsom pa yang mi bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste brjod par bya ba yang dgos pa med pa nyid yin na ni de bstan pa'i phyir sgra dgod pa'i rtsom pa yang mi bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the object of expression is also purposeless, then one should not undertake the composition of a treatise in order to teach it.

original: dper na bya rog gi so dgos pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa dang ldan pa de brtag pa'i rtsom pa mi byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bya rog gi so dgos pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa dang ldan pa de brtag pa'i rtsom pa mi byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a person who has understanding does not undertake the composition of a treatise in order to investigate the teeth of a crow, because they are purposeless.

original: de bas na rab tu byed pa 'di brtsam par bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'dis brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa bstan to /üîΩ'di dag gi don ni gang gi phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa'i sngon du 'gro ba de bas na de bstan pa'i phyir 'di brtsams so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rab tu byed pa 'di brtsam par bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'dis brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa bstan to / 'di dag gi don ni gang gi phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa'i sngon du 'gro ba de bas na de bstan pa'i phyir 'di brtsams so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that this treatise should be undertaken, the purpose of what is to be expressed by it is taught.üîΩThe meaning of these is: since the arising of right knowledge is the antecedent of the accomplishment of all the aims of man, therefore, in order to teach it, this treatise is composed.

original: 'dir ni rab tu byed pa'i brjod par bya ba yang dag pa'i shes pa'i dgos pa de skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pas dgos pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni rab tu byed pa'i brjod par bya ba yang dag pa'i shes pa'i dgos pa de skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pas dgos pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: Here, the purpose of right knowledge, which is the object of expression of the treatise, is taught as the cause of the accomplishment of all the aims of man.

original: don 'di brjod pa na yang 'brel pa dang / dgos pa dang / brjod par bya ba rnams bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: don 'di brjod pa na yang 'brel pa dang / dgos pa dang / brjod par bya ba rnams bstan pa yin te /
translated: When this matter is stated, the connection, the purpose, and the subject matter are also taught.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu'i don la phan pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa rab tu byed pa 'dis bstan par bya ba yin par smra ba na yang dag pa'i shes pa ni sgra bkod pa 'di'i brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu'i don la phan pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa rab tu byed pa 'dis bstan par bya ba yin par smra ba na yang dag pa'i shes pa ni sgra bkod pa 'di'i brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: When it is said that the subject matter of this treatise is the correct knowledge that is beneficial for the aims of man, then correct knowledge is the subject matter of this verbal composition.

original: de bstan pa ni dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni dgos pa yin no //
translated: And its teaching is the purpose.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di ni dgos pa'i thabs su @37a * //üîΩsmras pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di ni dgos pa'i thabs su @37a * // smras pa yin te /
translated: This treatise is said to be the means to the purpose.

original: de bas na brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa bstan pa'i shugs kyis 'brel pa la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na brjod par bya ba'i dgos pa bstan pa'i shugs kyis 'brel pa la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the purpose of the subject matter implicitly teaches the connection and so forth.

original: ngag gcig po 'dis ni 'brel pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa rnams dngos su smra bar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: ngag gcig po 'dis ni 'brel pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa rnams dngos su smra bar mi nus kyi /
translated: By this single statement, the connection, the subject matter, and the purpose cannot be stated directly,

original: gcig smra ba na gsum ni shugs kyis bstan te /
analyzed: gcig smra ba na gsum ni shugs kyis bstan te /
translated: but when one is stated, the other three are implicitly taught.

original: de la de zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: de la de zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúthat‚Äù is the word for the subject matter.

original: bstan to zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: bstan to zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'i tshig go //
translated: The word expounded is the purpose.

original: smra ba po rab tu byed pa mdzad par rtsol ba'i dgos pa dang / nyan pa rnams nyan pa'i dgos pa yang 'dir bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: smra ba po rab tu byed pa mdzad par rtsol ba'i dgos pa dang / nyan pa rnams nyan pa'i dgos pa yang 'dir bsam par bya ste /
translated: The purpose of the author's composition of the treatise and the purpose of the listener's study should be considered here.

original: 'di ltar rtog pa dang ldan pa thams cad kyi 'jug pa ni dgos pa brtags nas 'jug go //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog pa dang ldan pa thams cad kyi 'jug pa ni dgos pa brtags nas 'jug go //
translated: Thus, the engagement of all who are rational is engagement after examining the purpose.

original: de bas na slob dpon gyis rab tu byed pa ci'i phyir byas /
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon gyis rab tu byed pa ci'i phyir byas /
translated: Therefore, the master says, Why was the treatise composed?üîΩAnd why do the listeners listen?

original: nyan pa rnams kyang ci'i phyir nyan ces the tshom du gyur pa la bstan pa ni dgos pa yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nyan pa rnams kyang ci'i phyir nyan ces the tshom du gyur pa la bstan pa ni dgos pa yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: When there is doubt, the purpose is stated.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa khong du chud par byed pa rnams kyi ston pa por bdag nyid bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di byas la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa khong du chud par byed pa rnams kyi ston pa por bdag nyid bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di byas la /
translated: This treatise was composed in order to make oneself a teacher for those who wish to understand reality.

original: slob ma rnams kyang slob dpon gyis sbyar ba bdag nyid khong du chud par 'dod nas rab tu byed pa nyan pas na rab tu byed pa mdzad pa dang / nyan pa gnyis kyi dgos pa ni khong du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: slob ma rnams kyang slob dpon gyis sbyar ba bdag nyid khong du chud par 'dod nas rab tu byed pa nyan pas na rab tu byed pa mdzad pa dang / nyan pa gnyis kyi dgos pa ni khong du chud pa yin no //
translated: The disciples, too, desire to understand the treatise composed by the master, and so they listen to the chapter. The purpose of both the composition and the listening is the understanding.

original: 'brel pa ston pa'i tshig ni med de shugs kyis khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ston pa'i tshig ni med de shugs kyis khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: There is no statement that teaches the connection, but it is to be understood by implication.

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams rab tu byed pa 'di rtsom pa ni 'di nyid thabs yin gyi gzhan ma yin par bstan pa nyid kyis rab tu byed pa dang dgos pa gnyis thabs dang thabs las byung ba'iüîΩ'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams rab tu byed pa 'di rtsom pa ni 'di nyid thabs yin gyi gzhan ma yin par bstan pa nyid kyis rab tu byed pa dang dgos pa gnyis thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'brel pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the composition of this chapter by those who are endowed with discernment is itself the means for the teaching of right knowledge, and not something else. The very teaching of this indicates that the chapter and its purpose are connected as means and product.

original: rab tu byed pa nyan pa'i sngon rol du brjod par bya ba la sogs pa bstan du zin kyang tshad ma med pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa nyan pa'i sngon rol du brjod par bya ba la sogs pa bstan du zin kyang tshad ma med pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Even though the subject matter and so on are taught prior to the listening to the chapter, is it not the case that those who are endowed with discernment will not grasp it because there is no valid cognition?

original: rtsom pa'i phyogs su de dag bstan pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: rtsom pa'i phyogs su de dag bstan pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is the use of teaching them in the context of composition?

original: rab tu byed pa ma thos par ni smras su zin kyang nges par mi 'gyur ba bden mod kyi /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa ma thos par ni smras su zin kyang nges par mi 'gyur ba bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that even if one speaks without hearing the chapter, one will not be certain.

original: bstan na tshad ma med pa'i brjod par bya ba la sogs pa la the tshom skye la /
analyzed: bstan na tshad ma med pa'i brjod par bya ba la sogs pa la the tshom skye la /
translated: But if one teaches, doubt arises about the immeasurable subject matter, etc.

original: the tshom las kyang rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom las kyang rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: And from doubt, one will engage.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams don la the tshom yod pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag yin la /
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams don la the tshom yod pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag yin la /
translated: For those who have understanding, doubt about the meaning is a factor of engagement.

original: don du mi 'gyur ba la the tshom yod pa yang ldog pa'i yan lag yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: don du mi 'gyur ba la the tshom yod pa yang ldog pa'i yan lag yin pa de bas na /
translated: And doubt about the meaning that is not useful is a factor of disengagement. Therefore,

original: bstan bcos mdzad pa nyid kyis 'brel pa la sogs pa ni brjod par rigs so //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pa nyid kyis 'brel pa la sogs pa ni brjod par rigs so //
translated: it is reasonable for the author of the treatise to state the connection, etc.

original: 'chad pa po rnams kyi tshig ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i don du gzhan du srid kyi /
analyzed: 'chad pa po rnams kyi tshig ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i don du gzhan du srid kyi /
translated: The words of the expounders are possible elsewhere for the sake of affection, etc.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pa rnams rab tu byed pa rtsom pa la @37b ni brjod par bya ba la sogs pa'i log par ston pa'i dgos pa ma mthong ba la 'jug pa yang med de /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pa rnams rab tu byed pa rtsom pa la @37b ni brjod par bya ba la sogs pa'i log par ston pa'i dgos pa ma mthong ba la 'jug pa yang med de /
translated: When authors of treatises compose a treatise, they do not engage in composing a treatise without seeing the purpose of the treatise, such as its subject matter and so on.

original: de bas na de dag la the tshom bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na de dag la the tshom bya bar rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is appropriate to have doubts about those treatises.

original: ma bstan na ni rtog pa po rnams rab tu byed pa 'di'i brjod par bya ba ni bya rog gi so brtag pa bzhin dgos pa med do zhes bya bar srid par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ma bstan na ni rtog pa po rnams rab tu byed pa 'di'i brjod par bya ba ni bya rog gi so brtag pa bzhin dgos pa med do zhes bya bar srid par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If the purpose is not stated, it is possible that those who contemplate it will think, ‚ÄúThe subject matter of this treatise is like the examination of a crow‚Äôs teeth. It has no purpose.‚Äù

original: klu 'jog po'i spyi bo na rims nad sel ba'i rin po che'i rgyan gyi man ngag bzhin du bsgrub par mi nus pa'am /
analyzed: klu 'jog po'i spyi bo na rims nad sel ba'i rin po che'i rgyan gyi man ngag bzhin du bsgrub par mi nus pa'am /
translated: Or they may think, ‚ÄúIt is like the esoteric instructions for a precious ornament that cures a fever on the head of the nƒÅga Tak·π£aka. It cannot be accomplished.

original: ma bag mar len pa'i rim pa'i man ngag bzhin du dgos pa'i 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: ma bag mar len pa'i rim pa'i man ngag bzhin du dgos pa'i 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa'am /
translated: Or it is like the esoteric instructions for taking a maiden as a bride. It is not something to be desired for its purpose.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di bas dgos pa'i thabs sla ba yod pa'am /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di bas dgos pa'i thabs sla ba yod pa'am /
translated: Or there is an easier method for the purpose than this treatise.

original: rab tu byed pa thabs ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya bar yang srid par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa thabs ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya bar yang srid par 'gyur te /
translated: Or this treatise is only a method that is not a method.‚Äù

original: don med par srid snyam pa de dag las don med par srid snyam pa gcig yod na yang rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don med par srid snyam pa de dag las don med par srid snyam pa gcig yod na yang rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If any of them were to think that existence is meaningless, those who are rational would not engage in it.

original: brjod par bya ba la sogs pa smras na ni don med par srid snyam pa dang mi mthun par srid snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba la sogs pa smras na ni don med par srid snyam pa dang mi mthun par srid snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: But if one were to speak about the object, etc., then the thought that existence is meaningless would be inconsistent with the thought that existence is meaningful.

original: des kyang rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur ro //üîΩde bas na rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: des kyang rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur ro // de bas na rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur bas na /
translated: And that would cause those who are rational to engage in it.üîΩTherefore, since those who are rational would engage in it, the object, etc. would be meaningful as limbs for the engagement of those who are rational.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams 'jug pa'i yan lag tu don yod par srid do snyam du bya ba'i phyir 'brel pa la sogs pa bstan par bya'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams 'jug pa'i yan lag tu don yod par srid do snyam du bya ba'i phyir 'brel pa la sogs pa bstan par bya'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Thus, the connection, etc. should be taught in order to make one think that existence is meaningful.

original: mi slu bar byed pa'i shes pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: mi slu bar byed pa'i shes pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no //
translated: A non-deceptive consciousness is a correct consciousness.

original: 'jig rten na yang sngon nye bar bstan pa'i don dang phrad par byed pa la mi slu bar byed pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang sngon nye bar bstan pa'i don dang phrad par byed pa la mi slu bar byed pa zhes brjod do //
translated: In the world, that which causes one to attain an object previously indicated is called non-deceptive.

original: de bzhin du shes pa yang bstan pa'i don dang phrad par byed na mi slu bar byed pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa yang bstan pa'i don dang phrad par byed na mi slu bar byed pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Likewise, if cognition causes one to contact the object that is taught, it is said to be non-deceptive.

original: phrad par byed pa nyid kyang bstan pa'i don la 'jug par byed pa kho na phrad par byed pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: phrad par byed pa nyid kyang bstan pa'i don la 'jug par byed pa kho na phrad par byed pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin te /
translated: And the very fact that it causes one to contact is the fact that it causes one to engage in the object that is taught, and not anything else.

original: 'di ltar shes pa ni skyes bar byed pas don dang phrad par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa ni skyes bar byed pas don dang phrad par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: For in this way, cognition does not cause one to contact the object by producing it.

original: 'on kyang don la skyes bu 'jug par byed pas na don dang phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang don la skyes bu 'jug par byed pas na don dang phrad pa yin no //
translated: But rather, it causes one to contact the object by causing the person to engage in the object.

original: 'jug par byed pa yang 'jug pa'i yul ston par byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa yang 'jug pa'i yul ston par byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: And it causes one to engage in the object by teaching the object of engagement.

original: skyes bu rnams btsan thabs su shes pas gzhug par ni mi nus so //
analyzed: skyes bu rnams btsan thabs su shes pas gzhug par ni mi nus so //
translated: For it is not possible for cognition to force a person to engage in the object.

original: de bas na don rtogs pa kho na tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin la ;
analyzed: de bas na don rtogs pa kho na tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin la ;
translated: Therefore, the effect of valid cognition is just the understanding of the object.

original: rtogs pa'i don la skyes bu bcug par gyur pa ni don dang phrad par gyur pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don la skyes bu bcug par gyur pa ni don dang phrad par gyur pa yang yin no //
translated: And the person's engagement in the object that is understood is the contact with the object.

original: de ltar na don rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshad ma'i bya ba rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na don rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshad ma'i bya ba rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the function of valid cognition is complete because the object is understood.

original: de bas nam bcad pa'i yul can ni tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas nam bcad pa'i yul can ni tshad ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the subject of the determination is valid cognition.

original: shes pa gang gis thog ma nyid du don rtogs pa de nyid kyis skyes bu bcug par gyur cing don @38a * //üîΩdang phrad par gyur pa yang yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gang gis thog ma nyid du don rtogs pa de nyid kyis skyes bu bcug par gyur cing don @38a * // dang phrad par gyur pa yang yin te /
translated: By whatever cognition the object is first understood, by that very [cognition] the person is engaged and the object is encountered.

original: don de kho na la ni shes pa gzhan gyis lhag pa ci byar yang med do //
analyzed: don de kho na la ni shes pa gzhan gyis lhag pa ci byar yang med do //
translated: And for that very object, there is nothing else that another cognition can do.

original: de bas na bcad pa'i yul can ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bcad pa'i yul can ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the subject of the determination is not valid cognition.

original: de la mthong ba nyid du shes pa'i don gang yin pa'i don gang yin pa de ni mngon sum nyid kyis 'jug pa'i yul du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mthong ba nyid du shes pa'i don gang yin pa'i don gang yin pa de ni mngon sum nyid kyis 'jug pa'i yul du byas pa yin no //
translated: In that regard, the object that is known as seen is the object that is made the object of engagement by direct perception itself.

original: gang gi phyir don gang la rnam par rtog pas mngon sum gyi byed pa nyid rjes su rtog pa de'i mngon du byas pa ston bar byed pa ni mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don gang la rnam par rtog pas mngon sum gyi byed pa nyid rjes su rtog pa de'i mngon du byas pa ston bar byed pa ni mngon sum yin no //
translated: Because when one infers the function of direct perception with respect to an object through conceptual thought, it is direct perception that reveals what is made manifest by that [conceptual thought].

original: de bas na ma mthong ba nyid du shes par byas pa ni mngon sum gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ma mthong ba nyid du shes par byas pa ni mngon sum gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the demonstration of non-perception is a demonstration by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang rtags mthong ba las nges pa 'jug pa'i yul ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang rtags mthong ba las nges pa 'jug pa'i yul ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: Inference also demonstrates an object that is ascertained from seeing a reason.

original: de lta yin dang mngon sum yang snang bzhin pa'i don nges par ston par byed pa dang / rjes su dpag pa la yang rtags dang 'brel pa'i nges par ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang mngon sum yang snang bzhin pa'i don nges par ston par byed pa dang / rjes su dpag pa la yang rtags dang 'brel pa'i nges par ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: If that is so, then direct perception demonstrates an object that is present, and inference also demonstrates an object that is related to a reason.

original: de'i phyir de gnyis ni nges pa'i don ston par byed la nges na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis ni nges pa'i don ston par byed la nges na tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two demonstrate ascertained objects, and when they are ascertained, they are valid cognitions.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Other consciousnesses are not like that.

original: thob par nus pa'i don ston pa ni thob par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: thob par nus pa'i don ston pa ni thob par byed pa yin la /
translated: A demonstration of an object that can be attained is a means of attaining it.

original: tshad ma yang thob par byed pa las yin na tshad ma gnyis las gzhan pa'i shes pas bstan pa'i don ni smig rgyu la chu bzhin du kha cig shin tu phyin ci log pa yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma yang thob par byed pa las yin na tshad ma gnyis las gzhan pa'i shes pas bstan pa'i don ni smig rgyu la chu bzhin du kha cig shin tu phyin ci log pa yin la /
translated: And a valid cognition is a means of attaining it. If the object demonstrated by a consciousness that is different from the two valid cognitions is like water in a mirage, it is completely erroneous for some.

original: de yang med pa'i phyir phrad par bya mi nus so //
analyzed: de yang med pa'i phyir phrad par bya mi nus so //
translated: Since it does not exist, it cannot make contact.

original: kha cig ni yid gnyis kyi don bzhin ni yid gnyis ni don bzhin du dngos po dang dngos po med pa ma nges pa yin la /
analyzed: kha cig ni yid gnyis kyi don bzhin ni yid gnyis ni don bzhin du dngos po dang dngos po med pa ma nges pa yin la /
translated: Some say: Doubt is like the object of doubt. Doubt is not ascertained as either a thing or a nonthing.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga'i don dang ldan pa'i 'gro ba yang yod pa ma yin la de bas na de dang 'dra ba phrad par mi nus so //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga'i don dang ldan pa'i 'gro ba yang yod pa ma yin la de bas na de dang 'dra ba phrad par mi nus so //
translated: Also, there is no world that possesses the object of both a thing and a nonthing. Therefore it cannot make contact in that way.

original: rtags med par rnam par rtog pa nges par ma mthong bar 'jug pa thams cad kyis bstan par bya ba'i don ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tu ma nges pa kho na yin pa de yang thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: rtags med par rnam par rtog pa nges par ma mthong bar 'jug pa thams cad kyis bstan par bya ba'i don ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tu ma nges pa kho na yin pa de yang thob par mi nus so //
translated: Since a sign is not ascertained, all engagement in the absence of seeing is taught to be an object that is not ascertained as either a thing or a nonthing. That also cannot be obtained.

original: de bas na phrad par mi nus pa shin tu phyin ci log pa dang dngos po med pa ma nges pa'i don ston par byed pas shes pa gzhan ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na phrad par mi nus pa shin tu phyin ci log pa dang dngos po med pa ma nges pa'i don ston par byed pas shes pa gzhan ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it cannot make contact, it is utterly mistaken. Since it teaches an object that is not ascertained as a nonthing, another consciousness is not a valid knowledge.

original: don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis kyang don byed par nus pa thob pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi shes pa btsal bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis kyang don byed par nus pa thob pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi shes pa btsal bar bya ba yin la /
translated: Those who seek to accomplish a purpose should seek to know the reason for obtaining the ability to accomplish a purpose.

original: des btsal ba gang yin pa de nyid bstan bcos las kyang dpyad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: des btsal ba gang yin pa de nyid bstan bcos las kyang dpyad par bya ba yin te /
translated: That which is sought should be analyzed in a treatise.

original: de bas na don byed par nus pa'i dngos po bstan pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don byed par nus pa'i dngos po bstan pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of an entity that is able to accomplish a purpose is right knowledge.

original: gang zhig des rab tu bstan pa nyid des thob par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig des rab tu bstan pa nyid des thob par bya ba yin te /
translated: That which is taught by that is to be obtained by that.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThe attainment of the object is the realization of the object‚Äù is complete.

original: de thob par byed pa nyid ni don thob pa rtogs pa nyid ni don thob pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes brjod pa zin pa yin no zhes de la yul @38b tha dad pa dang / dus tha dad pa dang / rnam pa tha dad pa ni rab tu bstan pa las dngos po gzhan nyid de 'di ltar dngos po gzhan nyid 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa las yin la /
analyzed: de thob par byed pa nyid ni don thob pa rtogs pa nyid ni don thob pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes brjod pa zin pa yin no zhes de la yul @38b tha dad pa dang / dus tha dad pa dang / rnam pa tha dad pa ni rab tu bstan pa las dngos po gzhan nyid de 'di ltar dngos po gzhan nyid 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa las yin la /
translated: The difference in object, the difference in time, and the difference in aspect are the difference in entity from the teaching, because the difference in entity is the possession of contradictory properties.

original: yul dang / dus dang / rnam pa tha dad pa yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: yul dang / dus dang / rnam pa tha dad pa yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: And the object, time, and aspect are also contradictory.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa ni rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i dngos po la tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa ni rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i dngos po la tshad ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, a cognition that apprehends an entity with one aspect is not a valid cognition with regard to an entity with another aspect.

original: dper na dung dkar po la ser por 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dung dkar po la ser por 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like apprehending a white conch as yellow.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyi dngos po 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyi dngos po 'dzin pa ni /
translated: A cognition that apprehends an entity with one aspect

original: rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i dngos po la tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i dngos po la tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: is not a valid cognition with regard to an entity with another aspect.

original: yul gzhan na gnas par 'dzin pa yang yul gzhan na gnas pa la tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gzhan na gnas par 'dzin pa yang yul gzhan na gnas pa la tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: A cognition that apprehends an object in one place is not a valid cognition with regard to an object in another place.

original: ji ltar sgo'i bu ga'i gseb kyi yul na nor bu'i 'od gnas pa la nor bur 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni khang ba'i phug na nor bu gnas pa la tshad ma ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sgo'i bu ga'i gseb kyi yul na nor bu'i 'od gnas pa la nor bur 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni khang ba'i phug na nor bu gnas pa la tshad ma ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the cognition that apprehends the light of a jewel in the opening of a door not being a valid cognition with regard to the jewel that is in the interior of a house.

original: dus gzhan dang ldan pa 'dzin pa dang / dus gzhan dang ldan pa'i dngos po la tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan dang ldan pa 'dzin pa dang / dus gzhan dang ldan pa'i dngos po la tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: A cognition that apprehends an entity with one time is not a valid cognition with regard to an entity with another time.

original: ji ltar nam phyed yin pa la nyi ma'i gung gi ngo bor 'dzin pa'i rmi lam gyi shes pa ni nam phyed kyi ngo bo la tshang ma ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nam phyed yin pa la nyi ma'i gung gi ngo bor 'dzin pa'i rmi lam gyi shes pa ni nam phyed kyi ngo bo la tshang ma ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the consciousness in a dream that apprehends the essence of midday when it is midnight does not apprehend midnight.

original: yul nges pa dang rnam pa nges pa de ni phrad par nus pa yin gyi dus gang yin pa go yongs su bcad pa'i dus gang yin pa de nyid dang phrad par mi nus pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yul nges pa dang rnam pa nges pa de ni phrad par nus pa yin gyi dus gang yin pa go yongs su bcad pa'i dus gang yin pa de nyid dang phrad par mi nus pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not the case that the object is ascertained and the aspect is ascertained, and that they are capable of contact, but that the time that is ascertained is not capable of contact with the time that is ascertained?

original: gang gi dus na yongs su bcad pa'i dus de nyid kyi tshe ni phrad par bya ba yin par mi smra ste /
analyzed: gang gi dus na yongs su bcad pa'i dus de nyid kyi tshe ni phrad par bya ba yin par mi smra ste /
translated: We do not say that the time that is ascertained is capable of contact with the time that is ascertained.

original: mthong ba'i dus kyang gzhan phrad pa'i dus kyang gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i dus kyang gzhan phrad pa'i dus kyang gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the time of seeing is different from the time of contact.

original: 'on kyang dus gang du yongs su bcad pa'i dngos po de nyid dang phrad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dus gang du yongs su bcad pa'i dngos po de nyid dang phrad par bya ba yin te /
translated: But the object that is ascertained is capable of contact with the time that is ascertained.

original: tha dad pa med par mngon par zhen pa'i phyir rgyun gyis zhugs pa la gcig pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa med par mngon par zhen pa'i phyir rgyun gyis zhugs pa la gcig pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Because of the conception of nondifference, the stream is seen as one.

original: gang gi sngon du shes pa 'gro ba de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi sngon du shes pa 'gro ba de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which precedes consciousness is called prior.

original: 'bras bu bas rgyu snga ba la sngon du sang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu bas rgyu snga ba la sngon du sang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which precedes the effect is called prior, since the cause precedes the effect.

original: rgyu'i sgra smos na ni skyes bu'i don 'grub pa'i dngos kyi rgyu yin par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i sgra smos na ni skyes bu'i don 'grub pa'i dngos kyi rgyu yin par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the word cause were used, it would be understood that it is the direct cause of the accomplishment of the purpose of the person.

original: sngon du song ba'i sgra ni snga ba tsam la bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du song ba'i sgra ni snga ba tsam la bya'o //
translated: The word prior is used to indicate mere precedence.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Correct knowledge is twofold:

original: don byed par snang ba dang / don byed par nus pa la rab tu 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: don byed par snang ba dang / don byed par nus pa la rab tu 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: that which engages the appearance of the object‚Äôs function and that which engages the object‚Äôs capacity to function.

original: de nyid la rab tu 'jug par byed pa gang yin pa de 'dir dpyad par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de nyid la rab tu 'jug par byed pa gang yin pa de 'dir dpyad par bya ba yin la /
translated: That which engages the object‚Äôs capacity to function is to be analyzed here.

original: de yang sngon du song ba tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang sngon du song ba tsam yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is merely prior,

original: dngos po rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not the direct cause.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa yod na sngar mthong ba dran no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa yod na sngar mthong ba dran no //
translated: When there is correct knowledge, one remembers what was previously seen.

original: dran pa las mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: dran pa las mngon par 'dod do //
translated: From memory, there is desire.

original: mngon par 'dod pa las rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa las rab tu 'jug go //
translated: From desire, there is engagement.

original: rab tu zhugs pa na phrad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab tu zhugs pa na phrad par 'gyur te /
translated: When engaged, there is contact.
The first of these is theüîΩcause of the first, and the second is the cause of the second.

original: phyir mngon sum gyi rgyu ma yin no //üîΩdon byed par snang ba ni mngon sum du phrad pa'i rgyu yin mod kyi /
analyzed: phyir mngon sum gyi rgyu ma yin no // don byed par snang ba ni mngon sum du phrad pa'i rgyu yin mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not the cause of perception.

original: 'on kyang de brtag par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de brtag par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The appearance of the object as capable of effective action is indeed the cause of the perception, but it is not to be examined.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams gang la don du gnyer ba rtog pa dang ldan pa the tshom za ba de nyid ni brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams gang la don du gnyer ba rtog pa dang ldan pa the tshom za ba de nyid ni brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: That which is to be examined is that very thing which is sought by those who are doubtful about it.

original: don byed par snang ba'i shes pa yod na ni skyes bu don grub zin pas des na de la don du gnyer ba rnams yid gnyis med de /
analyzed: don byed par snang ba'i shes pa yod na ni skyes bu don grub zin pas des na de la don du gnyer ba rnams yid gnyis med de /
translated: When there is a cognition of the appearance of the object as capable of effective action, the person has already accomplished his purpose, and so those who seek that purpose have no doubt about it.

original: de'i phyir de brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be examined.

original: de bas na brtag par bya bar 'os pa dngos kyi rgyu ma yin pa yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir rgyu'i sgra gzhan nas sngon du yod pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas na brtag par bya bar 'os pa dngos kyi rgyu ma yin pa yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir rgyu'i sgra gzhan nas sngon du yod pa smos so //
translated: Thus, in order to demonstrate the cause of the real cognition, which is not the cause of what is to be examined, the word ‚Äúcause‚Äù is used in the sense of something existing previously.

original: skyes bu'i don ni don du gnyer bar bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don ni don du gnyer bar bya ba'i don te /
translated: The purpose of a person is the purpose that is sought by a person,

original: 'dod par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which means that which is desired.

original: dor bar bya ba'am blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dor bar bya ba'am blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be rejected or accepted.

original: dor bar bya ba'i don ni dor bar 'dod la /
analyzed: dor bar bya ba'i don ni dor bar 'dod la /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúto be rejected‚Äù is to be rejected.

original: blang bar bya ba yang blang bar 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba yang blang bar 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúto be accepted‚Äù is to be accepted.

original: dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba las ma gtogs pa phung po gzhan ni med de /
analyzed: dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba las ma gtogs pa phung po gzhan ni med de /
translated: There is no other aggregate apart from what is to be rejected and what is to be accepted.

original: btang snyoms su bya ba yang blang bar mi bya ba yin pa'i phyir dor bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: btang snyoms su bya ba yang blang bar mi bya ba yin pa'i phyir dor bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: Even that which is to be regarded with equanimity is to be rejected because it is not to be accepted.

original: de 'grub pa ni dor ba dang len pa dang / rgyu la rag las nas 'grub pa ni skye ba la brjod la /
analyzed: de 'grub pa ni dor ba dang len pa dang / rgyu la rag las nas 'grub pa ni skye ba la brjod la /
translated: Its establishment is the establishment of rejection and acceptance. Establishment is said to be dependent on a cause.

original: shes pa la rag las te 'grub pa ni rjes su sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa la rag las te 'grub pa ni rjes su sgrub pa ste /
translated: Establishment is dependent on knowledge.

original: dor bar bya ba la ni dor bar bya bar rjes su bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dor bar bya ba la ni dor bar bya bar rjes su bsgrub pa'o //
translated: That which is to be rejected is established as to be rejected.

original: blang bar bya ba yang blang bar rjes su sgrub pa'o//
analyzed: blang bar bya ba yang blang bar rjes su sgrub pa'o//
translated: That which is to be accepted is established as to be accepted.

original: de bas na dor bar bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba gnyis la 'dor ba dang len pa'i mtshan nyid rjes su sgrub pa ni 'grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dor bar bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba gnyis la 'dor ba dang len pa'i mtshan nyid rjes su sgrub pa ni 'grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of rejection and acceptance is said to be the establishment of the characteristics of rejection and acceptance.

original: 'di ni thams cad kyang yin la skyes bu don 'grub pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni thams cad kyang yin la skyes bu don 'grub pa yang yin no //
translated: He is the one who accomplishes the aims of all, and he is the one who accomplishes his own aim.

original: thams cad kyi sgra ni 'dir rdzas ma lus pa la 'jug gi /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgra ni 'dir rdzas ma lus pa la 'jug gi /
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù here refers to all the substances,

original: rnam pa ma lus pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ma lus pa la ma yin no //
translated: not to all the aspects.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyus rnam pa gnyi ga yang 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni ma yin la skyes bu'i don 'di ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyus rnam pa gnyi ga yang 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni ma yin la skyes bu'i don 'di ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the meaning is not that both are accomplished by the cause of right knowledge, nor is it that the aim of the person is not accomplished.

original: 'on kyang gang ji tsam grub pa de dag thams cad ma lus par sgrub pa 'di'i rgyu ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang ji tsam grub pa de dag thams cad ma lus par sgrub pa 'di'i rgyu ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no //
translated: Rather, the cause of accomplishing all of them without exception is right knowledge.

original: log pa'i shes pa las bya rog dang ta la tsam du yang don 'grub pa med de /
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa las bya rog dang ta la tsam du yang don 'grub pa med de /
translated: Nothing is accomplished by wrong knowledge, not even the mere killing of a crow or a palm tree.

original: 'di ltar ci ste bstan pa'i don dang phrad par byed pa de lta na de las don 'grub pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci ste bstan pa'i don dang phrad par byed pa de lta na de las don 'grub pa yin la /
translated: Thus, if one encounters the object that is indicated, then the aim is accomplished.

original: bstan pa dang phrad par byed pa yang yang dag pa'i shes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bstan pa dang phrad par byed pa yang yang dag pa'i shes pa kho na yin no //
translated: And it is only right knowledge that encounters the indicated object.

original: bstan kyang ma phrad pa ni log pa'i shes pa yin la /
analyzed: bstan kyang ma phrad pa ni log pa'i shes pa yin la /
translated: But if it is taught and not encountered, it is a wrong consciousness.

original: thob par byed pa ma yin yang ji ltar don 'grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: thob par byed pa ma yin yang ji ltar don 'grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur /
translated: And even if it is not a means of attainment, how can it be a cause of accomplishing the object?

original: de bas na log pa'i shes pa gang yin @39b pa de las ni don grub pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de bas na log pa'i shes pa gang yin @39b pa de las ni don grub pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, an object is not accomplished from whatever is a wrong consciousness.

original: gang las don 'grub pa de ni yang dag pa'i shes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang las don 'grub pa de ni yang dag pa'i shes pa kho na yin no //
translated: And whatever accomplishes an object is only a right consciousness.

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid ni 'bad de bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid ni 'bad de bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, only right consciousness should be taught with effort.

original: gang gi phyir de nyid skyes bu'i don 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid skyes bu'i don 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa de bas na /
translated: And because it is the cause of accomplishing the person‚Äôs aim,

original: ji tsam du skyes bu'i don 'grub pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu can kho na yin no zhes ji snyed smras pa de thams cad ni yang dag pa'i shes pa ni skyes bu'i don grub pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya bas bstanüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: ji tsam du skyes bu'i don 'grub pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu can kho na yin no zhes ji snyed smras pa de thams cad ni yang dag pa'i shes pa ni skyes bu'i don grub pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya bas bstanüîΩpa yin no //
translated: to the extent that accomplishing the person‚Äôs aim is only due to right consciousness, all that is said is that right consciousness is the antecedent of all accomplishment of the person‚Äôs aim.

original: yin pas na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir de bas na zhes bya ba'i don yin la /
analyzed: yin pas na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir de bas na zhes bya ba'i don yin la /
translated: The word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason‚Äù here.

original: gang dang de yang rtag tu 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dang de yang rtag tu 'brel pa yin no //
translated: And that is always related to ‚Äúit.‚Äù

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Thus, this is the meaning:

original: gang gi phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa ni skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub par sngon du 'gro ba yin pa de bas na de bstan no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa ni skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub par sngon du 'gro ba yin pa de bas na de bstan no //
translated: Since the arising of right knowledge is the prerequisite for the accomplishment of all the aims of man, therefore, it is taught.

original: ci ste sgra'i sbyor ba la yang dag pa'i shes pa gtso bor ma gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: ci ste sgra'i sbyor ba la yang dag pa'i shes pa gtso bor ma gyur mod kyi /
translated: But, even though right knowledge is not the primary factor in the application of the word ‚Äútherefore,‚Äù

original: 'on kyang rab tu byed pa 'dir brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gtso bor yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rab tu byed pa 'dir brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gtso bor yin no //
translated: nevertheless, it is the primary factor here in the introductory essay because it is the subject matter.

original: de bas na de zhes bya ba'i sgra de nyid dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de zhes bya ba'i sgra de nyid dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù should be connected with ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: bstan par bya ba yin pas log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i sgo nas so sor bstan pa ni bstan to zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba yin pas log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i sgo nas so sor bstan pa ni bstan to zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The exposition of right knowledge is completed through the removal of misunderstanding, since it is the subject matter.

original: 'dir log par rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dir log par rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Here, there are four kinds of misunderstanding:

original: grangs dang / mtshan nyid dang / spyod yul dang / 'bras bu'i yul lo //üîΩde la grangs las log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: grangs dang / mtshan nyid dang / spyod yul dang / 'bras bu'i yul lo // de la grangs las log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: 2. that which is based on the ultimate.üîΩThe two kinds of clear knowledge are:üîΩ1. that which is based on the conventional, andüîΩ2. that which is based on the ultimate.

original: rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The two kinds of clear knowledge are:üîΩ1. that which is based on the conventional, andüîΩ2. that which is based on the ultimate.üîΩThe two kinds of clear knowledge are:

original: 'di la rnam pa gnyis te bye brag gnyis yod pas na rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di la rnam pa gnyis te bye brag gnyis yod pas na rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: 1. that which is based on the conventional, andüîΩ2. that which is based on the ultimate.üîΩThe two kinds of clear knowledge are:üîΩ1. that which is based on the conventional, andüîΩ2. that which is based on the ultimate.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i gsal ba ni gnyis yin no zhes grangs bstan pa'i sgo nas kyang gsal ba'i dbye ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i gsal ba ni gnyis yin no zhes grangs bstan pa'i sgo nas kyang gsal ba'i dbye ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: The two kinds of clear knowledge are:üîΩ1. that which is based on the conventional, andüîΩ2. that which is based on the ultimate.üîΩThe two kinds of clear knowledge are:üîΩ1. that which is based on the conventional, andüîΩ2. that which is based on the ultimate.üîΩThe two kinds of clear knowledge are:

original: gsal ba'i dbye ba bstan pa ni gsal ba so so la nges pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid bstan par nus kyi /
analyzed: gsal ba'i dbye ba bstan pa ni gsal ba so so la nges pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid bstan par nus kyi /
translated: 1. that which is based on the conventional, andüîΩ2. that which is based on the ultimate.üîΩThe two kinds of clear knowledge are:üîΩ1. that which is based on the conventional, andüîΩ2. that which is based on the ultimate.üîΩThe two kinds of clear knowledge are:

original: gsal ba'i dbye ba ma bstan na ni gsal ba mtha' dag la khyab pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid gcig po mi slu ba de rten so so las yod par smra bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gsal ba'i dbye ba ma bstan na ni gsal ba mtha' dag la khyab pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid gcig po mi slu ba de rten so so las yod par smra bar mi nus so //
translated: 1. that which is based on the conventional, andüîΩ2. that which is based on the ultimate.üîΩThe two kinds of clear knowledge are:

original: de bas na grangs kyi dbye ba bstan bas ni /
analyzed: de bas na grangs kyi dbye ba bstan bas ni /
translated: 1. that which is based on the conventional, andüîΩ2. that which is based on the ultimate.

original: mtshan nyid bstan pa'i yan lag kho na yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid bstan pa'i yan lag kho na yin te /
translated: It is only a part of the teaching of the definition,

original: gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyang grangs kyi dbye ba ma bstan par ni mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyang grangs kyi dbye ba ma bstan par ni mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the classification of the definition cannot be taught without teaching the classification of the number of the instances.

original: de ltar na mtshan nyid bstan pa'i yan lag nyid yin pa'i phyir grangs kyi dbye ba thog mar bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan nyid bstan pa'i yan lag nyid yin pa'i phyir grangs kyi dbye ba thog mar bstan to //
translated: Thus, the classification of the number is taught first because it is only a part of the teaching of the definition.

original: rnam pa de gnyis kyang gang zhes mngon sum dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa de gnyis kyang gang zhes mngon sum dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What are the two aspects?

original: @40a * // dbang po la brten pa'i don ni mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: @40a * // dbang po la brten pa'i don ni mngon sum yin no //
translated: Direct perception is that which has an object that is based on a sense faculty.

original: dbang po la brten pa yang sgra bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang po la brten pa yang sgra bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin gyi /
translated: Being based on a sense faculty is the reason for the etymology of the word perception.

original: 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the reason for the engagement of the word.

original: dbang po la brten pa nyid 'dis ni don gcig tu 'dus pa'i don mngon sum du byed pa nyid mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po la brten pa nyid 'dis ni don gcig tu 'dus pa'i don mngon sum du byed pa nyid mtshon pa yin te /
translated: This being based on a sense faculty indicates that it is the direct perceiver of the object that is a single entity.

original: de nyid sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no ;
analyzed: de nyid sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no ;
translated: That itself is the reason for the engagement of the word.

original: / de bas na gang cung zad don mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa de ni mngon sum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / de bas na gang cung zad don mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa de ni mngon sum zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, whatever cognition makes a present object known is called perception.

original: ci ste dbang po la brten pa kho na 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa yin na ni dbang po'i shes pa 'ba' zhig mngon sum yin par smras kyi /
analyzed: ci ste dbang po la brten pa kho na 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa yin na ni dbang po'i shes pa 'ba' zhig mngon sum yin par smras kyi /
translated: If the object is the cause of the engagement of the cognition that is based on the sense faculty, then only the sense cognition is said to be perception.

original: yid la sogs pa ni ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid la sogs pa ni ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be mental cognition, etc.

original: dper na 'gro bas na ba lang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na 'gro bas na ba lang zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, in the expression ‚Äúcow because of going,‚Äù

original: ba lang gi sgras 'gro ba'i bya ba bshad pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: ba lang gi sgras 'gro ba'i bya ba bshad pa yin mod kyi /
translated: although the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù explains the action of going,

original: 'on kyang 'gro ba'i bya bas nye bar mtshon pa don gcig la 'dus pa'i ba lang nyid sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du byed la /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gro ba'i bya bas nye bar mtshon pa don gcig la 'dus pa'i ba lang nyid sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du byed la /
translated: nevertheless, the word is applied as the reason for the identity of the cow, which is included in the same referential object as the action of going.

original: de ltar na 'gro yang rung mi 'gro yang rung /
analyzed: de ltar na 'gro yang rung mi 'gro yang rung /
translated: Thus, whether it is going or not going,

original: ba lang ni ba lang gi sgrar grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang ni ba lang gi sgrar grub pa bzhin no //
translated: the cow is established as the referent of the word ‚Äúcow.‚Äù

original: 'dis dpogs pas na dpag pa ste ;
analyzed: 'dis dpogs pas na dpag pa ste ;
translated: It is inferred because of that,üîΩtherefore it is inference.

original: byed pa bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i sgras ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma bstan te /
analyzed: byed pa bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i sgras ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma bstan te /
translated: The word ‚Äúinference‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúinference that proves an object to be accomplished‚Äù teaches a valid cognition that has the characteristic of having a concept.

original: rtags bzung zhing 'brel pa dran pa'i rjes la dpogs pa la ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: rtags bzung zhing 'brel pa dran pa'i rjes la dpogs pa la ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: Inference is a cognition that arises after apprehending a reason and remembering its relation.

original: phyogs kyi chos bzung nas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa 'brel par dran na rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ni dus phyis 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos bzung nas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa 'brel par dran na rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ni dus phyis 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: After apprehending the property of the subject, if one remembers the relation between the probandum and the proof, the engagement of inference is called ‚Äúarising later.‚Äù

original: dang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes la dpag pa ni gnyis ka yang mthu mtshungs par sdud pa yin te /
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes la dpag pa ni gnyis ka yang mthu mtshungs par sdud pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù includes both direct perception and inference, which are similar in power.

original: ji ltar don med pa'i mi 'byung ba'i phyir don dang phrad par byed pas mngon sum tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang don med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir yongs su bcad pa'i don dang phrad par byed pas tshad ma yin no zhes
analyzed: ji ltar don med pa'i mi 'byung ba'i phyir don dang phrad par byed pas mngon sum tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang don med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir yongs su bcad pa'i don dang phrad par byed pas tshad ma yin no zhes
translated: Just as direct perception is a valid cognition because it encounters an object that exists, since it does not occur if the object does not exist, in the same way, inference is a valid cognition because it encounters an object that is ascertained, since it does not occur if the object does not exist.

original: so // de la zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i don dang sbyar nas dmigs kyis dgar ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: so // de la zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i don dang sbyar nas dmigs kyis dgar ba byed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù is a restrictive particle, which is connected with the sense of the seventh case.

original: de bas na tshig gi don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de bas na tshig gi don 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning of the words:

original: de la ste mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa de gnyis la zhes tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ste mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa de gnyis la zhes tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that,‚Äù i.e., in those two, perception and inference, the compound is taught.

original: mngon sum ni zhes phyogs gcig tu byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni zhes phyogs gcig tu byed pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúPerception‚Äù is a restrictive particle,

original: de la tshogs pa las mngon sum nyid kyi rigs kyis phyogs gcig po tha dad du byed pa ni dmigs kyis dgar pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshogs pa las mngon sum nyid kyi rigs kyis phyogs gcig po tha dad du byed pa ni dmigs kyis dgar pa'o //
translated: because in that compound, the restrictive particle ‚Äúperception‚Äù is a restrictive particle, which is a different part of speech from the other part of speech, ‚Äúinference.‚Äù

original: de la mngon sum nyid rjes su brjod nas /
analyzed: de la mngon sum nyid rjes su brjod nas /
translated: Having thus stated the definition of perception,

original: rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa nyid sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa nyid sgrub pa yin te /
translated: the author establishes that it is free from conceptual thought and non-erroneous.

original: khyed dang nged cag la don la mngon sum du byed pa'i shes @40b pa grags pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa nyid yin par blta'o //
analyzed: khyed dang nged cag la don la mngon sum du byed pa'i shes @40b pa grags pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa nyid yin par blta'o //
translated: That which is known to you and us as a cognition that perceives an object is to be regarded as free from conceptual thought and non-erroneous.

original: rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa nyid ma grub pa yin na mngon sum gyis shes pa'i ngo bo gzhan ci zhig lus te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa nyid ma grub pa yin na mngon sum gyis shes pa'i ngo bo gzhan ci zhig lus te /
translated: If the nature of direct perception is not established as being free from conceptuality and non-mistaken, then what other nature of direct perception remains?

original: gang zhig mngon sum gyi sgras brjod par bya ba yin na rjes su brjod ces de snyam du ni bsam par mi bya ste ;
analyzed: gang zhig mngon sum gyi sgras brjod par bya ba yin na rjes su brjod ces de snyam du ni bsam par mi bya ste ;
translated: If it is said that it is to be expressed by the term ‚Äúdirect perception,‚Äù one should not think that it is to be expressed by the term ‚Äúdirect perception‚Äù after it is established.

original: 'di ltar dbang po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par byed cing don la yang mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa ni thams cad la rab tu grub ba ni mngon sum gyi sgras brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par byed cing don la yang mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa ni thams cad la rab tu grub ba ni mngon sum gyi sgras brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: Thus, the consciousness that follows and turns away from the sense faculties and also directly perceives the object is well-established as to be expressed by the term ‚Äúdirect perception.‚Äù

original: de rjes su brjod nas rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa nyid sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de rjes su brjod nas rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa nyid sgrub par byed do //
translated: After expressing that, it establishes being free from conceptuality and non-mistaken.

original: rtog pa dang bral te mi ldan pa ni rtog pa dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral te mi ldan pa ni rtog pa dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Being free from conceptuality and not possessing it is being free from conceptuality.

original: rtog pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtog pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is free from the nature of conceptuality.

original: ma 'khrul pa nyid sgrub par byed nus pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo la phyin ci ma log par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo la bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa nyid sgrub par byed nus pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo la phyin ci ma log par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo la bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-errone‚Äù means that it is not erroneous with regard to the nature of the entity that is capable of accomplishing its function.

original: don byed par nus pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo ni dbyibs su bkod pa'i khyad par can gyi kha dog gi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: don byed par nus pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo ni dbyibs su bkod pa'i khyad par can gyi kha dog gi bdag nyid de /
translated: The nature of an entity that is capable of accomplishing its function is the nature of color that is distinguished by its configuration.

original: de la ma 'khrul pa gang yin pa de dag ni ma 'khrul pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ma 'khrul pa gang yin pa de dag ni ma 'khrul pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is non-errone with regard to that is called ‚Äúnon-errone.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid de gnyi ga yang log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de gnyi ga yang log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: Both of these characteristics are for the purpose of eliminating false understanding.

original: rjes su dpag pa bsal ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa bsal ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not for the purpose of eliminating inference.

original: 'di ltar rtog pa dang bral ba smos pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa bsal ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog pa dang bral ba smos pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa bsal ba yin mod kyi /
translated: In this way, the mere mention of ‚Äúfree from conceptuality‚Äù eliminates inference.

original: de la ma 'khrul pa ma smos na ni ljon shing 'gro bar snang ba la sogs pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir mngon sum yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ma 'khrul pa ma smos na ni ljon shing 'gro bar snang ba la sogs pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir mngon sum yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If ‚Äúnon-errone‚Äù is not mentioned, then the appearance of a tree moving, etc., would be direct perception because it is free from conceptuality.

original: de la zhugs pa'i ljon shing tsam dang yang phrad par mi slu ba yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de la zhugs pa'i ljon shing tsam dang yang phrad par mi slu ba yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa yang yin la /
translated: It is also right knowledge because it is undeceiving with regard to the mere tree that is engaged.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir mngon sum yang yin par rtog par 'gyur ba de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir mngon sum yang yin par rtog par 'gyur ba de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: It is also direct perception because it is free from conceptuality.

original: ma 'khrul pa smos te /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa smos te /
translated: In order to eliminate that idea, he says, ‚Äúnon-erroneous.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar de ni 'khrul pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'khrul pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin la /
translated: In that case, it is not direct perception because it is erroneous.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not inference because it is not generated by a sign that has the three modes.

original: tshad ma gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no other valid cognition.

original: de bas na ljon shing 'gro bar mthong ba la sogs pa ni log pa'i shes pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na ljon shing 'gro bar mthong ba la sogs pa ni log pa'i shes pa yin par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, seeing a tree move and so on are taught to be wrong consciousnesses.

original: ci ste log pa'i shes pa yin na de la ji ltar shing dang phrad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste log pa'i shes pa yin na de la ji ltar shing dang phrad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if they are wrong consciousnesses, how can they encounter a tree?

original: de las shing dang phrad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las shing dang phrad pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not encounter a tree.

original: des ni yul sna tshogs su 'gro ba'i shing yongs su bcad pa yin la /
analyzed: des ni yul sna tshogs su 'gro ba'i shing yongs su bcad pa yin la /
translated: They eliminate a tree that moves in various places.

original: phrad pa'i shing ni yul gcig na nges pa yin no //
analyzed: phrad pa'i shing ni yul gcig na nges pa yin no //
translated: The tree that is encountered is determined to be in one place.

original: de bas na ljon shing gi yul 'gro @41a * //üîΩbar snang ba gang yin pa yul de dang ni ma phrad pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na ljon shing gi yul 'gro @41a * // bar snang ba gang yin pa yul de dang ni ma phrad pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the place of the tree is not seen.

original: yul gang dang phrad pa de ni ma mthong bas /
analyzed: yul gang dang phrad pa de ni ma mthong bas /
translated: The place that is encountered is not seen.

original: de las don gang yang phrad pa med kyi /
analyzed: de las don gang yang phrad pa med kyi /
translated: Therefore, there is no encounter with any object.

original: shes pa gzhan zhig kho na las shing la sogs ba'i don dang phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan zhig kho na las shing la sogs ba'i don dang phrad pa yin no //
translated: Rather, the object, such as a tree, is encountered by another cognition.

original: de ltar nam 'khrul ba smos pa ni log par rtogs pa gsal ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: de ltar nam 'khrul ba smos pa ni log par rtogs pa gsal ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: Thus, the mention of error is for the sake of clarifying false cognition.

original: de bzhin du ma 'khrul pa smos pas kyang rjes su dpag pa gsal ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'khrul pa smos pas kyang rjes su dpag pa gsal ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Similarly, the mention of non-error clarifies inference.

original: rtogs pa dang bral ba smos pa ni log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang bral ba smos pa ni log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro /
translated: However, the mention of freedom from conceptualization is for the sake of excluding false conceptualization.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: Inference is erroneous,

original: rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du mngon par zhen par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du mngon par zhen par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it engages in conceiving a meaning that is a non-existent appearance as a meaning.

original: mngon sum ni gzung ba'i yul la phyin ci ma log pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni gzung ba'i yul la phyin ci ma log pa yin no //
translated: Direct perception is non-erroneous with regard to the object that is grasped.

original: ma 'khrul pa ni 'dir mi slu ba yin par gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa ni 'dir mi slu ba yin par gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: Non-erroneous should not be taken here as non-deceptive.

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa'i shes pa kho na mngon sum yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa'i shes pa kho na mngon sum yin gyi /
translated: For, only correct knowledge is direct perception,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: not anything else.

original: de la yang dag pa'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir mi slu ba yin par grub zin pa la yang mi slu ba smos pa ni dgos pa med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir mi slu ba yin par grub zin pa la yang mi slu ba smos pa ni dgos pa med pa kho na yin no //
translated: And, since it is correct knowledge, it is established as non-deceptive. Therefore, there is no need to mention non-deceptive again.

original: de ltar na dag gi don ni mi slu ba'i shes pa mngon sum zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni rtog pa dang bral zhing mi slu ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na dag gi don ni mi slu ba'i shes pa mngon sum zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni rtog pa dang bral zhing mi slu ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the passage is that direct perception is non-deceptive knowledge. It is free from conceptuality and non-deceptive.

original: mi slu ba lan gnyis smos pa 'di la dgos pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: mi slu ba lan gnyis smos pa 'di la dgos pa ci yang med do //
translated: There is no need for mentioning non-deceptive twice.

original: de bas na don byed nus pa'i dngos po gzung bar bya ba la phyin ci ma log pa gang yin pa de ma 'khrul pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na don byed nus pa'i dngos po gzung bar bya ba la phyin ci ma log pa gang yin pa de ma 'khrul pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that which is non-erroneous with regard to the object that is grasped, which is a thing that is able to perform a function, should be understood as non-erroneous.

original: rtog pa yang ci 'dra ba zhig 'dir gzung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa yang ci 'dra ba zhig 'dir gzung bar bya zhe na /
translated: What kind of conception is to be grasped here?

original: brjod pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brjod pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says: ‚Äúand verbalization.‚Äù

original: 'dis rjod par byed pas na brjod pa ste smra bar byed pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: 'dis rjod par byed pas na brjod pa ste smra bar byed pa'i sgra'o //
translated: Since this causes verbalization, it is verbalization. It is the sound that causes speech.

original: brjod pa dang 'dre ba ni rjod par byed pa'i rnam pa dang lhan cig shes pa gcig la gzung ba'i rnam pa nyid du tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'dre ba ni rjod par byed pa'i rnam pa dang lhan cig shes pa gcig la gzung ba'i rnam pa nyid du tshogs pa ste /
translated: The appearance of verbalization is the appearance of the form of the verbalizer, which is grasped in the same cognition as the form of the object of verbalization.

original: de bas na gang gi tshe shes pa gcig la brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i rnam pa gnyis tshogs par yod pa de'i tshe brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa gnyis 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gang gi tshe shes pa gcig la brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i rnam pa gnyis tshogs par yod pa de'i tshe brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa gnyis 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, when the two forms of the object of verbalization and the verbalizer exist together in one cognition, then the object of verbalization and the verbalizer are said to be mixed.

original: mngon par brjod ba dang 'dre bar rung ba'i brjod par bya ba'i snang ba shes pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par brjod ba dang 'dre bar rung ba'i brjod par bya ba'i snang ba shes pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That cognition in which the appearance of the object of verbalization is suitable to be mixed with verbalization is said to be like that.

original: de la shes pa kha cig ni brjod pa dang 'dres par snang ba yin te /
analyzed: de la shes pa kha cig ni brjod pa dang 'dres par snang ba yin te /
translated: In that regard, some cognitions appear to be mixed with verbalization.

original: dper na brda la blo byang ba rnams kyis bum pa'i don la rtog pa na bum pa'i sgra dang 'dres ba'i don snang ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na brda la blo byang ba rnams kyis bum pa'i don la rtog pa na bum pa'i sgra dang 'dres ba'i don snang ba yin no //
translated: For example, when those whose minds are trained in signs think of the meaning of pot, the meaning appears to them mixed with the word pot.

original: kha cig ni mngon par brjod pa dang ma 'dres bar yang mngon par brjod pa dang 'drer rung bar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni mngon par brjod pa dang ma 'dres bar yang mngon par brjod pa dang 'drer rung bar snang ba yin te /
translated: Some, even though not mixed with verbalization, appear as if they could be mixed with verbalization.

original: dper na byis pa brda la blo ma byang ba rnams kyi rtog @41b pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na byis pa brda la blo ma byang ba rnams kyi rtog @41b pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the thought of a child whose mind is not trained in signs.

original: de la rtog pa ni brjod pa dang 'dres pa'o zhes smos na ni brda la blo ma byang ba'i rtog ba bsdus par 'gyur bas rung ba smos pas de yang bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rtog pa ni brjod pa dang 'dres pa'o zhes smos na ni brda la blo ma byang ba'i rtog ba bsdus par 'gyur bas rung ba smos pas de yang bsdus pa yin no //
translated: If it were said that thought is mixed with verbalization, then the thought of one whose mind is not trained in signs would be included. Therefore, it is included by the word ‚Äúsuitable.‚Äù

original: ci ste brjod pa dang 'dres pa snang ba ma yin du zin kyang der skyes ba nyid kyis rtog pa ni brjod ba dang 'drer rung bar snang ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: ci ste brjod pa dang 'dres pa snang ba ma yin du zin kyang der skyes ba nyid kyis rtog pa ni brjod ba dang 'drer rung bar snang ba kho na yin no //
translated: Even if it does not appear as if mixed with verbalization, it is only thought that is suitable to be mixed with verbalization because it arises in that way.

original: brjod pa dang 'dres pa gang yin pa de yang rung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'dres pa gang yin pa de yang rung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: And that which is mixed with verbalization is also called ‚Äúsuitable.‚Äù

original: de bas na gnyi ga yang rung ba smos pas bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gnyi ga yang rung ba smos pas bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the expression ‚Äúeither one or the other‚Äù is inclusive.

original: brjod pa dang 'dres pa med na ji lta rung ba nyid du shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'dres pa med na ji lta rung ba nyid du shes par bya zhe na /
translated: If there is no appearance of the object, how can there be a determination of the appearance?

original: snang ba nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the appearance is not determined.

original: snang ba nges pa med pa yang snang ba nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba nges pa med pa yang snang ba nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And why is the appearance not determined? Because there is no cause for the determination of the appearance.

original: gzung ba'i don gyis rnam par shes pa skyed pa na snang ba nges par skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba'i don gyis rnam par shes pa skyed pa na snang ba nges par skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: When consciousness is produced by the object that is grasped, the appearance is produced as determined.

original: dper na gzugs kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa na snang ba nges pa skyed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa na snang ba nges pa skyed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when visual consciousness is produced by form, the appearance is produced as determined.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa ni don las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa ni don las skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: But the conceptual consciousness is not produced from the object.

original: de bas na snang ba nges pa'i rgyu nges pa med pa'i phyir snang ba nges pa med pa yin no ;
analyzed: de bas na snang ba nges pa'i rgyu nges pa med pa'i phyir snang ba nges pa med pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, because there is no cause for the determination of the appearance, the appearance is not determined.

original: / rnam par rtog pa don las mi skye'o zhes bya ba de yin par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: / rnam par rtog pa don las mi skye'o zhes bya ba de yin par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How do you know that the conceptual consciousness is not produced from the object?

original: don nye ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don nye ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not depend on a nearby object.

original: byis pa rnams kyang ji srid du na ma mthong ba na de nyid 'di yin no zhes sngon mthong ba nyid du mi 'dzin pa de srid du du ba btang nas nu mkhar 'jug par mi byed do //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyang ji srid du na ma mthong ba na de nyid 'di yin no zhes sngon mthong ba nyid du mi 'dzin pa de srid du du ba btang nas nu mkhar 'jug par mi byed do //
translated: As long as the child does not see the breast, it does not grasp the seen object as being the same as the unseen object, and as long as that is so, it will not reach out for the breast.

original: sngon mthong ba dang phyis mthong ba gnyis gcig tu byed pa'i rnam par shes pa ni yul nye ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon mthong ba dang phyis mthong ba gnyis gcig tu byed pa'i rnam par shes pa ni yul nye ba can ma yin te /
translated: The consciousness that unifies the prior seeing and the later seeing is not a consciousness that has a nearby object,

original: sngon mthong ba nye ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: sngon mthong ba nye ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because the prior seeing is not nearby.

original: yul nye ba ma yin pa can ni don la mi ltos la /
