analyzed: yul nye ba ma yin pa can ni don la mi ltos la /
translated: That which does not have a nearby object does not depend on an object.

original: mi ltos na snang ba nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir snang ba nges pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: mi ltos na snang ba nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir snang ba nges pa med pa yin te /
translated: If it does not depend on it, then there is no cause for the ascertainment of the appearance, and therefore there is no ascertainment of the appearance.

original: de 'dra ba ni brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba yin no //
translated: That is what is suitable to be expressed and mixed.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni nye ba tsam 'dzin pa'i phyir don la ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni nye ba tsam 'dzin pa'i phyir don la ltos pa yin la /
translated: Since the sense consciousnesses apprehend merely what is nearby, they depend on the object.

original: don kyang snang ba nges pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir snang ba nges pa yin no //
analyzed: don kyang snang ba nges pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir snang ba nges pa yin no //
translated: And since the object is the cause for the ascertainment of the appearance, there is ascertainment of the appearance.

original: de bas na mngon par brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mngon par brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to be mixed with verbalization.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid smra bar bya ba dang smra bar byed pa'i dngos bor khas blangs kyang de rnam par mi rtog par brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid smra bar bya ba dang smra bar byed pa'i dngos bor khas blangs kyang de rnam par mi rtog par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, even though one accepts that the intrinsic identity is the object of expression and the means of expression, it is said to be non-conceptual.

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid kho na smra bar bya ba dang smra bar byed pa yin pa de lta na yang mngon par brjod pa dang 'dres ba'i don gyi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa yin no //üîΩdbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni don gyi sgo nas snang ba yin ba'i phyir mngon par brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang @42a * //
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid kho na smra bar bya ba dang smra bar byed pa yin pa de lta na yang mngon par brjod pa dang 'dres ba'i don gyi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa yin no // dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni don gyi sgo nas snang ba yin ba'i phyir mngon par brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang @42a * //
translated: Even if the intrinsic identity is the object of expression and the means of expression, the consciousness of the object mixed with verbalization is conceptual.

original: ba ma yin pas rnam par mi rtog ba yin no //
analyzed: ba ma yin pas rnam par mi rtog ba yin no //
translated: The sense consciousnesses are non-conceptual because they do not appear as suitable to be mixed with verbalization, since they appear as objects.

original: 'o na rna ba'i rnam par shes ba ni sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid la 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na rna ba'i rnam par shes ba ni sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid la 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: If the auditory consciousness apprehends the intrinsic identity of sound,

original: sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyang kha cig ni smra bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyang kha cig ni smra bar bya ba yin la /
translated: and the intrinsic identity of sound is something to be expressed,üîΩthen the auditory consciousness would be conceptual.

original: kha cig ni smra bar byed pa yin bas mngon bar brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: kha cig ni smra bar byed pa yin bas mngon bar brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba snang bar 'gyur la /
translated: Some say that since it is the speaker that is the cause, the object that is fit to be expressed appears.

original: de lta na ni rnam bar rtog pa dang ba cas pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni rnam bar rtog pa dang ba cas pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then the conceptual consciousness would be clear.

original: de lta bu'i skyon med de rang gi mtshan nyid smra bar bya ba dang smra bar byed par dngos po yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: de lta bu'i skyon med de rang gi mtshan nyid smra bar bya ba dang smra bar byed par dngos po yod du zin kyang /
translated: There is no such fault, because even though the object and the speaker exist as the things that are the object of expression and the expresser,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid brda'i dus na mthong ba nyid du bzung na smra bar bya ba dang smra bar byed pa yang bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid brda'i dus na mthong ba nyid du bzung na smra bar bya ba dang smra bar byed pa yang bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if the object‚Äôs own character is apprehended as it is seen at the time of the convention, then the object of expression and the expresser are also apprehended.

original: brda'i dus na yod pa'i mthong ba'i yul gyi dngos po nyid ni da ltar yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brda'i dus na yod pa'i mthong ba'i yul gyi dngos po nyid ni da ltar yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The thing that is the object seen at the time of the convention does not exist now.

original: dper na brda'i tshe na yod pa'i mthong ba da ltar 'gags pa de bzhin du de'i yul gyi don yang da ltar med pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na brda'i tshe na yod pa'i mthong ba da ltar 'gags pa de bzhin du de'i yul gyi don yang da ltar med pa yin no //
translated: Just as the seeing that exists at the time of the convention has now ceased, so the object that is its object does not exist now.

original: de bas na rna ba'i rnam par shes pas ston gyi dus na mthong ba nyid mi 'dzin pas na smra bar bya ba dang smra bar byed pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rna ba'i rnam par shes pas ston gyi dus na mthong ba nyid mi 'dzin pas na smra bar bya ba dang smra bar byed pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the auditory consciousness does not apprehend what was seen at the time of the teaching, it does not apprehend the entity of the object of expression and the means of expression.

original: tshul 'dis rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa yang sgra dang don mtha' dag snang ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: tshul 'dis rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa yang sgra dang don mtha' dag snang ba yin mod kyi /
translated: By this method, the consciousness of the yogi does indeed appear as all words and meanings.

original: brda'i dus kyi mthong ba mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: brda'i dus kyi mthong ba mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
translated: However, because it does not apprehend what was seen at the time of the convention, it is nonconceptual.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang ste /
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang ste /
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to conceptuality.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba ste /
translated: The cognition that is free from the nature of conceptuality,

original: stong par gyur cing ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de mngon sum yin no zhes 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: stong par gyur cing ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de mngon sum yin no zhes 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: that is empty, and that is nonerroneous is direct perception.

original: rtog pa dang bral zhing 'khrul ba med pa ni phan tshun ltos pas ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral zhing 'khrul ba med pa ni phan tshun ltos pas ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: Freedom from conceptuality and freedom from error are the characteristics of direct perception because they are mutually dependent.

original: so sor ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa gang yin pa de mngon sum yin no zhes mtshan nyid gnyis phan tshun ltos pa ni mngon sum gyi yul can nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: so sor ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa gang yin pa de mngon sum yin no zhes mtshan nyid gnyis phan tshun ltos pa ni mngon sum gyi yul can nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: In order to show that they are not individual characteristics, he says, ‚ÄúThat which is free from that and is non-erroneous is perception.‚Äù Thus, the two characteristics are mutually dependent, and this is shown to be the object of perception.

original: rab rib ni mig la gnod pa ste /
analyzed: rab rib ni mig la gnod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEye disease‚Äù is an affliction of the eye.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'di ni dbang po la yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'di ni dbang po la yod pa'o //
translated: This cause of error is present in the sense faculty.

original: myur du bskor ba ni mgal me la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: myur du bskor ba ni mgal me la sogs pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúRapidly moving‚Äù refers to a firebrand and so on.

original: mgal me la sogs pa dal bus bskor na 'khor los 'khrul pa mi 'byung bas de'i phyir myur du zhes smos pas 'khrul pa la bye brag tu byas so //
analyzed: mgal me la sogs pa dal bus bskor na 'khor los 'khrul pa mi 'byung bas de'i phyir myur du zhes smos pas 'khrul pa la bye brag tu byas so //
translated: If a firebrand and so on is moved slowly, the error of a circle does not occur. Therefore, by saying ‚Äúrapidly,‚Äù he specifies the error.

original: rgyu de ni yul la yod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu de ni yul la yod pa'o //
translated: This cause is present in the object.

original: grus 'gro ba ni grur zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: grus 'gro ba ni grur zhugs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTraveling by boat‚Äù means boarding a boat.

original: grus 'gro ba ni shing la sogs pa 'gro bar 'khrul pa 'byung bas zhugs pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: grus 'gro ba ni shing la sogs pa 'gro bar 'khrul pa 'byung bas zhugs pa zhes smos so //
translated: Since the error of a tree and so on moving occurs when traveling by boat, he says ‚Äúboarding.‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'di ni phyi rol gyi rten la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'di ni phyi rol gyi rten la gnas pa yin no //
translated: This cause of error is present in the external support.

original: 'khrugs pa ni rlung dang mkhris ba dang bad kan la @42b sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrugs pa ni rlung dang mkhris ba dang bad kan la @42b sogs pa ste /
translated: Disturbance is wind, bile, phlegm, etc.

original: rlung la sogs pas 'khrul par gyur ba na ka ba la sogs pa la 'bar ba 'khrul pa skye'o //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pas 'khrul par gyur ba na ka ba la sogs pa la 'bar ba 'khrul pa skye'o //
translated: When the sense-faculties are disturbed by wind, etc., the error of the appearance of a circle of fire, etc. arises.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'di ni nang la yod pa la //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'di ni nang la yod pa la //
translated: This cause of error is internal.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu dbang po la yod pa dang / yul la yod pa dang / phyi rol gyi rten la yod pa dang / nang la yod pa de thams cad kyis ni dbang po nyis sgyur bar byed de /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu dbang po la yod pa dang / yul la yod pa dang / phyi rol gyi rten la yod pa dang / nang la yod pa de thams cad kyis ni dbang po nyis sgyur bar byed de /
translated: The cause of error is in the sense-faculty, in the object, in the external support, and in the internal. All of these cause the sense-faculty to be disturbed.

original: dbang po ma bsgyur bar dbang po 'khrul par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: dbang po ma bsgyur bar dbang po 'khrul par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because it is not reasonable that the sense-faculty should be in error without being disturbed.

original: 'khrugs pa la mthar thug pa de dag la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa la mthar thug pa de dag la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The final disturbance, etc., are called that.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni ling tog dang / mig ser la sogs ba ni dbang po la gnas pa yin par gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni ling tog dang / mig ser la sogs ba ni dbang po la gnas pa yin par gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes cataracts, jaundice, etc., which are held to be located in the sense-faculty.

original: myur du bskor ba la sogs pa ni yul la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: myur du bskor ba la sogs pa ni yul la gnas pa yin te /
translated: Rapid rotation, etc., are located in the object.

original: mgal me yan man du bskor ba byas na me'i kha dog can gyi 'bigs par snang ba'i 'khrul pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mgal me yan man du bskor ba byas na me'i kha dog can gyi 'bigs par snang ba'i 'khrul pa 'byung ngo //
translated: If a firebrand is whirled around in a circle, the appearance of a fire wheel arises, which is an error.

original: glang po che bzhon ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi rten la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: glang po che bzhon ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi rten la gnas pa yin no //
translated: Riding an elephant, etc., are external supports.

original: gnad mi bzad par bsnun pa la sogs pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu nang gi rten la gnas pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: gnad mi bzad par bsnun pa la sogs pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu nang gi rten la gnas pa gzung ngo //
translated: Being struck by a fatal blow, etc., are internal supports that are the cause of error.

original: de dag gis 'khrul pa gang du yang ma skyes pa'i rnam pa de lta pu'i shes pa de ni mngon sum yin no /
analyzed: de dag gis 'khrul pa gang du yang ma skyes pa'i rnam pa de lta pu'i shes pa de ni mngon sum yin no /
translated: The consciousness that is of that kind, which is not produced by any of those, is direct perception.

original: // / de ltar mtshan nyid bstan nas gang dag dbang po kho na lta ba po yin par rtog pa dang / yid kyi mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid la skyon brjod pa dang / rang rig pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa khas mi len pa de dag gi log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir mngon sum gyi rnam par dbye ba ston pas /
analyzed: // / de ltar mtshan nyid bstan nas gang dag dbang po kho na lta ba po yin par rtog pa dang / yid kyi mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid la skyon brjod pa dang / rang rig pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa khas mi len pa de dag gi log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir mngon sum gyi rnam par dbye ba ston pas /
translated: Having taught the definition in that way, in order to remove the misconceptions of those who think that only the sense faculties are the seer, those who state faults in the definition of mental direct perception, and those who do not accept reflexive awareness and the consciousness of a yogin, the different types of direct perception are taught.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is of four types.

original: dbang po dang 'brel pa'i shes pa ni dbang po'i shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang 'brel pa'i shes pa ni dbang po'i shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cognition that is related to a sense faculty is called a sense cognition.

original: dbang po la brten pa gang yin pa de mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: dbang po la brten pa gang yin pa de mngon sum yin no //
translated: That which is based on a sense faculty is direct perception.

original: yid kyi mngon sum la gzhan dag skyon brjod pa de bsal ba'i phyir yid kyi mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa /
analyzed: yid kyi mngon sum la gzhan dag skyon brjod pa de bsal ba'i phyir yid kyi mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa /
translated: In order to eliminate the faults that others have ascribed to mental direct perception, the defining characteristics of mental direct perception are explained.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa rang bdag nyid kyi yul de'i de ma thag pa ni 'di la bar med pas de ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa rang bdag nyid kyi yul de'i de ma thag pa ni 'di la bar med pas de ma thag pa'o //
translated: The immediately antecedent condition of a sense consciousness that is its own object is called immediately antecedent because there is no interval between them.

original: bar yang bar chad dang khyad par la brjod de /
analyzed: bar yang bar chad dang khyad par la brjod de /
translated: An interval is also said to be an obstruction or a distinction.

original: de bas na bar bkag pas na dbang pa'o rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi nye bar len pa las byung ba rigs 'dra ba'i skad cig ma gnyis par 'byung ba gzung ste /
analyzed: de bas na bar bkag pas na dbang pa'o rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi nye bar len pa las byung ba rigs 'dra ba'i skad cig ma gnyis par 'byung ba gzung ste /
translated: Therefore, by negating an interval, the immediately antecedent condition of a sense consciousness is its own object that arises from the substantial cause of the object of a sense consciousness, and it is grasped as the second moment of a similar type.

original: de lta yin dang rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi skad cig la skad cig ma phyi ma bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi skad cig la skad cig ma phyi ma bzung ba yin no //
translated: In that case, the object of the moment of sense consciousness that is included in the same continuum is the object of the subsequent moment.

original: de ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang lhan cig byed @43a * //
analyzed: de ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang lhan cig byed @43a * //
translated: That is the object of the sense consciousness that is simultaneous with it.

original: pa de dbang po'i rnam par shes pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: pa de dbang po'i rnam par shes pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which exists in the sense consciousness is called the object of the sense consciousness.

original: lhan cig byed pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of simultaneity:

original: phan tshun phan pa byed pa dang / bya ba gcig la byed pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun phan pa byed pa dang / bya ba gcig la byed pa'o //
translated: mutual benefit and the same action.

original: 'dir ni skad cig gi dngos po la khyed par sgrub pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir bya ba gcig la byed pa nyid lhan cig byed par bzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni skad cig gi dngos po la khyed par sgrub pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir bya ba gcig la byed pa nyid lhan cig byed par bzung ste /
translated: Here, since the establishment of difference in the entity of a moment is not tenable, the same action is taken to be simultaneity.

original: yul dang rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig la byed do //
analyzed: yul dang rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig la byed do //
translated: The object and consciousness are the same action in the one mental consciousness.

original: 'di ltar de gnyis ni de la gnyi ga lhan cig byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de gnyis ni de la gnyi ga lhan cig byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: In this way, the two are the same action in the mental consciousness.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa'i skyon byed pa'i tshul gyis kyang rnal 'byor pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyid pa de bsal ba'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen smos so //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa'i skyon byed pa'i tshul gyis kyang rnal 'byor pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyid pa de bsal ba'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen smos so //
translated: This kind of sense consciousness is also a fault of the object. In order to eliminate the sleepiness of the yogin's consciousness, the immediately preceding condition is mentioned.

original: mtshungs pa mi shes pa nyid kyis mtshungs pa yang yin la bar ma chod pas de ma thag pa yang yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa mi shes pa nyid kyis mtshungs pa yang yin la bar ma chod pas de ma thag pa yang yin no //
translated: It is similar because it is not known to be different, and it is immediately preceding because it is uninterrupted.

original: de'ang yin la rgyu nyid kyis na rkyen kyang yin pa'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen te des bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de'ang yin la rgyu nyid kyis na rkyen kyang yin pa'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen te des bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is that, and it is a condition by way of being a cause, so it is the immediately preceding condition, which is what produces it.

original: 'dis ni rgyu gcig tu gtogs pa kho na'i dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos por gyur pa na yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mngon sum nyid du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu gcig tu gtogs pa kho na'i dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos por gyur pa na yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mngon sum nyid du smra ba yin no //
translated: This means that when the sense consciousness and the mental consciousness, which belong to the same cause, are in the state of being produced and producer, the mental consciousness is the direct perceiver.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'i shes ba rgyud gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang ba yang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'i shes ba rgyud gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang ba yang bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the objection that the yogi's consciousness would follow the continuum of another is also refuted.

original: gang gi tshe dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul las yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gzhan yin pa de'i tshe bzung zin pa 'dzin pas tshad mar mi rung ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul las yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gzhan yin pa de'i tshe bzung zin pa 'dzin pas tshad mar mi rung ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba bsal ba yin no //
translated: When the object of the mental consciousness is different from the object of the sense consciousness, the error that it is not a valid cognition because it apprehends what has already been apprehended is refuted.

original: gang gi tshe dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi nye bar len pa las byung ba'i skad cig ma 'dzin pa de'i tshe dbang po'i shes pas gzung ba ma yin pa'i yul gzhan mi 'dzin pa'i phyir long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa med pa'i skyonüîΩdu thal bar 'gyur ba bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi nye bar len pa las byung ba'i skad cig ma 'dzin pa de'i tshe dbang po'i shes pas gzung ba ma yin pa'i yul gzhan mi 'dzin pa'i phyir long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa med pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba bsal ba yin no //
translated: When it apprehends the moment that arises from the appropriation of the object of the sense consciousness, then the error that the blind and the deaf would not exist because it does not apprehend an object that is not apprehended by the sense consciousness is refuted.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yang mig gi bya ba 'das pa'i tshe mngon sum du 'dod do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yang mig gi bya ba 'das pa'i tshe mngon sum du 'dod do //
translated: That mental consciousness is also asserted to be direct perception when the function of the eye has passed.

original: mig byed pa dang ldan pa de'i tshe gzugs shes pa gang yin pa de thams cad mig la brten pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: mig byed pa dang ldan pa de'i tshe gzugs shes pa gang yin pa de thams cad mig la brten pa kho na yin te /
translated: When the eye is functioning, all consciousnesses of visible forms are supported on the eye.

original: de ltar ma yin na ni rnam par shes pa gang yang mig la brten pa mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na ni rnam par shes pa gang yang mig la brten pa mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then it would not be tenable that any consciousness is supported on the eye.

original: yid kyi mngon sum de ni grub pa'am ma grub pa'i mtha' las grags pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi mngon sum de ni grub pa'am ma grub pa'i mtha' las grags pa yin no //
translated: This direct perception of the mental faculty is known in the philosophies of the non-Buddhists and the Buddhists.

original: 'di sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no valid cognition that establishes it.

original: ji ste de lta bu de yod du bcug na yang nyes pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no//
analyzed: ji ste de lta bu de yod du bcug na yang nyes pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no//
translated: If we allow that such a thing exists, then there is no fault at all.

original: @43b rang rig pa bstan pa'i phyir smras ba /
analyzed: @43b rang rig pa bstan pa'i phyir smras ba /
translated: To demonstrate its characteristics, he says:

original: sems ni don tsam 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni don tsam 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The mind apprehends just the object.

original: sems las byung ba bde ba la sogs pa ni bye drag gi gnas skabs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba bde ba la sogs pa ni bye drag gi gnas skabs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Mental factors such as pleasure apprehend the state of the object.

original: thams cad kyang de yin la sems dang sems las byung ba yang yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang de yin la sems dang sems las byung ba yang yin no //
translated: All of them are both mind and mental factors.

original: bde ba la sogs pa 'ba' zhig nyams su myong ba gsal ba yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa yin gyi sems kyi gnas skabs gzhan ni ma yin no snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir thams cad ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa 'ba' zhig nyams su myong ba gsal ba yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa yin gyi sems kyi gnas skabs gzhan ni ma yin no snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir thams cad ces bya ba smos te /
translated: To dispel this doubt, he says: ‚Äúall.‚Äù

original: sems kyi gnas skabs gang dag bdag nyid rig cing mngon sum du ma gyur pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: sems kyi gnas skabs gang dag bdag nyid rig cing mngon sum du ma gyur pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no state of the mind whatsoever that is not self-aware and manifest.

original: ngo bo gang gis bdag nyid rig pa'i ngo bo de ni bdag nyid rig pa'i mngon sum mo //
analyzed: ngo bo gang gis bdag nyid rig pa'i ngo bo de ni bdag nyid rig pa'i mngon sum mo //
translated: The nature by which it is self-aware is the self-awareness that is direct perception.

original: 'dir gzugs la sogs ba snang ba na dus gcig tu nang gi bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni myong ba yin no //üîΩgzung bar bya ba'i rnam pa sngon po la sogs pa nyid sim pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du myong ba yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs la sogs ba snang ba na dus gcig tu nang gi bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni myong ba yin no // gzung bar bya ba'i rnam pa sngon po la sogs pa nyid sim pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du myong ba yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: Here, when form, etc. appear, the internal aspects of pleasure, etc. are experienced simultaneously.üîΩOne cannot say that the aspects of the object, such as blue, etc. are experienced as having the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor myong ba ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po la sogs pa sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor myong ba ni nges pa med do //
translated: Because there is no certainty that blue, etc. are experienced as having the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: gal te 'di ni sim pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni sngon po la sogs pa 'di bde ba'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba nges par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: gal te 'di ni sim pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni sngon po la sogs pa 'di bde ba'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba nges par 'gyur ro /
translated: If it is the nature of pleasure, then it is certain that this blue, etc. is the nature of pleasure.

original: rang bzhin gang la rnam par rtog pas mngon sum gyi byed pa don mngon sum du byed pa nyid rjes su rtogs pa de ni mngon sum yin na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang la rnam par rtog pas mngon sum gyi byed pa don mngon sum du byed pa nyid rjes su rtogs pa de ni mngon sum yin na /
translated: If the nature of something is understood by the activity of direct perception, then that is direct perception.

original: sngon po la ni bde ba'i rang bzhin rjes su rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: sngon po la ni bde ba'i rang bzhin rjes su rtogs pa med do //
translated: But there is no understanding of the nature of pleasure in blue.

original: de bas na sngon po myong ba'i tshe bde ba ma yin ba'i sngon po'i don las gzhan kho na'i bde ba myong ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sngon po myong ba'i tshe bde ba ma yin ba'i sngon po'i don las gzhan kho na'i bde ba myong ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, when blue is experienced, pleasure is experienced as something different from the object of blue, which is not pleasure.

original: de yang shes pa nyid yin pa de bas na shes pa nyams su myong ba ni yod do //
analyzed: de yang shes pa nyid yin pa de bas na shes pa nyams su myong ba ni yod do //
translated: And that is consciousness itself. Therefore, the experience of consciousness exists.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo rig pa de yang bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du byed cing rnam par mi rtog pa dang / ma 'khrul ba yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo rig pa de yang bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du byed cing rnam par mi rtog pa dang / ma 'khrul ba yin te /
translated: That awareness which is the nature of consciousness is itself direct perception, because it is non-conceptual and non-erroneous.

original: de bas na mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is direct perception.

original: rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum bshad pa'i phyir smras par dang yang dag ba'i don ni bden pa la / bde pa yang tshad mas mthong ba'i don te /üîΩji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi lta bu'o //üîΩyang dag pa'i don bsgom pa ni yang nas yang du sems la bslan pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum bshad pa'i phyir smras par dang yang dag ba'i don ni bden pa la / bde pa yang tshad mas mthong ba'i don te / ji ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi lta bu'o // yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa ni yang nas yang du sems la bslan pa'o //
translated: In order to explain the direct perception of the yogi, he says: ‚Äúthe meaning of reality is the truth, and the meaning of happiness is the object seen by valid knowledge.‚ÄùüîΩFor example, the four noble truths.üîΩThe meditation on the meaning of reality is repeatedly bringing it to mind.üîΩ

original: sgom pa'i rab ni bsgom par bya ba'i don snang ba'i shes pa gsal bar snang ba rtsom pa'o //üîΩrab kyi mtha' ni gang gi tshe gsal ba'i snang ba cung zad ma rdzogs ba yin te /üîΩ'di ltar ji srid du gsal bar snang ba nyid ma rdzogs bar de srid @44a * //üîΩdu de khyad par du 'gro ba yin pa gang gi tshe rdzogs pa de'i tshe ni khyad par du 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: sgom pa'i rab ni bsgom par bya ba'i don snang ba'i shes pa gsal bar snang ba rtsom pa'o //üîΩrab kyi mtha' ni gang gi tshe gsal ba'i snang ba cung zad ma rdzogs ba yin te /üîΩ'di ltar ji srid du gsal bar snang ba nyid ma rdzogs bar de srid @44a * //üîΩdu de khyad par du 'gro ba yin pa gang gi tshe rdzogs pa de'i tshe ni khyad par du 'gro ba med do //
translated: In order to explain the direct perception of the yogi, he says: ‚Äúthe object of correct seeing is the truth, and the object of correct seeing is the truth, and the object of correct
