original: mthun pa'i phyogs ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúthe similar class.‚Äù

original: mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: That which is not the similar class is the dissimilar class.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the dissimilar class?

original: mthun pa'i phyogs de las gzhan pa dang / de dang 'gal ba dang / mthun pa'i phyogs de med pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs de las gzhan pa dang / de dang 'gal ba dang / mthun pa'i phyogs de med pa'o //
translated: It is other than the similar class, it is contradictory with it, and it is the absence of the similar class.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la gzhan pa dang / de dang 'gal ba ni rje srid du phyogs kyi rang gi ngo bo med pa'i ni ming shes pa de srid du khong du chud par mi nus so //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la gzhan pa dang / de dang 'gal ba ni rje srid du phyogs kyi rang gi ngo bo med pa'i ni ming shes pa de srid du khong du chud par mi nus so //
translated: As long as one does not know the nature of the similar class, one cannot understand the nature of the dissimilar class, because the dissimilar class is other than the similar class and contradictory with it.

original: de bas na gzhan nyid dang 'gal ba nyid du rtog pa'i shugs kyis na gzhan pa dang 'gal ba gnyis ni mthun phyogs med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs so //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan nyid dang 'gal ba nyid du rtog pa'i shugs kyis na gzhan pa dang 'gal ba gnyis ni mthun phyogs med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, by the force of the conception of otherness and contradiction, one understands the two, otherness and contradiction, as the nature of the absence of the similar class.

original: de bas na med pa'i dngos po mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i ngo @49b por rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na med pa'i dngos po mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i ngo @49b por rtogs pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the non-observation of a concordant factor is the realization of the nature of non-existence.

original: gzhan pa dang 'gal ba gnyis ni shus kyis na med pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa yin no /
analyzed: gzhan pa dang 'gal ba gnyis ni shus kyis na med pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa yin no /
translated: The other two, the observation of a contradictory factor and the observation of a pervader of the non-existence, are the realization of the nature of non-existence by implication.üîΩTherefore, all three are discordant factors.

original: de bas na gsum char yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no / tshul gsum po yang rtags gsum 'o na dang ste zhes bya ba ni bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de bas na gsum char yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no / tshul gsum po yang rtags gsum 'o na dang ste zhes bya ba ni bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The three modes are the three reasons, as explained before.

original: yang gi sgras ni brjod par bya ba gzhan pa sdud pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni brjod par bya ba gzhan pa sdud pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The word also includes other topics to be discussed.üîΩThe other two are the non-observation of a pervader and the non-observation of a nature.

original: gzhan gyi sngar tshul gsum dang tshul gsum pa'i rtags des pa yin no / tshul gsum nyid ni bshad zin pas tshul gsum pa'i mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sngar tshul gsum dang tshul gsum pa'i rtags des pa yin no / tshul gsum nyid ni bshad zin pas tshul gsum pa'i mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Since the three modes have already been explained, the non-observation of the three modes is the non-observation of the three modes.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyang gsum kho na yin te /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyang gsum kho na yin te /
translated: The reason of the three modes is also only three.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags ni rnam pa gsum yin no zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags ni rnam pa gsum yin no zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning is that the reason of the three modes is of three types.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na smras pa //
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na smras pa //
translated: What are they? It is said:

original: dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba las tshul gsum pa'i mi dmigs pa dang / yod pa bsgrub par bya ba las tshul gsum pa'i rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba las tshul gsum pa'i mi dmigs pa dang / yod pa bsgrub par bya ba las tshul gsum pa'i rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: In the case of a negation to be established, the non-apprehension of the triply characterized [object]; in the case of an existent to be established, the nature and the effect of the triply characterized [object].

original: de la mi dmigs pa brjod pa'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa brjod pa'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to explain non-apprehension, he says, for example, etc.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: For example means in order to illustrate.

original: ji ltar mi dmigs pa 'di ji lta ba de bzhin du gzhan yang yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mi dmigs pa 'di ji lta ba de bzhin du gzhan yang yin gyi /
translated: Just as this non-apprehension is so, so is the other.

original: 'di'i 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: 'di'i 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The meaning is that it is not only this one.

original: phyogs ni phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: phyogs ni phyogs gcig go //
translated: A part is a portion.

original: bye brag tu gyur pa ni bye brags ste rtogs pa po'i mngon sum la bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu gyur pa ni bye brags ste rtogs pa po'i mngon sum la bya'o //
translated: A particular is a distinction, which is to be taken as the direct perception of the one who understands.

original: de lta bu yang thams cad ma yin pa de'i phyir 'ga' zhig na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta bu yang thams cad ma yin pa de'i phyir 'ga' zhig na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since that is not the case for all, he says, in some place.

original: rtogs par byed pa'i mngon sum gyi phyogs 'ga' zhig na zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa'i mngon sum gyi phyogs 'ga' zhig na zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: In some place of the direct perception that brings about understanding is the subject.

original: bum pa med de zhes bya ba ni bsgrubs par bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa med de zhes bya ba ni bsgrubs par bya'o //
translated: The pot does not exist is what is to be established.

original: dmigs pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: The object is consciousness.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni skyed par byed pa tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni skyed par byed pa tshogs pa yin te /
translated: The definition of that is the assemblage of causes that generate it.

original: 'on te gang gi phyir deng dmigs pa mtshon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te gang gi phyir deng dmigs pa mtshon par byed pa'o //
translated: Or, because it is the cause of the appearance of the object,

original: der 'gyur ba'i don ni skyed pa nyid du chogs par 'dus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: der 'gyur ba'i don ni skyed pa nyid du chogs par 'dus pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is the object. The meaning of ‚Äúthat‚Äù is the assemblage of causes that generate it.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The definition of the object is that which appears.

original: mi dmigs pa de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The reason is ‚Äúbecause of the non-apprehension of that.‚Äù

original: 'on te gang zhig gang la med pa de ji ltar der snang zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang zhig gang la med pa de ji ltar der snang zhe na /
translated: But if something does not exist, how can it appear?

original: snang ba nyid sgro btags pa'i phyir med du zin kyang der snad ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: snang ba nyid sgro btags pa'i phyir med du zin kyang der snad ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Even though it does not exist, it is said to appear because of the superimposition of the appearance itself.üîΩIf it existed here, it would be seen.

original: gal te 'di na yod na ni lta ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar brtag tu rung ba gang yin pa de ni der med kyang snang @50a * //üîΩbar sgro gdags par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'di na yod na ni lta ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar brtag tu rung ba gang yin pa de ni der med kyang snang @50a * // bar sgro gdags par bya ba yin no //
translated: That which is suitable to be imagined is superimposed as appearing there, even though it does not exist there.

original: de ltar brtag tu rung ba yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar brtag tu rung ba yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is suitable to be imagined?

original: gang gi rang la dmigs pa mthong ba'i rgyu tshogs par gyur pa'i //
analyzed: gang gi rang la dmigs pa mthong ba'i rgyu tshogs par gyur pa'i //
translated: When the cause for seeing the object that is focused on is complete,

original: gang gi tshe tshogs par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshogs par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: when should it be known that the cause is complete?

original: gang gi tshe shes pa gcig la 'dres ba'i dngos po gzhan dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes pa gcig la 'dres ba'i dngos po gzhan dmigs pa ste /
translated: When one consciousness focuses on a thing that is mixed with another.

original: dbang po gcig gi shes pa gzung bar bya ba mig la sogs pa 'dod pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i dngos po gnyis gcig la gcig ltos pa na shes pa gcig la 'dre ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po gcig gi shes pa gzung bar bya ba mig la sogs pa 'dod pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i dngos po gnyis gcig la gcig ltos pa na shes pa gcig la 'dre ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When the object of one sense consciousness, such as the eye, is two things that are present and mutually dependent, it is said that they are mixed in one consciousness.

original: de gnyis yod pa na gcig nges par gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis yod pa na gcig nges par gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: When those two exist, it is not that one is ascertained and the other is not.

original: rtogs par byar rung ba gnyi ga yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par byar rung ba gnyi ga yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because both are equally suitable to be cognized and there is no difference between them.üîΩTherefore, when one of the two things that are mixed in one consciousness appears, if the other thing that is part of the complete cause for seeing it exists, it should be seen.

original: de bas na shes pa gcig la 'dre ba cig shos snang ba na mthong ba'i tshogs pa tshad ma cig shos kyang gal te yod na ni mthong ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes brtag par bya ba ni snang bar sgro btags pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na shes pa gcig la 'dre ba cig shos snang ba na mthong ba'i tshogs pa tshad ma cig shos kyang gal te yod na ni mthong ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes brtag par bya ba ni snang bar sgro btags pa yin la /
translated: This is the imputation of appearance.

original: de mi dmigs pa ni nang ba mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa ni nang ba mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension of that is the non-apprehension of the internal.

original: de bas na bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs de nyid dang / de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ni snang ba mi dmigs par nges pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs de nyid dang / de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ni snang ba mi dmigs par nges pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that very place which is devoid of a pot and the cognition which has that as its object are ascertained as the non-apprehension of the appearance, because they are the cause of the ascertainment of the non-apprehension of the appearance.

original: di tsam du shes pa gcig le 'dre ba'i dngos po nges par ma gyur pa de srid du snang ba mi dmigs par nges pa med do //
analyzed: di tsam du shes pa gcig le 'dre ba'i dngos po nges par ma gyur pa de srid du snang ba mi dmigs par nges pa med do //
translated: As long as there is no ascertainment of the single cognition of the mere thing that is mixed in, for that long there is no ascertainment of the non-apprehension of the appearance.

original: de bas na dngos po dang shes pa la yang mi dmigs pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po dang shes pa la yang mi dmigs pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that there is non-apprehension even in regard to the thing and the cognition.

original: mthong ba log pa tsam ni rna gnyid ma nges pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba log pa tsam ni rna gnyid ma nges pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The mere cessation of the appearance is not the cause of ascertainment, because it is not ascertained as the mere cessation of sleep.

original: de bas na snang ba ni bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs dang de'i shes pa tshig gi shugs nyid kyis snang ba mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin par smra bar lta'o //
analyzed: de bas na snang ba ni bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs dang de'i shes pa tshig gi shugs nyid kyis snang ba mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin par smra bar lta'o //
translated: Therefore, it is seen that the appearance is the nature of the non-apprehension of the appearance, by the force of the words themselves, in the place devoid of a pot and in the cognition of that.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of the object of apprehension?

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which has the nature of the object‚Äôs mark‚Äù means

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni bum pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni bum pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: that the object‚Äôs mark is the nature of the object.

original: shes pa'i rkyen gzhan tshar bar gyur pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes pa'i rkyen gzhan tshar bar gyur pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe other conditions of consciousness are present‚Äù means

original: bum pa yang shes pa skyed par byed pa yin la /üîΩmig la sogs pa gzhan yang yin te /
analyzed: bum pa yang shes pa skyed par byed pa yin la / mig la sogs pa gzhan yang yin te /
translated: that the pot is the cause of the arising of consciousness,üîΩand that the other conditions, such as the eye, are also present.

original: snang ba'i bum pa las gzhan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni rkyen gzhan yin la /
analyzed: snang ba'i bum pa las gzhan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni rkyen gzhan yin la /
translated: The other causes of the appearance of the pot are the other conditions.

original: de dag tshogs pa ni 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de dag tshogs pa ni 'dus pa'o //
translated: The collection of these is their assembly.

original: rang bzhin nyid de gzhan pa las khyad par du gyur pa yin @50b pas khyad par can de khyad par dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid de gzhan pa las khyad par du gyur pa yin @50b pas khyad par can de khyad par dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The pot‚Äôs own nature is distinguished from the other conditions, and so it is a distinguished thing. The phrase ‚Äúthe distinguished thing possesses a distinction‚Äù means that the pot possesses its own nature.

original: des na bum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin khyad par can 'di dang / rkyen gzhan tshogs pa 'dis gnyis ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na bum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin khyad par can 'di dang / rkyen gzhan tshogs pa 'dis gnyis ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this distinguished nature of the pot, and the assembly of the other conditions, should be seen as the object‚Äôs mark.

original: rang bzhin byed par can cig 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: rang bzhin byed par can cig 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: If you say that the nature of the object is the same,

original: rang bzhin gang yod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te dmigs pa'i rkyen snang du rung ba'i bum pa las gzhan de dag de bdog na rang bzhin gang yin pa mngon sum kho nar 'gyur ba de ni rang bzhin khyad par can yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te dmigs pa'i rkyen snang du rung ba'i bum pa las gzhan de dag de bdog na rang bzhin gang yin pa mngon sum kho nar 'gyur ba de ni rang bzhin khyad par can yin no //
translated: then the verse states, ‚ÄúIf the nature of the object exists . . . ‚Äù If the object that is the condition for the object of knowledge exists, then the nature of the object would be directly perceived.

original: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid 'di ni rtogs par byed pa gcig la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid 'di ni rtogs par byed pa gcig la ltos pa yin no //
translated: The definition of direct perception depends on a single cognition.

original: de lta yin dang lta ba po gcig lta ba la zhugs pa snang na ni gnyi ga dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang lta ba po gcig lta ba la zhugs pa snang na ni gnyi ga dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then when a single observer engages in seeing, both are present.

original: mi snang ba yin na ni yul dang dus dang por ngo bo nyid kyi bskal bas rang bzhin khyad par can dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: mi snang ba yin na ni yul dang dus dang por ngo bo nyid kyi bskal bas rang bzhin khyad par can dang bral ba yin la /
translated: If they are not present, then the nature of the object is separated from the nature of the object by the separation of place, time, and essence.

original: rkyen gzhan ni tshogs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan ni tshogs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The other conditions are present.

original: rkyen gang gis lta ba po des mthong bar 'gyur ba de nye bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rkyen gang gis lta ba po des mthong bar 'gyur ba de nye bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The condition by which the observer sees is present.

original: de lta bas na de gang lta ba'i don du 'jug pa de dag nye ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de gang lta ba'i don du 'jug pa de dag nye ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, those that are proximate are the ones that engage in seeing.

original: lta bar ma zhugs pa na rung ba'i yul na 'dug kyang blta bar bya mi nus pa ni rkyen gzhan dang 'bral ba can yin la /
analyzed: lta bar ma zhugs pa na rung ba'i yul na 'dug kyang blta bar bya mi nus pa ni rkyen gzhan dang 'bral ba can yin la /
translated: When not engaged in seeing, even if one is in a suitable place, one is unable to see due to being devoid of other conditions.

original: rang bzhin khyad par can dang ni ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin khyad par can dang ni ldan pa yin no //
translated: And one possesses a special nature.

original: yul dang dus ring po dang 'dug pa ni gnyi ga dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: yul dang dus ring po dang 'dug pa ni gnyi ga dang bral ba yin no //
translated: When far away in terms of place and time, one is devoid of both.

original: de lta na 'ga' zhig mthong na ni rkyen gzhan dang bral ba zhes bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta na 'ga' zhig mthong na ni rkyen gzhan dang bral ba zhes bya ba ma yin la /
translated: Thus, if one sees something, it is not said to be devoid of other conditions.

original: rang bzhin khyad par can dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin khyad par can dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: It is similar to possessing a special nature.

original: ma mthong ba ni mthong bar nus pa'i yul la gnas pa rkyen gzhan dang bral ba yin la ;
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni mthong bar nus pa'i yul la gnas pa rkyen gzhan dang bral ba yin la ;
translated: When not seeing, one is in a place where one is able to see, but is devoid of other conditions.

original: gzhan ni gnyi ga dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni gnyi ga dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The other is said to be devoid of both.

original: mi dmigs pa'i dpe bkod nas /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i dpe bkod nas /
translated: Having presented the example of non-apprehension,

original: rang bzhin gyi dpe dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dpe dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to present the example of nature,

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says ‚Äúnature‚Äù and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúreason of essence‚Äù is supplied.üîΩWhat kind of reason is the nature of the probandum?

original: gtan tshigs ci 'dra ba zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin zhe na rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ci 'dra ba zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin zhe na rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe nature of the probandum‚Äù is supplied.

original: bdag nyid yod pa de 'ba' zhig ni rang yod pa tsam mo //üîΩde yod pa na yod par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo yin pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid yod pa de 'ba' zhig ni rang yod pa tsam mo // de yod pa na yod par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo yin pa ste /
translated: The nature of the probandum is the mere existence of the probandum itself.üîΩThe nature of the probandum is the existence of the probandum when the reason exists.

original: gang zhig gtan tshigs bdag nyid yod pa la ltos te yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig gtan tshigs bdag nyid yod pa la ltos te yod pa yin gyi /
translated: The reason is the existence of the probandum when the reason exists,

original: gtan tshigs yod pas khas rgyu gzhan 'ga' zhig la ltos pa ni ma @51a * //üîΩyin pa de ni rang yod pa tsam na yod pa bsgrub bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs yod pas khas rgyu gzhan 'ga' zhig la ltos pa ni ma @51a * // yin pa de ni rang yod pa tsam na yod pa bsgrub bar bya ba yin te /
translated: but it is not the existence of the probandum when some other cause exists.üîΩThe probandum is the mere existence of the probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba de'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba de'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba de'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba de'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
translated: The reason is the nature of the probandum.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not something else.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni dpe 'god pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni dpe 'god pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfor example‚Äù introduces the example.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis is‚Äù refers to the subject.

original: shing ngo zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: shing ngo zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTree‚Äù is the probandum.

original: shing sha ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //üîΩde'i don ni 'di shing gi tha snyad du byar rung ba yin te /
analyzed: shing sha ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so // de'i don ni 'di shing gi tha snyad du byar rung ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ‚Äù is the reason.üîΩThe meaning of that is: ‚ÄúThis is suitable to be called a tree because it is a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ.‚Äù

original: shing sha ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //üîΩde la shing sha pa mang du yod pa'i yul na gang gi tshe shing sha pa'i tha snyad mi shes pa'i glen pa zhig la kha cig gis shing sha pa ring po zhig bstan te /
analyzed: shing sha ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no // de la shing sha pa mang du yod pa'i yul na gang gi tshe shing sha pa'i tha snyad mi shes pa'i glen pa zhig la kha cig gis shing sha pa ring po zhig bstan te /
translated: That is the meaning of the reason.üîΩIn a place where there are many ≈õim≈õapƒÅ trees, when a fool who does not know the convention of the term ≈õim≈õapƒÅ is shown a tall ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree by someone and told ‚ÄúThis is a tree,‚Äù at that time, the fool realizes that the tallness of the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree is not the reason for the convention of the term ≈õim≈õapƒÅ.

original: 'di shing yin no zhes brjod pa de'i tshe glen pa de ni shing sha pa ring po nyid shing sha pa tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ma yin par rtogs pa de'i tshe shing sha pa thung ngu gang yin pa mthong ba ni 'di shing ma yin no zhes
analyzed: 'di shing yin no zhes brjod pa de'i tshe glen pa de ni shing sha pa ring po nyid shing sha pa tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ma yin par rtogs pa de'i tshe shing sha pa thung ngu gang yin pa mthong ba ni 'di shing ma yin no zhes
translated: When he sees a short ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree, he thinks, ‚ÄúThis is not a tree.‚Äù

original: rtogs so // glen pa de shing sha pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis shing nyid kyi tha snyad la gzhug bar byed pa ring po la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan gyis 'dir shing gi tha snyad byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rtogs so // glen pa de shing sha pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis shing nyid kyi tha snyad la gzhug bar byed pa ring po la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan gyis 'dir shing gi tha snyad byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The fool is made to accept the term ‚Äútree‚Äù on the basis of the mere fact that it is a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ, but the term ‚Äútree‚Äù is not used here on the basis of some other fact, such as its being long.

original: 'on kyang shing sha pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang shing sha pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis yin te /
translated: However, it is on the basis of the mere fact that it is a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ.

original: shing sha par gtogs pa'i yal ga dang ldan pa rgyu mtshan gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shing sha par gtogs pa'i yal ga dang ldan pa rgyu mtshan gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is on the basis of some other fact, namely, that it possesses branches that belong to a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ.

original: 'bras bu'i dpe dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dpe dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to set forth the example of the effect, he says:

original: me yod ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: me yod ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äúwhere there is smoke, there is fire,‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: which is the probandum.

original: de na zhes bya ba ni chos can ni //
analyzed: de na zhes bya ba ni chos can ni //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù refers to the subject.

original: du ba yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: du ba yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is smoke‚Äù is the reason.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni 'jig rten na mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du grags pas rang bzhin ltar 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni ma bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni 'jig rten na mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du grags pas rang bzhin ltar 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni ma bstan to //
translated: Since the relation of cause and effect is known in the world to be characterized by perception and non-perception, the characteristic of the effect is not taught, as is the case with the essential property.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags yin pa'i phyir rtags gcig kho nar ma yin nam /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags yin pa'i phyir rtags gcig kho nar ma yin nam /
translated: Aren‚Äôt there only one type of reason, since it is a reason that has the three modes?

original: 'on te rnam pa tha dad par byed na ni /
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa tha dad par byed na ni /
translated: But if you make a distinction in terms of the aspect,

original: de lta na ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni /
translated: thenüîΩsince the classification of the one type of natural reason is limitless, it is not reasonable to have only three.

original: rang bzhin gyis rtags gcig bu'i rab tu dbye ba yang mtha' yas pa'i phyir gsum nyid du mi rigs so zhe na 'di la gnyis ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rtags gcig bu'i rab tu dbye ba yang mtha' yas pa'i phyir gsum nyid du mi rigs so zhe na 'di la gnyis ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúHere, two . . . ‚Äù

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs gsum po de rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs gsum po de rnams la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to those three reasons.

original: gtan tshigs gnyis ni dngos po bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyis ni dngos po bsgrub pa ste /
translated: Two reasons are reasons that prove a positive object,

original: yod pa sgrub cing go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa sgrub cing go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: because they prove and make known an existent.

original: gcig ni dgag pa go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gcig ni dgag pa go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: One is a reason that makes known a negation.

original: dgag pa zhes bya ba ni med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad du bsgrub @51b par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dgag pa zhes bya ba ni med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad du bsgrub @51b par blta bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNegation‚Äù should be viewed as proving nonexistence and the term nonexistence.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is this.

original: gtan tshigs ni bsgrub par bya ba bsgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i yan lag yin la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni bsgrub par bya ba bsgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i yan lag yin la /
translated: Because a reason proves a probandum, it is a part of the probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni gtso bo yin no //
translated: The probandum is the principal.

original: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba la mkho ba'i gtan tshigs ni gtso bo bsgrub par bya ba tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad par dbye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba la mkho ba'i gtan tshigs ni gtso bo bsgrub par bya ba tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad par dbye ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the reason that is required for the probandum is divided into different types because the principal probandum is different,

original: rang gi ngo bo las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not because of its own nature.

original: bsgrub par bya ba yang kha cig ni gtan tshigs las tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yang kha cig ni gtan tshigs las tha dad pa yin la /
translated: Also, some probandums are different from the reason,

original: kha cig ni tha dad pa tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni tha dad pa tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: but some are not different from it.

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa yang gcig gis spangs te gnas pas gtan tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa yang gcig gis spangs te gnas pas gtan tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Since difference and non-difference are mutually exclusive, they are definitely different.

original: yod pa yang kha cig ni gtan tshigs las tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: yod pa yang kha cig ni gtan tshigs las tha dad pa yin la /
translated: Also, some existences are different from the reason,

original: kha cig ni tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: but some are not different.

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa yang gcig gis gcig spangs te gnas pas gtan tshigs tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa yang gcig gis gcig spangs te gnas pas gtan tshigs tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Since difference and non-difference are mutually exclusive, they are definitely different.

original: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba phan tshun mi mthun pa'i phyir gtan tshigs dag kyang tha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba phan tshun mi mthun pa'i phyir gtan tshigs dag kyang tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, because the objects of affirmation are mutually incompatible, the reasons are also different.

original: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not different by virtue of their own natures.

original: ci'i phyir gsum ni gtan tshigs nyid yin la /üîΩci'i phyir gzhan ni gtan tshigs nyid ma yin snyam du dogs pa la /üîΩji ltar gsum ni gtan tshigs nyid yin la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gsum ni gtan tshigs nyid yin la / ci'i phyir gzhan ni gtan tshigs nyid ma yin snyam du dogs pa la / ji ltar gsum ni gtan tshigs nyid yin la /
translated: Why are the three reasons, but not others, reasons?üîΩFearing that this might be thought,

original: gzhan ni gtan tshigs nyid ma yin pa de gnyi ga yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan ni gtan tshigs nyid ma yin pa de gnyi ga yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate both why the three are reasons and why others are not reasons,

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa zhes smos te /üîΩrang bzhin 'bral pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa zhes smos te / rang bzhin 'bral pa yin te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe relation of nature,‚ÄùüîΩand so on.üîΩThe relation of nature is the relation of nature.üîΩThe relation of nature is the relation of nature.üîΩThe relation of nature is the relation of nature.üîΩThe relation of nature is the relation of nature.
