original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: sbyor ba de dag dngos su snang ba mi dmigs par rjod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sbyor ba de dag dngos su snang ba mi dmigs par rjod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The above syllogisms do not express the non-apprehension of the actual appearance of the reason and the predicate.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa la mi 'khrul pa nyid kyi don gzhan yod pa dag dgag pa rjod par byed do //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa la mi 'khrul pa nyid kyi don gzhan yod pa dag dgag pa rjod par byed do //
translated: They express the negation of the existence of something else, namely, the non-erroneous nature of the appearance of the non-apprehension of the reason.

original: de ltar zo chun brgyud pa'i tshul gyis 'di dag rang bzhin mi dmigs par 'dus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar zo chun brgyud pa'i tshul gyis 'di dag rang bzhin mi dmigs par 'dus pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, these syllogisms are collections of non-apprehension of intrinsic nature in the manner of a waterwheel.

original: dngos su ni ma yin no //üîΩci ste sbyor ba tha dad pa'i phyir de ltar tha dad na ni de dag gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin par brjod par bya ba'i sbyor ba tha dad pa ni sgra tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: dngos su ni ma yin no // ci ste sbyor ba tha dad pa'i phyir de ltar tha dad na ni de dag gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin par brjod par bya ba'i sbyor ba tha dad pa ni sgra tha dad pa yin la /
translated: They are not direct.üîΩIf, because of the difference in syllogisms, they are different, then they are called inferences for the sake of others. The difference in syllogisms is the difference in words.üîΩAnd words are inferences for the sake of others.

original: sgra yang gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes dgos pa la /
analyzed: sgra yang gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes dgos pa la /
translated: In response to the need for this, the following is stated:

original: sbyor ba mthong ba goms pa las /üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthong ba goms pa las / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom seeing and becoming accustomed to the syllogisms.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos las byung ba'i sbyor ba mthong ba dmigs shing /
analyzed: bstan bcos las byung ba'i sbyor ba mthong ba dmigs shing /
translated: One sees and observes the syllogisms that occur in the treatises.

original: de goms pa yang nas yang du byed pa de'i rgyu mtshan de las de dag nyid kyang sgrub pa po rang yang ji skad du bstan pa'i rim pa de bzhin du rnam par gcod pa 'gog pa rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de goms pa yang nas yang du byed pa de'i rgyu mtshan de las de dag nyid kyang sgrub pa po rang yang ji skad du bstan pa'i rim pa de bzhin du rnam par gcod pa 'gog pa rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The reason for cultivating that again and again is that the proponent himself also understands the exclusion, the negation, in the same way that he has taught it.

original: bas zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bas zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means ‚Äúfor this reason.‚Äù

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: gang gi phyir rang yang sbyor ba goms pa'i thabs 'dis rtogs par byed par byed pa de bas na rtogs pa po rang la dgos pa sbyor ba tha dad pa rnams rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang yang sbyor ba goms pa'i thabs 'dis rtogs par byed par byed pa de bas na rtogs pa po rang la dgos pa sbyor ba tha dad pa rnams rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since the proponent himself understands by means of this method of cultivating the syllogism, therefore the syllogism is taught for the sake of the proponent himself.

original: gang yang gzhan khong du chud par bya ba nyid du dgos na ni de dag gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang gzhan khong du chud par bya ba nyid du dgos na ni de dag gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: But if it is for the sake of causing others to understand, then it should be called ‚Äúinference for the sake of others.‚Äù

original: snang ba 'gog na ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba yin par thal bar 'gyur bas 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs ba ni rgyu la sogs pa mi snang ba kho na 'gog pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: snang ba 'gog na ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba yin par thal bar 'gyur bas 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs ba ni rgyu la sogs pa mi snang ba kho na 'gog pa ma yin nam /
translated: Thus, non-observation of effect and so forth do not refute the non-appearance of cause and so forth alone.

original: de lta yin na ni de dag rnam pa mi @59b dmigs pas 'gog pa ma yin na de ltar sbyor ba de dag snang ba dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus she na /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni de dag rnam pa mi @59b dmigs pas 'gog pa ma yin na de ltar sbyor ba de dag snang ba dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus she na /
translated: If that is so, since they do not refute non-observation of form, are those syllogisms included in the observation of appearance?

original: med ba dang med pa'i tha snyad sgrub ba mi dmigs pa de dag thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med ba dang med pa'i tha snyad sgrub ba mi dmigs pa de dag thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚ÄúAll of those non-observations that prove non-existence and the term non-existence‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: med pa dang de'i tha snyad ni med pa dang tha snyad de rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la ni tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: med pa dang de'i tha snyad ni med pa dang tha snyad de rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la ni tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Non-existence and the term for that are non-existence and the term for that. In the case of non-observation of essential nature, the term is what is to be proven.

original: lhag ma rnams la ni med par bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la ni med par bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: In the case of the remaining ones, non-existence is what is to be proven.

original: de gnyis bsgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa de dag thams cad la yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnyis bsgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa de dag thams cad la yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: In all of those non-observations that prove those two,

original: yang gi sgra ni phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni phyir gyi don te /
translated: the term ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúfurthermore.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir mi dmigs ba thams cad la dgag pa bstan pa gang yin pa de dag dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa kho na snang ba 'gog pa de bas na snang ba mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi dmigs ba thams cad la dgag pa bstan pa gang yin pa de dag dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa kho na snang ba 'gog pa de bas na snang ba mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus pa yin no //
translated: Because all non-apprehensions are taught to be negations, they appear only as the characteristics of apprehensions. Therefore, they are included in the non-apprehension of appearances.

original: snang ba kho na yin pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba kho na yin pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it only appearances?

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the nature of‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: 'dir yang ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu'i don te /
analyzed: 'dir yang ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu'i don te /
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the sense of cause.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin 'gal ba gang dag yin pa de dag la sogs pa mi dmigs pa dang / rgyu la sogs pa mi dmigs pas dgag pa bshad pa de bas na snang ba kho na dgag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin 'gal ba gang dag yin pa de dag la sogs pa mi dmigs pa dang / rgyu la sogs pa mi dmigs pas dgag pa bshad pa de bas na snang ba kho na dgag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of those that are mutually exclusive by nature, etc., and because of the non-apprehension of causes, etc., negations are explained. Therefore, it means that only appearances are negations.

original: ci ste rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa dmigs pa dang / rgyu la sogs pa mi dmigs pas dgag pa bshad mod kyis /
analyzed: ci ste rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa dmigs pa dang / rgyu la sogs pa mi dmigs pas dgag pa bshad mod kyis /
translated: But even though negations are explained by the apprehension of those that are mutually exclusive by nature, etc., and by the non-apprehension of causes, etc.,

original: 'on kyang ji ltar snang ba kho na dgag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar snang ba kho na dgag pa yin zhe na /
translated: how is it that only appearances are negations?

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa kho na dag las dmigs pa dang mi dmigs par yang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa kho na dag las dmigs pa dang mi dmigs par yang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said that the object of observation and non-observation should be understood just from those that have the characteristic of the object of observation.

original: 'dir yang yang zhes bya ba rgyu'i don te /
analyzed: 'dir yang yang zhes bya ba rgyu'i don te /
translated: Here, ‚Äújust‚Äù has the meaning of cause.

original: gang gi phyir 'gal ba dang / khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed par gyur pa dang / 'bras bu dang ; rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag gdon mi za bar dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gal ba dang / khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed par gyur pa dang / 'bras bu dang ; rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag gdon mi za bar dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Because that which is contradictory, that which is pervaded, that which is the pervader, that which is the effect, and that which is the cause, without a doubt, are objects of observation.

original: dmigs pa'i sngon du song ba'i mi dmigs pa rig par bya ste shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i sngon du song ba'i mi dmigs pa rig par bya ste shes par bya'o //
translated: Non-observation that precedes the object of observation should be understood, should be known.

original: dmigs pa'i mi dmigs pa gnyis yod pa gang yin pa de ni snang ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mi dmigs pa gnyis yod pa gang yin pa de ni snang ba kho na yin no //
translated: That which is the existence of the two, the object of observation and non-observation, is just appearance.

original: de bas na rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa dmigs pa dang / rgyu la sogs pa mi dmigs pas dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i 'gal ba la sogs pa dgag pa byed pa ni snang ba kho na la byas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa dmigs pa dang / rgyu la sogs pa mi dmigs pas dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i 'gal ba la sogs pa dgag pa byed pa ni snang ba kho na la byas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the refutation of the contradictions, etc. that are based on the observation of the intrinsic nature, etc. and the non-observation of the cause, etc. should be regarded as being made only in regard to appearances.

original: rgol ba mang por sngar thal ba'i lan bsdu ba'i phyir yang yang gi sgra ni rgyu'i don yin te /üîΩgang gi @60a * //
analyzed: rgol ba mang por sngar thal ba'i lan bsdu ba'i phyir yang yang gi sgra ni rgyu'i don yin te / gang gi @60a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúagain‚Äù has the sense of cause, in order to summarize the response to the many objections.

original: phyir lan 'di dang 'di dag yod pa de bas na rgol ba mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni yang gi don te /
analyzed: phyir lan 'di dang 'di dag yod pa de bas na rgol ba mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni yang gi don te /
translated: Because these responses exist, therefore the objection is unreasonable. This is the sense of ‚Äúagain.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir dgag par bya ba'i 'gal ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa dang mi dmigs par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dgag par bya ba'i 'gal ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa dang mi dmigs par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: Why should the contradiction, etc. of the object of negation be understood in terms of observation and non-observation?

original: gzhan dag la ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúin regard to others.‚Äù

original: gang gi dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa las gzhan pa mi dmigs pa kho na gang yin pa de dag la ni 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig tu 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa dang khyab par byed pa med na med pa mi
analyzed: gang gi dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa las gzhan pa mi dmigs pa kho na gang yin pa de dag la ni 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig tu 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa dang khyab par byed pa med na med pa mi
translated: But in the case of those which are non-observation-only, and not endowed with observation of an object, there is no establishment of any of the three, contradiction, cause and effect, and pervasion,üîΩin the case of any of them.

original: 'grub po // gang gi phyir de lta yin ba de bas na 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dang med pa mi 'grub pa'i rgyu des na dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa kho na 'gal ba la sogs pa'i dgag par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'grub po // gang gi phyir de lta yin ba de bas na 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dang med pa mi 'grub pa'i rgyu des na dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa kho na 'gal ba la sogs pa'i dgag par bya ba yin la /
translated: And because that is so, by that cause, namely, the non-establishment of contradiction, cause and effect, and pervasion, observation and non-observation are alone the objects of negation, contradiction, etc.

original: gnyis ka dang ldan pa yang snang ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ka dang ldan pa yang snang ba kho na yin no //
translated: And the endowed with both is only apparent.

original: de bas na snang ba kho na dgag pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na snang ba kho na dgag pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, only the apparent is negated.

original: 'gal ba dang 'bras bu dang rgyu yod pa dang khyab par byed pa med na khyab par byed pa med pa ni snang ba mi dmigs pa kho na las yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba dang 'bras bu dang rgyu yod pa dang khyab par byed pa med na khyab par byed pa med pa ni snang ba mi dmigs pa kho na las yin te /
translated: The existence of contradiction, effect, cause, and pervasion, and the non-existence of the pervader are only from the non-observation of the apparent.

original: gcig yod pa na gzhan med par rtogs na ni 'gal ba yin par shes so //
analyzed: gcig yod pa na gzhan med par rtogs na ni 'gal ba yin par shes so //
translated: If one understands that when one is present, the other is absent, then one understands the contradiction.

original: rgyu mngon par 'dod pa med na 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa med par shes na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu khong du chud do //
analyzed: rgyu mngon par 'dod pa med na 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa med par shes na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu khong du chud do //
translated: If one understands that when the cause is not desired, the effect is not desired, then one understands cause and effect.

original: khyab par byed par mngon par 'dod pa med na yang khyab par byed par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed par mngon par 'dod pa med na yang khyab par byed par nges pa yin no //
translated: If one understands that when the pervader is not desired, the pervaded is not desired, then one understands the pervasion.

original: de la khyab par byed pa dang khyab par byed par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du dngos po med pa khong du chud par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de la khyab par byed pa dang khyab par byed par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du dngos po med pa khong du chud par bya dgos te /
translated: In this case, one should understand the non-existence as the reason for understanding the pervader and the pervaded.

original: 'di shing med na shing sha pa nyid med par shes na ni khyab pa dang khyab par byed par shes pa yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di shing med na shing sha pa nyid med par shes na ni khyab pa dang khyab par byed par shes pa yin zhing /
translated: If one understands that when this tree is absent, the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree is absent, then one understands the pervasion and the pervaded.

original: dngos po med par khong du chud pa yang thams cad du snang ba mi dmigs pa kho na las yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med par khong du chud pa yang thams cad du snang ba mi dmigs pa kho na las yin no //
translated: And the understanding of non-existence is always only from the non-apprehension of appearance.

original: de bas na 'gal ba dang rgyu 'bras dang khyab bya khyab byed kyi dngos po dran par byed pa ni 'gal ba la sogs pa dang khyab bya khyab byed kyi dngos po'i yul la /
analyzed: de bas na 'gal ba dang rgyu 'bras dang khyab bya khyab byed kyi dngos po dran par byed pa ni 'gal ba la sogs pa dang khyab bya khyab byed kyi dngos po'i yul la /
translated: Therefore, the recollection of things that are contradictory, cause and effect, and the pervaded and the pervader is the object of the recollection of things that are contradictory and so on and the pervaded and the pervader.üîΩ

original: dngos po med pa khong du chud pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pa dran par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa khong du chud pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pa dran par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should recall the entities of contradiction, cause and effect, and the pervaded and the pervader, and one should recall the non-apprehension of appearance which is the cause of understanding the non-existence of entities in the domain of the entities of the pervaded and the pervader, etc.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa mi dran na ni 'gal ba la sogs pa yang mi dran no //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa mi dran na ni 'gal ba la sogs pa yang mi dran no //
translated: If one does not recall the non-apprehension of appearance, one will not recall the contradiction, etc.

original: de ltar gyur na ni 'gal ba la sogs pa yod pa dang dgag pa nyid kyis cig shos med par shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni 'gal ba la sogs pa yod pa dang dgag pa nyid kyis cig shos med par shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is the case, one will not understand the existence of the other by the mere negation of the existence of the contradiction, etc.

original: 'gal ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i dus na yod pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pa gdon mi za bar dran par bya ba na @60b yang de kho na las dngos po med par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i dus na yod pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pa gdon mi za bar dran par bya ba na @60b yang de kho na las dngos po med par shes pa yin no //
translated: When one apprehends the contradiction, etc., one should certainly recall the non-apprehension of appearance, and from that alone one understands the non-existence of entities.

original: de la ci ste snang ba mi dmigs pa dang bltar med du zin kyang sngon 'gal ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i dus kyi snang ba mi dmigs pa da ltar dran pa gang yin pa de nyid dngos po med par khong du chud pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de la ci ste snang ba mi dmigs pa dang bltar med du zin kyang sngon 'gal ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i dus kyi snang ba mi dmigs pa da ltar dran pa gang yin pa de nyid dngos po med par khong du chud pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhy is it that even though the appearance is not observed and is not seen, the memory of the appearance at the time of the apprehension of the contradictory, etc., is the cause of understanding the nonexistence of the thing?‚Äù

original: de bas na snang ba mi dmigs pa da ltar med pa yin pas dngos po med pa sgrub pa ni snang ba mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba las 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na snang ba mi dmigs pa da ltar med pa yin pas dngos po med pa sgrub pa ni snang ba mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba las 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the nonobservation of the appearance is not present now, the proof of the nonexistence of the thing is different from the proof of the nonobservation of the effect, etc., which is the nonobservation of the appearance.

original: 'gal ba bsgrub pa dang / rgyu la sogs pa dgag pa'i sgo nas kyang gang gi phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa 'phangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba bsgrub pa dang / rgyu la sogs pa dgag pa'i sgo nas kyang gang gi phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa 'phangs pa yin te /
translated: The proof of the contradictory and the negation of the cause, etc., are also implied by the nonobservation of the appearance.

original: de bas na dus gzhan na yod pa ngan pa'i yul du gyur pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par khong du chud pa dang / sbyor ba 'di dag kyang snang ba mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dus gzhan na yod pa ngan pa'i yul du gyur pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par khong du chud pa dang / sbyor ba 'di dag kyang snang ba mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the understanding of non-existence from the non-perception of an object that is present at another time and in a bad place, and these applications are included in the non-perception of an object.

original: de ltar na 'di thams cad kyis ni mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba bcu po rnams brgyud pa'i sgo nas snang ba mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus par bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di thams cad kyis ni mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba bcu po rnams brgyud pa'i sgo nas snang ba mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus par bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that all of this demonstrates that the ten applications of non-perception are included in the non-perception of an object by way of a continuum.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba la tshad ma yin par smras pa mi snang ba mi dmigs pas ni ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba la tshad ma yin par smras pa mi snang ba mi dmigs pas ni ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: Non-perception of an object is said to be a valid means of knowledge for establishing the non-existence and the convention of non-existence. What is the use of non-perception of non-appearance?

original: bskal ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bskal ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe object that is distant in time‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gsum gyis bskal pa'i yul gang yin pa bskal ba'i yul yin pa de ni the tshon gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gsum gyis bskal pa'i yul gang yin pa bskal ba'i yul yin pa de ni the tshon gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: The object that is distant in time, place, and nature is the object that is distant. That is the cause of doubt.

original: rang bzhin ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: rang bzhin ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the nature of that?

original: smras pa / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa log pa'i mtshan nyid de rang bzhin gang la yod pa log pa'i ngo bo nyid shes pa dang shes bya'i ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: smras pa / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa log pa'i mtshan nyid de rang bzhin gang la yod pa log pa'i ngo bo nyid shes pa dang shes bya'i ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: Objection: Direct perception and inference are the characteristics of error. That which has a nature that is erroneous is not the nature of the object of knowledge and the knower.

original: / tshad ma las gzhal bya yod par gzhag pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: / tshad ma las gzhal bya yod par gzhag pa ma yin nam /
translated: Reply: Are objects of comprehension not posited as existent by means of valid knowledge?

original: de bas na tshad ma med pa'i phyir gzhal bya med par khong du chud par rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na tshad ma med pa'i phyir gzhal bya med par khong du chud par rigs so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because valid knowledge does not exist, it is reasonable to understand that objects of comprehension do not exist.

original: tshad ma log kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshad ma log kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúEven if valid knowledge is refuted. . . . ‚Äù

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa log na ni 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba ldog par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa log na ni 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba ldog par yang 'gyur la /
translated: If a cause or a pervader is refuted, then an effect or that which is pervaded is refuted.

original: tshad ma ni gzhal bya'i rgyu yang ma yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma ni gzhal bya'i rgyu yang ma yin la /
translated: But valid knowledge is not the cause of objects of comprehension,

original: khyab par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it a pervader.

original: de bas na tshad ma gnyis log tu zin kyang don te gzhal bya ldog par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de bas na tshad ma gnyis log tu zin kyang don te gzhal bya ldog par mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, even if the two valid knowledges are refuted, it is not established that objects of comprehension, that is, objects, are refuted.

original: de ltar mi 'grub pa'i phyir mi snang ba mi dmigs pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'grub pa'i phyir mi snang ba mi dmigs pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Since that is not established, nonobservation that is a nonobservation of something that could be observed is a cause of doubt.

original: nges pa'i gtan tshigs ni ma yin no //üîΩgang yang tshad ma yod @61a * //
analyzed: nges pa'i gtan tshigs ni ma yin no // gang yang tshad ma yod @61a * //
translated: but not a definitive proof.

original: pas gzhal bya yod par 'grub pa de ni rigs yin te /üîΩtshad ma ni gzhal bya'i 'bras bu yin la 'bras bu yang rgyu med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pas gzhal bya yod par 'grub pa de ni rigs yin te / tshad ma ni gzhal bya'i 'bras bu yin la 'bras bu yang rgyu med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is reasonable that the object of valid cognition is established by the existence of valid cognition,üîΩbecause valid cognition is the effect of the object of valid cognition, and an effect does not occur without a cause.

original: rgyu ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: But a cause does not necessarily possess an effect.

original: de bas na tshad ma las gzhal bya yod par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na tshad ma las gzhal bya yod par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the object of valid cognition is established by valid cognition.

original: tshad ma med pa'i phyir gzhal bya med par rnam par gzhag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i phyir gzhal bya med par rnam par gzhag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the object of valid cognition is established by the nonexistence of valid cognition.

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ste le'u gnyis pa'o /üîΩ// / rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa gnyis las gzhan gyi don bshad par 'dod nas /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ste le'u gnyis pa'o / // / rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa gnyis las gzhan gyi don bshad par 'dod nas /
translated: This is the second chapter, on inference for oneself.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags rjod pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags rjod pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Having explained inference for oneself and inference for others, wishing to explain inference for others, he says: ‚ÄúInference for others is the statement of a reason having the three modes.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang phyogs kyi chos nyid ces bya ba'i tshul gsum gang la yod pa de ni tshul gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang phyogs kyi chos nyid ces bya ba'i tshul gsum gang la yod pa de ni tshul gsum pa'o //
translated: The three modes are called the property of the position, the forward pervasion, and the counter pervasion. The property of the position is the property of the subject. The forward pervasion is the pervasion of the reason by the predicate of the probandum. The counter pervasion is the pervasion of the negation of the predicate of the probandum by the negation of the reason.

original: tshul gsum pa yang yin la rtags kyang yin pa de brjod pa ste /üîΩ'dis tshul gsum pa'i rtags 'chad par byed /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa yang yin la rtags kyang yin pa de brjod pa ste / 'dis tshul gsum pa'i rtags 'chad par byed /
translated: The statement of the triply characterized reason is the statement of the triply characterized reason.üîΩIt is a statement because it explains the triply characterized reason.

original: ston par byed pas brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ston par byed pas brjod pa'o //
translated: It is a statement because it teaches the triply characterized reason.

original: de ci yin zhe na tshig ste /
analyzed: de ci yin zhe na tshig ste /
translated: What is it? It is a statement.

original: tshig gis tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig gis tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa yin no //
translated: The statement is the statement of the triply characterized reason.

original: gzhan gyi ches yin pas gzhan don no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ches yin pas gzhan don no //
translated: It is for the sake of others because it is for the sake of others.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes smras pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes smras pa ma yin nam /
translated: Didn‚Äôt we say that inference is by nature right knowledge?

original: de ci'i phyir de ltar tshig gi bdag nyid la rjes su dpag pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir de ltar tshig gi bdag nyid la rjes su dpag pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called inference in regard to a statement that is by nature a word?

original: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause the effect is designated upon the cause.‚Äù

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa las tshul gsum gyi rtags dran pa skye'o //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa las tshul gsum gyi rtags dran pa skye'o //
translated: From the statement of the triply characterized reason, the memory of the triply characterized reason arises.

original: dran pa las rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: dran pa las rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: It is an inference from memory.

original: de bas na tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin no //üîΩde ltar na rgyu tshig la 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa btags pa sgro btags pa byas te /
analyzed: de bas na tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin no // de ltar na rgyu tshig la 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa btags pa sgro btags pa byas te /
translated: Therefore, the expression of a reason having the three modes is the indirect cause of inference.üîΩThus, the cause, the words, are designated as the effect, the inference.

original: de ltar sgro btags pa'i phyir rgyu dag ni rjes su dpag pa'i sgras bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar sgro btags pa'i phyir rgyu dag ni rjes su dpag pa'i sgras bstan te /
translated: Because of that designation, the cause is indicated by the term ‚Äúinference.‚Äù

original: dag ni rjes su dpag par btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dag ni rjes su dpag par btags pa yin gyi /
translated: The cause is designated as an inference,

original: dngos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: dngos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: but it is not actually that, is what is meant.

original: / gang ji snyed nye bar btags nas rjes su dpag pa'i sgras brjod par nus pa de thams cad bshad par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: / gang ji snyed nye bar btags nas rjes su dpag pa'i sgras brjod par nus pa de thams cad bshad par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Not everything that can be expressed by the term ‚Äúinference‚Äù through designation is to be explained.

original: 'on kyang rjes su dpag par bshad par 'dod pas rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan brjod par bya dgos la /
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su dpag par bshad par 'dod pas rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan brjod par bya dgos la /
translated: However, because the one who wishes to explain inference wishes to express the nature of inference, he must state the reason, because the nature of inference is not to be expressed.

original: rgyu mtshan yang tshul @61b gsum pa'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yang tshul @61b gsum pa'i rtags yin no //
translated: And the reason is a reason having the three modes.

original: de yang rang nyid rtogs pas rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu mtshan du yin pa'am /
analyzed: de yang rang nyid rtogs pas rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu mtshan du yin pa'am /
translated: Moreover, it is a reason that is inferred from one's own understanding,

original: gzhan gyis bstan pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pas so //
translated: or it is taught by another.

original: de bas na rtags kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / ston par byed pa'i sgra yang bshad dgos so //
analyzed: de bas na rtags kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / ston par byed pa'i sgra yang bshad dgos so //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the logical mark and the words that teach it must be explained.

original: de la rang gi ngo bo ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la rang gi ngo bo ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par bshad zin to //
translated: Regarding that, the nature has already been explained as inference for oneself.

original: ston par byed pa'i sgra 'dir 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: ston par byed pa'i sgra 'dir 'chad pa yin no //
translated: The words that teach it are explained here.

original: de bas na ston par byed pa'i sgras gdon mi za bar brjod par bya ba yin par byed pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis rjes su dpag pa'i sgras brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na ston par byed pa'i sgras gdon mi za bar brjod par bya ba yin par byed pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis rjes su dpag pa'i sgras brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the words that teach it must be expressed, the master says that it is expressed by the words of inference. In order to teach the classification of inference for oneself,

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: he says, It is of two kinds.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa de ni gang la rnam pa gnyis te bye brag yod pa te rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa de ni gang la rnam pa gnyis te bye brag yod pa te rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: That inference for the sake of others is of two kinds, because there is a distinction, that is, it is of two kinds.

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa gnyis yin zhe na /üîΩsbyor ba zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩsgra'i byed pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa gnyis yin zhe na / sbyor ba zhes bya ba smos te / sgra'i byed pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: Why are there two types?üîΩThe root text states, ‚Äúbecause of the difference in the function of the words.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba ni rab tu sbyor ba ste don brjod pa'o //üîΩsgra'i don brjod pa'i byed pa tha dad pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rab tu sbyor ba ste don brjod pa'o // sgra'i don brjod pa'i byed pa tha dad pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The function of a word is its operation.üîΩInference is of two types because the function of expressing the meaning of a word is different.

original: rgyu mtshan rjod byed kyi byed pa gnyis po de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩchos mthun pa nyid can dang chos mi mthun pa nyid can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan rjod byed kyi byed pa gnyis po de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / chos mthun pa nyid can dang chos mi mthun pa nyid can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúbecause of the difference in the function of expressing the reason.‚ÄùüîΩThe two types of inference are called ‚Äúhaving a similar property‚Äù and ‚Äúhaving a dissimilar property.‚ÄùüîΩThe root text states, ‚Äúhaving a similar property and having a dissimilar property.‚Äù

original: 'di la chos mtshungs pa yod pa de ni chos mthun pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di la chos mtshungs pa yod pa de ni chos mthun pa yin la /
translated: That which has a similar property is called ‚Äúhaving a similar property.‚Äù

original: de'i dngos po ni chos dang mthun pa nyid do //üîΩ'di la mi 'dra ba'i chos yod pa ni chos mi mthun pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni chos dang mthun pa nyid do // 'di la mi 'dra ba'i chos yod pa ni chos mi mthun pa yin la /
translated: The nature of that is called ‚Äúhaving a similar property.‚ÄùüîΩThat which has a dissimilar property is called ‚Äúhaving a dissimilar property.‚Äù

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dngos po ni chos dang mi mthun pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dngos po ni chos dang mi mthun pa nyid de /
translated: The nature of that is called ‚Äúhaving a dissimilar property.‚Äù

original: dpe'i chos can dang lhan cig bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi chos de 'dra bar gtan tshigs kyis byas pa de ni chos dang mthun pa zhes bya'o //üîΩmi 'dra bar gtan tshigs kyis byas pa ni chos dang mi mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dpe'i chos can dang lhan cig bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi chos de 'dra bar gtan tshigs kyis byas pa de ni chos dang mthun pa zhes bya'o // mi 'dra bar gtan tshigs kyis byas pa ni chos dang mi mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The property of the example that is made similar to the property of the subject by the reason is called ‚Äúhomologous.‚ÄùüîΩThe property of the example that is made dissimilar to the property of the subject by the reason is called ‚Äúheterologous.‚Äù

original: de la sgrub par byed pa'i ngag gang la rjod par byed pa chos mthun pa nyid yod pa de ni chos mthun pa nyid can te /
analyzed: de la sgrub par byed pa'i ngag gang la rjod par byed pa chos mthun pa nyid yod pa de ni chos mthun pa nyid can te /
translated: In this regard, an argument that has a homologous property is one that has a property that is expressed as being similar.

original: gang byas pa de ni mi rtag ste dper na bum pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang byas pa de ni mi rtag ste dper na bum pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúWhatever is produced is impermanent, like a pot.üîΩSound is produced.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du sgra yang byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i ngag 'dir byas pa nyid kyis byas pa dpe dang bsgrub bya'i chos can gyi 'dra ba nyid brjod bya yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra yang byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i ngag 'dir byas pa nyid kyis byas pa dpe dang bsgrub bya'i chos can gyi 'dra ba nyid brjod bya yin pa bzhin no //
translated: In this argument, the property of being produced is expressed as being similar to the example and the property of the subject.

original: ngag gang la brjod par bya ba chos mi mthun pa nyid yod pa de ni chos mi mthun pa nyid can te dper na gang rtag pa de ni @62a * //
analyzed: ngag gang la brjod par bya ba chos mi mthun pa nyid yod pa de ni chos mi mthun pa nyid can te dper na gang rtag pa de ni @62a * //
translated: An argument that has a heterologous property is one that has a property that is expressed as being dissimilar. For example, ‚ÄúWhatever is permanent is not produced,

original: byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byas pa ma yin te /
translated: like space.üîΩSound is impermanent.‚Äù

original: dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like space.

original: sgra ni byas pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dir byas pas byas pa bsgrub par bya ba dang / dpe'i chos can sgra dang nam mkha' dag gi mi 'dra ba nyid brjod par bya ba yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra ni byas pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dir byas pas byas pa bsgrub par bya ba dang / dpe'i chos can sgra dang nam mkha' dag gi mi 'dra ba nyid brjod par bya ba yin pa bzhin no //
translated: In the case of the statement, ‚ÄúSound is produced,‚Äù the production of the probandum is established by production, and the dissimilarity of the example-property-possessor, sound, and space must be stated.

original: ci ste sbyor ba 'di gnyis kyang brjod par bya ba tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: ci ste sbyor ba 'di gnyis kyang brjod par bya ba tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If these two syllogisms are to be stated,

original: 'o na bstan par bya ba tshul gsum pa'i rtags tha mi dad par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bstan par bya ba tshul gsum pa'i rtags tha mi dad par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how can the probandum, the sign that has three modes, be non-different?

original: 'di gnyis don du bye brag ci yang med do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis don du bye brag ci yang med do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúThere is no difference in their meaning.‚Äù

original: don ni dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: don ni dgos pa yin te /
translated: Meaning is purpose.

original: bstan par bya ba'i dgos pa gang gi ched du rjes su dpag pa sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba'i dgos pa gang gi ched du rjes su dpag pa sbyor ba'o //
translated: The purpose of the probandum is the reason for the application of inference.

original: de bas na 'di gnyis kyi dgos pa ni bye brag cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di gnyis kyi dgos pa ni bye brag cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is not the slightest difference in the purpose of these two.

original: tshul gsum gyi rtags bshad par bya ba yin pas 'di gnyi ga yang de'i ched du sbyar bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: tshul gsum gyi rtags bshad par bya ba yin pas 'di gnyi ga yang de'i ched du sbyar bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Since the sign that has three modes is to be explained, both of these are to be applied for that purpose.

original: rnam pa gnyis kas kyang tshul gsum pa'i rtags bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kas kyang tshul gsum pa'i rtags bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: Both of these are to be demonstrated by a trimodal logical reason.

original: de bas na 'di gnyis kyang dgos pa bstan par bya ba tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di gnyis kyang dgos pa bstan par bya ba tha dad pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference in the purpose that is to be demonstrated by these two.

original: de ltar na de las ni tha dad pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de ltar na de las ni tha dad pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Thus, there is not the slightest difference between them.

original: 'o na brjod par bya ba yang tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na brjod par bya ba yang tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well then, the content would not be different either.

original: sbyor ba'i bye brag ma gtogs par zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bye brag ma gtogs par zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúapart from the difference in their application‚Äù is stated.

original: sbyor ba ni brjod pa'i tshig nyid yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni brjod pa'i tshig nyid yin no //
translated: Application is the very words that are expressed.

original: rjod byed nyid tha dad pa las gzhan dgos pas byas pa ni tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjod byed nyid tha dad pa las gzhan dgos pas byas pa ni tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that apart from the difference in the expression itself, there is no difference in the purpose that is accomplished.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: brjod par bya ba yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yang gzhan yin la /
translated: The content is one thing.

original: bstan par bya ba'i dgos pa yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba'i dgos pa yang gzhan yin no //
translated: The purpose that is to be demonstrated is another.

original: de la brjod par bya ba la ltos nas ni tshig nyid tha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ba la ltos nas ni tshig nyid tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: In that regard, the words themselves are different in dependence upon the content.

original: bstan par bya ba ni tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba ni tha dad pa med de /
translated: But the demonstration is not different.

original: rjes su 'gro ba smos pa ni 'og nas ston pa'i tshul gyis ldog pa rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba smos pa ni 'og nas ston pa'i tshul gyis ldog pa rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: The mention of concomitance is for the purpose of showing the way to understand the pervasion.

original: ldog pas kyang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs so //
analyzed: ldog pas kyang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs so //
translated: And by the pervasion one understands the concomitance.

original: de bas na bstan par bya ba tshul gsum pa'i rtags ni tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na bstan par bya ba tshul gsum pa'i rtags ni tha dad pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the sign of the three modes of the probandum is not different.

original: gang na brjod par bya ba tha dad pa der shugs kyis rtogs par bya ba'i don kyang tha dad pa na ma yin te /
analyzed: gang na brjod par bya ba tha dad pa der shugs kyis rtogs par bya ba'i don kyang tha dad pa na ma yin te /
translated: Where the expressed meanings are different, the understood meanings are also different.

original: 'di ltar lha sbyin tshon po nyin par zan mi za'o zhes smras pa dang / lha sbyin tshon po mtshan mo zan za'o zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di gnyis brjod par bya ba tha dad du zin kyang rtogs par bya ba gcig kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar lha sbyin tshon po nyin par zan mi za'o zhes smras pa dang / lha sbyin tshon po mtshan mo zan za'o zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di gnyis brjod par bya ba tha dad du zin kyang rtogs par bya ba gcig kho na yin no //
translated: For example, when one says, ‚ÄúFat Devadatta does not eat during the day,‚Äù and ‚ÄúFat Devadatta eats at night,‚Äù although the expressed meanings are different, the understood meaning is the same.

original: de bzhin du 'dir brjod par bya ba'i don tha dad kyang rtogs par bya ba gcig kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir brjod par bya ba'i don tha dad kyang rtogs par bya ba gcig kho na yin no //
translated: In the same way, here although the expressed meanings are different, the understood meaning is the same.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa dang chos mi @62b mthun pa can gnyis kyi rjes su dpag pa can de gnyis la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa dang chos mi @62b mthun pa can gnyis kyi rjes su dpag pa can de gnyis la'o //
translated: In this regard, in that refers to the two types of inference, that which has a similar property and that which has a dissimilar property.

original: re zhig chos mthun pa can mi dmigs pa'i dpe dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig chos mthun pa can mi dmigs pa'i dpe dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: First, in order to present the example of non-apprehension that has a similar property,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, That which has the characteristic of apprehension... and so on.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa gang snang ba gang yin pa ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni snang ba mi dmigs pa de rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa gang snang ba gang yin pa ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni snang ba mi dmigs pa de rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: That which has the characteristic of apprehension, whatever appears, is not apprehended - by this, the non-apprehension of appearance is referred to.

original: de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
analyzed: de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
translated: That is the object of the convention of non-existence.

original: de med do zhes bya bar tha snyad du bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de med do zhes bya bar tha snyad du bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it should be conventionally expressed as it does not exist.

original: 'dis ni 'di med pa'i tha snyad du rung pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di med pa'i tha snyad du rung pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no /
translated: By this, the suitability for the convention of non-existence is what is to be established.

original: de bas na med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i nyid la snang ba mi dmigs pa nges par bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i nyid la snang ba mi dmigs pa nges par bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of appearance is definitely taught with regard to the suitability for the convention of non-existence.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the non-observation of appearance is suitable as the term for non-existence.

original: sgrub par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba'i don la nges par ston pas yang khyab pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba'i don la nges par ston pas yang khyab pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: The demonstration of the pervasion by the proof of the probandum is also taught.

original: ji skad du khyab par byed pa'i khyab pa ni de la yod pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: ji skad du khyab par byed pa'i khyab pa ni de la yod pa kho na yin la /
translated: As it is said, the pervasion of the pervader is only present in that [pervaded].üîΩAnd the pervaded is also only present in that [pervading].

original: khyab par bya ba yang de kho na la yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa khyab pa sgrub pa tshad ma'i yul ni dpe yin pas de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyab par bya ba yang de kho na la yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa khyab pa sgrub pa tshad ma'i yul ni dpe yin pas de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The object of valid cognition that establishes the pervasion is the example. Therefore, in order to teach just that,

original: dper na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says for example.

original: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can las gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i don ston to //
analyzed: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can las gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i don ston to //
translated: The meaning is that the example is different from the subject of the probandum.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni tshad nges pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni tshad nges pa yin te /
translated: Seeing indicates a definite measure.

original: ri bong gi rva ni mig gi yul du byas pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva ni mig gi yul du byas pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the horn of a rabbit is not made into an object of the eye,

original: 'on kyang tshad ma'i sgo nas med pa'i tha snyad du rung bar shes so //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshad ma'i sgo nas med pa'i tha snyad du rung bar shes so //
translated: nevertheless, through valid cognition, it is understood to be suitable as the term for non-existence.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i gang med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i gang med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The object of the expression ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is that which is nonexistent, such as the horn of a rabbit.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni snang ba mi dmigs pa tsam gyis med pa'i tha snyad yin par tshad mar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni snang ba mi dmigs pa tsam gyis med pa'i tha snyad yin par tshad mar grub pa yin no //
translated: The horn of a rabbit is established as the object of the expression ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù by the mere nonapprehension of appearance.

original: de bas na dag 'dis brjod par bya ba'i khyab pa ni tshad ma las shes par bya ba yin no //üîΩkhyab pa bstan nas da ni snang ba mi dmigs pa'i phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na dag 'dis brjod par bya ba'i khyab pa ni tshad ma las shes par bya ba yin no // khyab pa bstan nas da ni snang ba mi dmigs pa'i phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the pervasion of this expression is to be understood from a valid cognition.üîΩHaving taught the pervasion, now, in order to teach the property of the subject of the nonapprehension of appearance, he says,

original: phyogs kyi bye brag gang na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi bye brag gang na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äúin a particular place.‚Äù

original: phyogs ni sa'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: phyogs ni sa'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: A place is a part of the earth.

original: de nyid gzhan las bye brag tu gyur pa ni bye brag yin te /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan las bye brag tu gyur pa ni bye brag yin te /
translated: That very [place] which is distinguished from another is a particular.

original: phyogs gcig gi bye brag yin pas na phyogs gcig na'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gi bye brag yin pas na phyogs gcig na'o //
translated: Since it is a particular of a part, it is in a part.

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rtogs pa po'i mngon sum la bya ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rtogs pa po'i mngon sum la bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSome‚Äù refers to the direct perception of the cognizer.

original: phyogs gcig de yang med pa'i tha snyad kyi gzhir gyur pa sgrub ba po'i mngon sum gang yin pa de yin gyi /
analyzed: phyogs gcig de yang med pa'i tha snyad kyi gzhir gyur pa sgrub ba po'i mngon sum gang yin pa de yin gyi /
translated: The one part that is the basis of the expression ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù is the direct perception of the proponent.

original: gzhan ni ma yin @63a * //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin @63a * //
translated: It is not anything else.

original: no ; / dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni snang ba ste /
analyzed: no ; / dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni snang ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of the object is appearance.

original: ji ltar bum pa med du zin kyang sgro btags nas dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa nyid yin par de ltar na bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa med du zin kyang sgro btags nas dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa nyid yin par de ltar na bshad zin to //
translated: Just as, even though a pot does not exist, it is the object of perception, having been superimposed, so it has been explained.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi chos dang mthun pa nyid can de'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi chos dang mthun pa nyid can de'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the application of the property of the logical reason of nature, he says, ‚ÄúIn the same way.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du rang bzhin gyi chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du rang bzhin gyi chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, just as in the case of non-apprehension, so too is the application of the property of the logical reason of nature.

original: gang yod pa zhes bya bas yod pa rjes su brjod nas /
analyzed: gang yod pa zhes bya bas yod pa rjes su brjod nas /
translated: Having restated ‚Äúwhat exists,‚Äù

original: de thams cad mi rtag pa de zhes bya bas ni mi rtag pa nyid sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de thams cad mi rtag pa de zhes bya bas ni mi rtag pa nyid sgrub pa'o //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúAll of that is impermanent,‚Äù thereby proving impermanence.

original: thams cad smos pa ni nges pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: thams cad smos pa ni nges pa'i don yin te /
translated: The word all is definitive in meaning.

original: thams cad mi rtag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad mi rtag pa yin gyi /
translated: All is impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ma yin pa 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ma yin pa 'ga' yang med de /
translated: There is nothing whatsoever that is not impermanent.

original: gang yod pa de mi rtag pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang yod pa de mi rtag pa kho na yin te /
translated: Whatever exists is only impermanent.üîΩImpermanence is not in the permanent, other than in the impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa las gzhan du rtag pa la yod pa ma yin no zhes de ltar bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid la yod pa nyid nges par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa las gzhan du rtag pa la yod pa ma yin no zhes de ltar bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid la yod pa nyid nges par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the existence of the probandum, impermanence, is definitely shown.

original: de ltar na 'dir khyab pa bstan pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir khyab pa bstan pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: Thus, here the words show the pervasion.üîΩFor example, like a pot, etc.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'di ni khyab pa sgrub par byed pa tshad ma'i yul ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'di ni khyab pa sgrub par byed pa tshad ma'i yul ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: This shows the means of valid knowledge that establishes the pervasion.

original: dag pa zhes bya bas ni bye brag med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: dag pa zhes bya bas ni bye brag med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: The word pure shows the application of a non-distinguishing nature.

original: bye brag dang bcas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag dang bcas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the distinguishing,

original: gang skye ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang skye ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, that which possesses arising.

original: skye bar rang gi ngo bo thob pa gang la yod pa de skye ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: skye bar rang gi ngo bo thob pa gang la yod pa de skye ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: That which has the attainment of its own nature is said to be ‚Äúendowed with arising.‚Äù

original: gang skye ba dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni skye pa dang ldan pa nyid rjes su brjod nas /
analyzed: gang skye ba dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni skye pa dang ldan pa nyid rjes su brjod nas /
translated: By saying ‚Äúthat which is endowed with arising,‚Äù he restates ‚Äúthat which has arising.‚Äù

original: de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is impermanent‚Äù is the proof of impermanence.

original: de lta yin dang skye ba dang ldan pa ni mi rtag pa nyid la nges par bstan to //
analyzed: de lta yin dang skye ba dang ldan pa ni mi rtag pa nyid la nges par bstan to //
translated: If that is so, then that which is endowed with arising is definitely shown to be impermanent.

original: rang bzhin du gyur pa rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid kyi chos de'i bye brag gis bye brag tu gyur pa gtan tshigs su byas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin du gyur pa rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid kyi chos de'i bye brag gis bye brag tu gyur pa gtan tshigs su byas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application of the reason is: that which has a nature that is a property of that, which is distinguished by a particular nature, is impermanent.

original: skye ba med pa las ldog pa la brten nas dngos po la skye ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: skye ba med pa las ldog pa la brten nas dngos po la skye ba zhes brjod do //
translated: In dependence on the opposite of non-arising, arising is said to be a property of things.

original: ldog pa de nyid ni gang gi tshe ldog pa gzhan las mi ltos par brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe dngos po'i skye ba zhes tha dad par 'dra bar bstan cing skye ba tha dad pa lta bu des khyad par can du gyur pa'i dngos po yang skyeüîΩba dang ldan par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa de nyid ni gang gi tshe ldog pa gzhan las mi ltos par brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe dngos po'i skye ba zhes tha dad par 'dra bar bstan cing skye ba tha dad pa lta bu des khyad par can du gyur pa'i dngos po yang skye ba dang ldan par brjod pa yin no //
translated: That very reversal, when one wishes to express it without depending on another reversal, at that time, having shown the similarity of the difference called ‚Äúthe arising of an entity,‚Äù by that, as if it were a different arising, the entity that is qualified by that is also said to possess arising.

original: des na rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos rtag pa'i tha dad pas khyad par can du gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba yin par @63b blta'o ;
analyzed: des na rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos rtag pa'i tha dad pas khyad par can du gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba yin par @63b blta'o ;
translated: Therefore, one should see that the application of the qualifier ‚Äúinherent‚Äù is a property that is permanent due to the difference of the inherent.

original: / gang byas pa de ni zhes bya ba ni byas pa nyid rjes su brjod nas mi rtag pa'o zhes sgrub pa ste /üîΩdes na mi rtag pa nyid la byas pa nyid nges par bstan to //
analyzed: / gang byas pa de ni zhes bya ba ni byas pa nyid rjes su brjod nas mi rtag pa'o zhes sgrub pa ste / des na mi rtag pa nyid la byas pa nyid nges par bstan to //
translated: That which is produced is impermanent. Having stated the production itself, the proof is ‚Äúimpermanent.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, production is definitely shown to be impermanent.

original: de bas na mi rtag pa nyid kyis byas pa la khyab par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mi rtag pa nyid kyis byas pa la khyab par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, impermanence is shown to pervade production.

original: khyad par gyi bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase by a particular distinction is to be construed as by a natural connection.

original: khyab par ni khyab par du byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyab par ni khyab par du byed pa'o //
translated: The word pervades means to pervade.

original: de'i bye brag gis de khyad par tha dad pas khyad par can du gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bye brag gis de khyad par tha dad pas khyad par can du gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase by a particular distinction means by a natural connection that is distinguished by a particular distinction.

original: 'di la res 'ga' ni dag pa kho na'i don rjod par byed do //üîΩres 'ga' ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis bye brag tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la res 'ga' ni dag pa kho na'i don rjod par byed do // res 'ga' ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis bye brag tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Sometimes, the word distinction is used to refer to a pure object.üîΩSometimes, it is used to refer to a particular distinction that is not different.

original: res 'ga' ni tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni tha dad pa ste /
translated: Sometimes, it is used to refer to a different object.

original: dper na lha sbyin zhes bya ba dag pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin zhes bya ba dag pa yin no //
translated: For example, the word Devadatta is a pure object.

original: rna ba 'phyang ba can zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa med pa'i rna ba gnyis kyi bye brag can du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba 'phyang ba can zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa med pa'i rna ba gnyis kyi bye brag can du gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase long-eared is a particular distinction that is not different from the two ears.

original: ba khra mo can zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i ba khra mo'i bye brag can no //
analyzed: ba khra mo can zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i ba khra mo'i bye brag can no //
translated: The phrase speckled-cow is a particular distinction that is different from the cow.

original: de bzhin du yod pa ni dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa ni dag pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the word existent is a pure object.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa ni tha dad pa med pa'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa ni tha dad pa med pa'i bye brag yin no //
translated: That which possesses arising is a particular that is not different.

original: byas pa nyid ni tha dad pa'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: byas pa nyid ni tha dad pa'i bye brag yin no //
translated: That which is produced is a particular that is different.

original: ba khra mo can gyi sgra la ni tha dad pa'i bye brag brjod pa ste /
analyzed: ba khra mo can gyi sgra la ni tha dad pa'i bye brag brjod pa ste /
translated: In the word ‚Äúwhite cow,‚Äù the particular that is not different is expressed.

original: khra mo'i sgra dang ba'i sgra yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: khra mo'i sgra dang ba'i sgra yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren‚Äôt there also the words ‚Äúwhite‚Äù and ‚Äúcow‚Äù?

original: byas pa'i sgra la ni bye brag brjod pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba yod pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: byas pa'i sgra la ni bye brag brjod pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba yod pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: In the word ‚Äúproduced,‚Äù there is no application of a word that expresses a particular.

original: rang gi ngo bo bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to prove its own nature, he says, ‚Äúthat which has a nature that depends on the activity of another.‚Äù

original: rgyu gzhan gyi byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gyi byed pa'o //
translated: The activity of another is a cause.

original: rang gi ngo bo bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir 'grub pa'i don du gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir 'grub pa'i don du gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is to be proven is its own nature. That which depends on the activity of another for the purpose of being proven is called that.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIndeed‚Äù means ‚Äúfor what reason.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pas bshad pa de bas na tha dad pa'i bye brag tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin du brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pas bshad pa de bas na tha dad pa'i bye brag tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin du brjod do //
translated: Because it is explained in dependence on the activity of another, therefore it is said to be a nature that is a different particular.

original: tha dad pa'i bye brag gi tshig ma sbyar du zin kyang byas pa'i sgra nyid kyis tha dad pa'i bye brag gi tshig nang du 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bye brag gi tshig ma sbyar du zin kyang byas pa'i sgra nyid kyis tha dad pa'i bye brag gi tshig nang du 'dus pa yin no //
translated: Even though the word ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù is not added, the word ‚Äúproduced‚Äù itself includes the word ‚Äúdifferent.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir byas pa'i sgra 'di ni ming gi bye brag yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byas pa'i sgra 'di ni ming gi bye brag yin te /
translated: For this very reason, this word ‚Äúproduced‚Äù is a particular name.

original: gang gi phyir byas pa'i rkyen 'di ni mi la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byas pa'i rkyen 'di ni mi la byed pa yin no //
translated: Because this condition of being produced is used for humans.

original: gang du bye brag 'dus pa der ni bye brag gi tshig sbyar bar mi bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang du bye brag 'dus pa der ni bye brag gi tshig sbyar bar mi bya ba yin la /
translated: Where the particular is included, there the word ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù should not be added.

original: kha cig tu ni bye brag rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni bye brag rtogs pa yin te /
translated: But in some cases, the particular is understood.

original: dper na byas so zhes brjod pa na rgyu rnams kyis zhes bya ba 'di rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na byas so zhes brjod pa na rgyu rnams kyis zhes bya ba 'di rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when ‚Äúproduced‚Äù is said, it is understood that it is by causes.

original: der ni res 'ga' ni rgyu'i sgra sbyor bar @64a * //
analyzed: der ni res 'ga' ni rgyu'i sgra sbyor bar @64a * //
translated: There, sometimes the word ‚Äúcause‚Äù is added,

original: byed la // res 'ga' ni sbyor bar mi byed do //
analyzed: byed la // res 'ga' ni sbyor bar mi byed do //
translated: and sometimes it is not added.

original: rang gi sgras sbyor ba yang dper na rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa can nyid kyis sgra la skyen tha dad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang gi sgras sbyor ba yang dper na rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa can nyid kyis sgra la skyen tha dad pa lta bu'o //
translated: The application of the term ‚Äúown nature‚Äù is like, for example, the term ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù in ‚Äúdifferent from sound due to the difference in conditions.‚Äù

original: ji ltar byas pa'i sgra tha dad pa'i bye brag can gyi rang bzhin rjod par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pa'i sgra tha dad pa'i bye brag can gyi rang bzhin rjod par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the term ‚Äúmade‚Äù expresses the nature that is qualified by the difference of the action,

original: rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa nyid can la sogs pa gang dag yin pa dang / brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba la sogs pa'i tha dad pa'i bye brag can gyi rang bzhin rjod par byed pa de dag kyang rang bzhin rjod par byed pa'i tshig gi sbyor ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa nyid can la sogs pa gang dag yin pa dang / brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba la sogs pa'i tha dad pa'i bye brag can gyi rang bzhin rjod par byed pa de dag kyang rang bzhin rjod par byed pa'i tshig gi sbyor ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: in the same way, those terms that express the nature that is qualified by the difference of the conditions, such as ‚Äúdifferent due to the difference in conditions,‚Äù and those that express the nature that is qualified by the difference of the action, such as ‚Äúarising immediately upon the exertion,‚Äù should be regarded as the application of terms that express own nature.

original: rkyen rgyu rnams kyi bye brag khyad par yin te /
analyzed: rkyen rgyu rnams kyi bye brag khyad par yin te /
translated: The difference is the particular of the causal conditions.

original: rkyen gyi bye brag des tha dad pa can du gyur pa ngo bo gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rkyen gyi bye brag des tha dad pa can du gyur pa ngo bo gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is the nature that is different due to that difference of conditions

original: rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa can rkyen gyi gra'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa can rkyen gyi gra'o //
translated: is the difference of conditions.

original: de'i ngo bo ni rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: Its nature is that of being different due to the difference of conditions.

original: rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa nyid rkyen de las ni sgra'i byas pa bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa nyid rkyen de las ni sgra'i byas pa bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: The difference due to the difference of conditions is the probandum, the product of sound, from that condition.

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid las ni mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid las ni mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: But impermanence is from the fact of arising immediately after exertion.

original: de ni rkyen gyi bye brag gis thad dad pa'i sgra la ni tha dad pa'i khyad par brjod pa rkyen gyi bre brag gi sgra sbyor ba yin la brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i sgra la yang brtsal ba'i sgra sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni rkyen gyi bye brag gis thad dad pa'i sgra la ni tha dad pa'i khyad par brjod pa rkyen gyi bre brag gi sgra sbyor ba yin la brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i sgra la yang brtsal ba'i sgra sbyar ba yin no //
translated: In the case of sound, which is different due to the difference of conditions, the expression of the difference is the application of the word ‚Äúcondition.‚Äù In the case of the word ‚Äúarising immediately after exertion,‚Äù the word ‚Äúexertion‚Äù is applied.

original: de ltar na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis sbyor ba rnam pa gsum du bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis sbyor ba rnam pa gsum du bstan te /
translated: Thus, the application of natural reasoning is shown to be of three kinds.

original: dag pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i bye brag can dang tha dad pa'i bye brag can no //
analyzed: dag pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i bye brag can dang tha dad pa'i bye brag can no //
translated: The pure, the particular that is not different, and the particular that is different.

original: 'di de'i ltar bshad pa'i don ni 'ga' tshig gis 'khrul pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs sbyar ba la rmongs par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di de'i ltar bshad pa'i don ni 'ga' tshig gis 'khrul pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs sbyar ba la rmongs par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of this explanation is that one should not be confused about the application of natural reasoning by the words of some.

original: 'on ltar na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs de dag ci 'brel pa ma grub pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin la sbyor bar bya ba yin nam /üîΩ'on te grub pa'i rang bzhin la zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: 'on ltar na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs de dag ci 'brel pa ma grub pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin la sbyor bar bya ba yin nam / 'on te grub pa'i rang bzhin la zhes dogs pa la /
translated: If that is so, should those natural reasonings be applied to a nature of the probandum that is not established, or to a nature that is established?

original: grub pa'i rang bzhin la sbyor bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grub pa'i rang bzhin la sbyor bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In response to that qualm, in order to teach that they are applied to an established nature,

original: sgrub pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúAll of those phenomena that are established‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rtogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa'o //
translated: They are established because they are understood.

original: gzhan la brten pa'i phyir chos so //
analyzed: gzhan la brten pa'i phyir chos so //
translated: They are phenomena because they depend on something other.

original: sgrub pa'i chos kho phyir chos so //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos kho phyir chos so //
translated: They are phenomena that are established because they are established phenomena.

original: sgrub pa'i cho kho na tsam ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i cho kho na tsam ste /
translated: They are mere phenomena that are established.

original: tsam gyi sgras ltos par bya ba lhag pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: tsam gyi sgras ltos par bya ba lhag pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúmere‚Äù excludes what is additional that is relied upon.

original: de dang rjes su 'brel pa ni rjes su zhugs pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de dang rjes su 'brel pa ni rjes su zhugs pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúconcomitant‚Äù means ‚Äúconnected‚Äù and ‚Äúfollowing.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is connected with the mere property to be established is so-called.

original: gang gis grub ce na /
analyzed: gang gis grub ce na /
translated: By what is it established?

original: rang gi tshad ma ji lta bu dag gis te /
analyzed: rang gi tshad ma ji lta bu dag gis te /
translated: By what kind of valid cognition?

original: bsgrub par @64b bya ba'i chos gang gi bdag nyid kyi tshad ma gang yin pa'i tshad ma de nyid kyis grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgrub par @64b bya ba'i chos gang gi bdag nyid kyi tshad ma gang yin pa'i tshad ma de nyid kyis grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is established by that very valid cognition which is the valid cognition of the nature of the property to be established.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshig la yang dbye na rnam pa mang du yod pa'i phyir 'brel pa bsgrub pa yang tshad ma mang bas tshad dag gis zhes mang po'i tshig tu bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshig la yang dbye na rnam pa mang du yod pa'i phyir 'brel pa bsgrub pa yang tshad ma mang bas tshad dag gis zhes mang po'i tshig tu bstan to //
translated: Since there are many types of inference based on real fact when it is divided, the establishment of the relation is also by many valid cognitions. Therefore, the plural particle ‚Äús‚Äù is taught in ‚Äúby the valid cognitions.‚Äù

original: rtogs bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is to be understood, it is the probandum.

original: gzhan la brten pa'i phyir chos te /
analyzed: gzhan la brten pa'i phyir chos te /
translated: Because it depends on another, it is a property.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: It is the property to be established.

original: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: sgron ma bzhin du rung ba'i sgo nas ni gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang med na med pa nyid du nges pa yin te /
analyzed: sgron ma bzhin du rung ba'i sgo nas ni gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin gyi / 'on kyang med na med pa nyid du nges pa yin te /
translated: The reason does not prove the probandum by means of a lamp, but rather, it is the ascertainment that if the probandum does not exist, the reason does not exist.üîΩThe reason proves the probandum by means of the ascertainment that the reason definitely does not occur if the probandum does not exist.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med na ni mi 'byung bar nges pa kho na gtan tshigs kyi rtogs par byed pa'i byed pa yin gyi gzhan 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med na ni mi 'byung bar nges pa kho na gtan tshigs kyi rtogs par byed pa'i byed pa yin gyi gzhan 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: The reason does not prove the probandum by any other means.

original: thog ma gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas bsgrub par bya ba gtan tshigs dang 'brel pa gtan la dbab par byed pa /
analyzed: thog ma gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas bsgrub par bya ba gtan tshigs dang 'brel pa gtan la dbab par byed pa /
