translated: At first, the valid cognition that refutes the opposite ascertains the relation between the probandum and the reason.

original: phyis rjes su dpog par byed pa'i tshe ni byas pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes kyang sgrub par byed pa dang bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba nyid du spyir dran par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyis rjes su dpog par byed pa'i tshe ni byas pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes kyang sgrub par byed pa dang bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba nyid du spyir dran par bya ba yin no //
translated: Later, when one is inferring, one should remember in general that the reason proves the probandum, and that the reason does not occur if the probandum does not exist.

original: spyir dran pa'i don de nyid yang khyad par la sbyor bar byed pa ni sgra la yod pa'i byas pa 'di yang mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyir dran pa'i don de nyid yang khyad par la sbyor bar byed pa ni sgra la yod pa'i byas pa 'di yang mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In general, the meaning of memory is the existence of a sign, and the application of that to a particular case is, for example, ‚ÄúThis sound, which is produced, is impermanent by nature.‚Äù

original: de la spyir dran pa ni rtags shes pa yin la /
analyzed: de la spyir dran pa ni rtags shes pa yin la /
translated: In that regard, in general, memory is the knowledge of a sign.

original: bye brag tu gyur pa sgra la yod pa'i byas pa nyid mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin du dran pa'i ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu gyur pa sgra la yod pa'i byas pa nyid mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin du dran pa'i ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yin no //
translated: In particular, the memory of the fact that sound, which is produced, is impermanent by nature is inferential knowledge.

original: de ltar yin dang lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni med na mi 'byung bar shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni med na mi 'byung bar shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: In that way, the so-called realization of a hidden object is simply the knowledge of the invariable relation.

original: des na de tsam dang rjes su 'brel par nges pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na de tsam dang rjes su 'brel par nges pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the property of the subject, which is ascertained to be related to that, should be applied as the reason of nature.

original: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is not applied to anything else. This is the point.

original: sgrub par byed pa gal te de ltar sgrub par byed pa dang lhan cig 'brel pa nges par bya ba yin mod /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa gal te de ltar sgrub par byed pa dang lhan cig 'brel pa nges par bya ba yin mod /
translated: If the proof is related to the probandum in that way, then the relation is ascertained.

original: bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa nges pa ci'i phyir gsal bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa nges pa ci'i phyir gsal bar bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it made clear that the probandum is related to the mere property of the proof?

original: de nyid cas bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid cas bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúbecause of that nature.‚Äù

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa grub pa ni /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa grub pa ni /
translated: The establishment of the relation to the mere property of the proofüîΩis because of that nature.

original: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbsgrub par bya ba'i chos gang zhig sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa dang ldan pa de nyid @65a * //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro // bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gang zhig sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa dang ldan pa de nyid @65a * //
translated: The probandum is related to the mere property of the proof and possesses that nature.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos de'i ngo bo yin gyi /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos de'i ngo bo yin gyi /
translated: The probandum is the nature of the property of the proof.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: The probandum is not related to anything else.

original: 'di 'dra ba kho na rang bzhin yin du zad mod bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid la ci'i phyir gtan tshigs sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba kho na rang bzhin yin du zad mod bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid la ci'i phyir gtan tshigs sbyor zhe na /
translated: But why apply a reason to the very nature that is to be established?

original: rang bzhin yang gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because nature is a reason.

original: 'dir ni rang bzhin kho na'i gtan tshigs kyi skabs yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rang bzhin kho na'i gtan tshigs kyi skabs yin te /
translated: Here, the context is only a reason of nature.

original: de bas na sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa gang yin pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de bas na sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa gang yin pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, that which is a nature that establishes is itself that which is to be established.

original: rang bzhin yang sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang 'brel pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang 'brel pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, nature is related to the mere phenomenon that establishes it,

original: gzhan ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin gyi /
translated: but not to anything else.

original: gzhan ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: gzhan ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: If something else were the nature that establishes the phenomenon to be established,

original: 'o na ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then one part of the meaning of the thesis would become the reason.

original: dngos su na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos su na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn actuality,‚Äù

original: don dam par ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag de'i bdag nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam par ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag de'i bdag nyid yin gyi /
translated: because in actuality, that which is to be established and that which establishes it are the same nature.

original: sgor btags te bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: sgor btags te bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa yin no //
translated: and the object to be established and the means of establishing are different.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po ni nges pa la gnas pa'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po ni nges pa la gnas pa'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: The object to be established and the means of establishing are essentially fixed.

original: nges pa la gnas pa'i ngo bo phan tshun ldog pas byas pa'i sgo btags pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa des na sgrub par byed pa yang gzhan /
analyzed: nges pa la gnas pa'i ngo bo phan tshun ldog pas byas pa'i sgo btags pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa des na sgrub par byed pa yang gzhan /
translated: Since the essence of what is fixed is differentiated by the difference of the exclusion that is mutually created, the means of establishing is different.

original: sgrub par byed pa dang bsgrub par bya ba yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa dang bsgrub par bya ba yang gzhan yin no //
translated: The object to be established and the means of establishing are different.

original: 'di ltar thag ring po nas yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don la shing zhes ni nges la /
analyzed: 'di ltar thag ring po nas yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don la shing zhes ni nges la /
translated: Thus, from a distance one ascertains the object that has branches, etc. to be a tree,

original: shing sha pa zhes ni ma nges mod kyi /
analyzed: shing sha pa zhes ni ma nges mod kyi /
translated: but one does not ascertain it to be a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ tree.

original: de lta na de nyid shing yin la sha pa yang de nyid de /
analyzed: de lta na de nyid shing yin la sha pa yang de nyid de /
translated: In that case, that very thing is a tree and that very thing is a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ tree.

original: des na dngos po la tha dad pa med kyang nges pas ldog pa'i dbye ba tha dad par kun du ston par byed do //
analyzed: des na dngos po la tha dad pa med kyang nges pas ldog pa'i dbye ba tha dad par kun du ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore, although there is no difference in the thing, ascertainment displays a difference in the division of the exclusion.

original: de lta bas na nges pa la gnas pa'i ngo bo la ltos nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na nges pa la gnas pa'i ngo bo la ltos nas /
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the nature of the ascertainment,

original: sgrub par byed pa yang gzhan bsgrub par bya ba yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yang gzhan bsgrub par bya ba yang gzhan yin la /
translated: the proof is one thing and the probandum is another.

original: des na dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs ma yin la /
analyzed: des na dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs ma yin la /
translated: Thus, one part of the meaning of the thesis is not the logical reason,

original: dngos su na de'i bdag nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: dngos su na de'i bdag nyid kyang yin no //
translated: but in reality, it is also its nature.

original: ci'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa kho na sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa kho na sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that only the mere property of the logical reason that is related to the probandum is the nature of the proof, and not anything else?

original: de grub pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de grub pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the establishment of that.‚Äù

original: gang zhig gang dang rjes su 'brel pa de ni de grub pa na ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang rjes su 'brel pa de ni de grub pa na ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is related to something is not non-established when that is established.

original: gnag gi phyir de grub pa na ma grub pa de ni sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: gnag gi phyir de grub pa na ma grub pa de ni sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Because of that, when that is established, it is not logical that it is the nature of the proof of that which is non-established.

original: 'di ltar grub pa dang ma grub pa nyid ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar grub pa dang ma grub pa nyid ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis yin la /
translated: Thus, establishment and non-establishment are the two, entity and non-entity.

original: @65b dngos po dang dngos po med pa yang phan tshun spangs te /üîΩgnas pa yin te /
analyzed: @65b dngos po dang dngos po med pa yang phan tshun spangs te / gnas pa yin te /
translated: And an entity and a nonentity are mutually exclusive.üîΩIf an entity and a nonentity were one,

original: ci ste sngar grub pa dang ma grub pa gcig yin par gyur na ni don gcig kho na la dus gcig tu dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis su 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste sngar grub pa dang ma grub pa gcig yin par gyur na ni don gcig kho na la dus gcig tu dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis su 'gyur na /
translated: then a single entity would be both an entity and a nonentity.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa 'gal ba dag gcig tu rigs su yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa 'gal ba dag gcig tu rigs su yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not tenable for an entity and a nonentity, which are mutually exclusive, to be one.

original: gcig ma yin pa ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig ma yin pa ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is not one has a nature that possesses mutually exclusive attributes.

original: gzhan yang phyis skye ba ni sngar skye ba las tha dad pa'i rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyis skye ba ni sngar skye ba las tha dad pa'i rgyu can yin la /
translated: Moreover, later arising is caused by earlier arising.

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa yang rgyu tha dad pa sngon du song ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa yang rgyu tha dad pa sngon du song ba yin no //
translated: And a different effect is preceded by a different cause.

original: de bas na grub pa dang ma grub pa gnyis mi mthun pa'i chos tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi tha dad pa yin la tha dad pa'i rgyu can yang byed rgyu tha da pa yin pas ji ltar gcig yin /
analyzed: de bas na grub pa dang ma grub pa gnyis mi mthun pa'i chos tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi tha dad pa yin la tha dad pa'i rgyu can yang byed rgyu tha da pa yin pas ji ltar gcig yin /
translated: Therefore, since that which is established and that which is not established are different, having a nature that is a collection of incompatible attributes, and since a different cause is the cause of a different effect, how could they be one?

original: de bas na sgrub par byed pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na sgrub par byed pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the probandum is merely the relation to the proving property.

original: gzhan na mi yin no //
analyzed: gzhan na mi yin no //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: phyis grub pa sngar skyes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin du zad mod kyi /
analyzed: phyis grub pa sngar skyes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin du zad mod kyi /
translated: It is not the case that the probandum is the nature that arises later, after the proving property.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the probandum?

original: sngar skyes pas phyis grub pa la 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: sngar skyes pas phyis grub pa la 'khrul pa ste /
translated: The error is that the probandum arises later, after the proving property.

original: yongs su gtong ba gang yin pa de yang srid pa'i phyir 'grub pa ni sngar grub pa'i bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gtong ba gang yin pa de yang srid pa'i phyir 'grub pa ni sngar grub pa'i bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it is possible that the probandum is relinquished, the probandum is not the nature that is established earlier.

original: de bas na sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa kho na rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: de bas na sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa kho na rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Therefore, the nature is merely the relation to the proving property.

original: de yang bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: And that is the probandum.

original: de ltar na ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa grub pa kho na la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs sbyar bar bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar na ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa grub pa kho na la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs sbyar bar bya bar gnas so //
translated: In that case, it is established that the nature is the relation to the proving property alone, and the probative argument is applied to that which is established.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba la skabs kyis na chos mthun pa nyid can zhes bya ba ltos par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba la skabs kyis na chos mthun pa nyid can zhes bya ba ltos par bya ba yin no //
translated: In the syllogism of the effect as reason, the word ‚Äúsimilar‚Äù is to be supplied according to the context.

original: gang na du ba yod pa zhes du ba rjes su brjod nas /
analyzed: gang na du ba yod pa zhes du ba rjes su brjod nas /
translated: ‚Äú Where there is smoke‚Äù ‚Äî having stated the smoke ‚Äî

original: de na me yod de zhes bya ba ni me yod pa rjes su sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de na me yod de zhes bya ba ni me yod pa rjes su sgrub pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú there is fire‚Äù ‚Äî this is the establishment of the presence of fire.

original: de ltar na snga ma bzhin du nges pa'i don khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na snga ma bzhin du nges pa'i don khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the meaning should be understood as before.

original: des ni rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi khyab pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi khyab pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the pervasion based on the reason of the existence of cause and effect.

original: khyab pa sgrub pa tshad ma'i yul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyab pa sgrub pa tshad ma'i yul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the object of the valid cognition that establishes the pervasion,

original: dper na tshang bang la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na tshang bang la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúFor example, in a kitchen, etc.‚Äù

original: tshang bang la sogs par mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa gnyis kyi rgyu dag 'bras bu'i dngos po'i bdag nyid med na mi 'byung ba nges pa yin no //
analyzed: tshang bang la sogs par mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa gnyis kyi rgyu dag 'bras bu'i dngos po'i bdag nyid med na mi 'byung ba nges pa yin no //
translated: In a kitchen, etc., the two, direct perception and non-apprehension, ascertain the cause and effect as having the nature of the absence of non-occurrence.

original: 'di na yang du ba yod do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la phyogs kyi chos nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di na yang du ba yod do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la phyogs kyi chos nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: Here, there is smoke is the inclusion of the property of the subject.

original: @66a * // 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi /
analyzed: @66a * // 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig la ma yin gyi /
translated: Here also means not only in the case of a reason based on nature, but also in the case of a reason based on effect.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'dir yang ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'dir yang ngo //
translated: Here also means in the case of a reason based on effect.

original: grub pa kho na zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa nges pa kho na la ste /
analyzed: grub pa kho na zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa nges pa kho na la ste /
translated: Only when established means only when the relation of cause and effect is ascertained.

original: nges pa ni gdon mi za bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: nges pa ni gdon mi za bar bya dgos so //
translated: What is ascertained must necessarily be done.

original: 'di bltar rung ba tsam gyi sgo nas gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di bltar rung ba tsam gyi sgo nas gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not a reason that makes one understand by mere appearance.

original: med pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: med pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Because it is not nonexistent, as has been explained.

original: chos mthun pa can gyi rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa yin no //üîΩchos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos mthun pa can gyi rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa yin no // chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This shows the application of nature, effect, and non-apprehension that have a similar property.üîΩTo show the application that has a dissimilar property, he says:

original: chos mi mthun pa nyid can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa nyid can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The application that has a dissimilar property.

original: gang yod pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang yod pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which is called existent is that which has become the object of perception.

original: bltar rung ba yod pa gang yin pa zhes bod pa nyid du rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bltar rung ba yod pa gang yin pa zhes bod pa nyid du rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: That which is called existent is that which is suitable to be seen.

original: de ni dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa nyid bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa nyid bsgrub pa'o //
translated: That is only the object of perception.

original: des na 'dis ni snang ba yod pa la mthong ba'i yul nyid kyis khyab pa bstan to //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni snang ba yod pa la mthong ba'i yul nyid kyis khyab pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that the existence of appearance is pervaded by the object of seeing.

original: med pa log pa nges pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa log pas khyab pa bstan to //
analyzed: med pa log pa nges pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa log pas khyab pa bstan to //
translated: Since the non-existence of the opposite is ascertained, the absence of the proof is pervaded.

original: de bas na khyab par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na ni gtan tshigs kyang yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na khyab par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na ni gtan tshigs kyang yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, if the property to be established, the pervader, is absent, the reason also cannot be present.

original: gtan tshigs med pas bsgrub par bya ba med pa la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs med pas bsgrub par bya ba med pa la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the absence of the reason pervades the absence of the probandum.

original: gtan tshigs kyang yod do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyang yod do //
translated: The reason is also present.

original: de bas na khyab par byed pa sgrub bar byed pa med pas khyab par bya ba bsgrub bar bya ba med pa med de /
analyzed: de bas na khyab par byed pa sgrub bar byed pa med pas khyab par bya ba bsgrub bar bya ba med pa med de /
translated: Therefore, the absence of the probandum, which is pervaded by the absence of the proof, the pervader, is absent.

original: des na bsgrub par bya ba nges pa yin na /
analyzed: des na bsgrub par bya ba nges pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the probandum is ascertained,

original: de bas na chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba thams cad du sgrub par byed pa med pa nges par bstan par bya ba yin no zhes rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba thams cad du sgrub par byed pa med pa nges par bstan par bya ba yin no zhes rigs pa yin no //
translated: then in all syllogisms with dissimilar reasons, the absence of the proof must be indicated. This is the principle.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the syllogism with a reason of nature that has a dissimilar reason,

original: mi rtag pa nyid med na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid med na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf impermanence did not exist . . .‚Äù

original: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid med pa gtan tshigs med pa la nges par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid med pa gtan tshigs med pa la nges par brjod pa yin te /
translated: Here, the absence of the probandum, impermanence, is definitely stated to be the absence of the reason.

original: de bas na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gsum char yang gtan tshigs med par bsgrub par bya ba med pa la nges par khyab par bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gsum char yang gtan tshigs med par bsgrub par bya ba med pa la nges par khyab par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, in all three types of reasons of nature, the absence of the probandum is definitely pervaded by the absence of the reason.

original: sgra ni yod pa'am /
analyzed: sgra ni yod pa'am /
translated: Sound is existent,

original: skye ba dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa'am /
translated: or it possesses arising,üîΩor it is produced.

original: byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni gsum ka'i yang phyogs kyi chos bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni gsum ka'i yang phyogs kyi chos bstan pa'o //
translated: These are the demonstration of the property of the subject in all three.

original: 'dir yang khyab par byed pa sgrub par byed pa @66b med par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang khyab par byed pa sgrub par byed pa @66b med par brjod pa yin te /
translated: Here, too, the absence of the proof of the pervasion is stated.

original: de bas na khyab par byed pa sgrub par byed pa med pa yang log pas bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na khyab par byed pa sgrub par byed pa med pa yang log pas bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the absence of the proof of the pervasion is also stated, and so the object to be proven is understood.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of the effect reason that has the property of the dissimilar is stated:

original: me med na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: me med na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is no fire . . .‚Äù

original: 'dir yang me med pa la du ba med pas khyab par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir yang me med pa la du ba med pas khyab par bstan to //
translated: Here, too, the absence of fire is pervaded by the absence of smoke.

original: 'di na ni du ba yod do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa du ba med pa med do zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di na ni du ba yod do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa du ba med pa med do zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHere there is smoke‚Äù indicates the absence of the absence of the pervader, smoke.

original: de bas na khyab par bya ba me med pas na bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa yin no //üîΩchos mthun pa nyid can la yang ldog pa ma bstan la /
analyzed: de bas na khyab par bya ba me med pas na bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa yin no // chos mthun pa nyid can la yang ldog pa ma bstan la /
translated: Therefore, the object to be proven is understood from the absence of the pervaded, fire.üîΩIn the case of the reason having the property of the similar, the counter pervasion is not stated.

original: chos mi mthun pa nyid can la yang rjes su 'gro ba ma bstan na de ji ltar tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa nyid can la yang rjes su 'gro ba ma bstan na de ji ltar tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa yin zhe na /
translated: In the case of the reason having the property of the dissimilar, the forward pervasion is not stated. So how is it that the three modes of the reason are stated?

original: don gyis na chos mthun pas kyang ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don gyis na chos mthun pas kyang ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In fact, even when a syllogism is formulated that has a similar property,

original: brjod par bya ba chos mthun pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba byas pa la yang don gyis te shugs kyis na /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba chos mthun pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba byas pa la yang don gyis te shugs kyis na /
translated: by implication,

original: chos mi mthun pa nyid ldog pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa nyid ldog pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: one understands the contrapositive that has a dissimilar property.

original: ni'i don ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: ni'i don ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúni‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: de lta na ni de bas na tshul gsum pa'i rtags 'chad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni de bas na tshul gsum pa'i rtags 'chad pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the reason that has three modes is explained.

original: gal te yang rjes su 'gro ba la ldog pa ma smras su zin kyang rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig gi shugs nyid kyis khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang rjes su 'gro ba la ldog pa ma smras su zin kyang rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig gi shugs nyid kyis khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one does not state the contrapositive of the reason, the contrapositive is understood by the force of the statement of the positive concomitance.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: blos rtogs pa'i ldog pa de med na sgrub par byed pa la gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba blos yid ches pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blos rtogs pa'i ldog pa de med na sgrub par byed pa la gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba blos yid ches pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the contrapositive is not understood, then the mind does not believe that the reason is concomitant with the probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs nges par ni rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig las khong du chud par bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa yod par dogs pa mi bya ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs nges par ni rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig las khong du chud par bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa yod par dogs pa mi bya ste /
translated: In the proof of something to be established, the reason is ascertained from the words expressing the positive concomitance. One should not doubt that the probandum exists when the probans exists.

original: de ltar ma yin na bsgrub par bya ba la nges pa nyid yin par mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na bsgrub par bya ba la nges pa nyid yin par mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, one would not understand that the probandum is ascertained.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med bar rtog pa yang ldog pa rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med bar rtog pa yang ldog pa rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The understanding of the counter-positive is also the understanding that the probans does not exist when the probandum does not exist.

original: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig las bsgrub par bya ba la sgrub bar byed pa yod par rjod pa'i shugs kyis ldog pa rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig las bsgrub par bya ba la sgrub bar byed pa yod par rjod pa'i shugs kyis ldog pa rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the understanding of the counter-positive is by implication from the statement that the probandum exists when the probans exists, from the words expressing the positive concomitance.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig la ji lta ba de bzhin du don gyis na chos mi mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba rjes su 'gro ba ma brjod du zin kyang rtogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig la ji lta ba de bzhin du don gyis na chos mi mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba rjes su 'gro ba ma brjod du zin kyang rtogs so //
translated: Just as means that just as it is from the words expressing the positive concomitance, so it is from the meaning that one understands the application with a dissimilar example, even though the positive concomitance is not stated.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: blos bzung ba'i rjes su 'gro ba de med na ni bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: blos bzung ba'i rjes su 'gro ba de med na ni bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: If there were no concomitance with what is grasped by the mind, then the reason would not be established as nonexistent when the probandum is nonexistent.

original: khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no understanding.

original: @67a * // gtan tshigs med pa la bsgrub bya med pa nges par ni ldog pa'i tshig las khong du chud pas gtan tshigs yod pa la bsgrub par bya ba med par dogs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: @67a * // gtan tshigs med pa la bsgrub bya med pa nges par ni ldog pa'i tshig las khong du chud pas gtan tshigs yod pa la bsgrub par bya ba med par dogs par mi bya ste /
translated: When the reason is nonexistent, the probandum is ascertained as nonexistent by the statement of the contrapositive. Therefore, when the reason exists, the probandum should not be doubted as nonexistent.

original: de ltar ma yin na gtan tshigs med pa las nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na gtan tshigs med pa las nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, it would not be ascertained from the nonexistent reason.

original: gtan tshigs yod na yang bsgrub par bya ba yod par rtogs kyang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs yod na yang bsgrub par bya ba yod par rtogs kyang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Even when the reason exists, the existence of the probandum is understood, but the concomitance is understood.

original: de bas na ldog pa'i tshig la sgrub par byed pa med pa las bsgrub par bya ba med par nges par brjod pa'i shugs kyis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ldog pa'i tshig la sgrub par byed pa med pa las bsgrub par bya ba med par nges par brjod pa'i shugs kyis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the statement of the contrapositive, the existence of the probandum is ascertained as nonexistent from the nonexistent reason. By the force of that, the concomitance is understood.

original: ci ste nam mkha' la sogs pa las bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med du zin kyang /
analyzed: ci ste nam mkha' la sogs pa las bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med du zin kyang /
translated: But if the object of affirmation does not exist in space, etc., then even though the means of affirmation does not exist,

original: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang ci'i phyir gtan tshigs yod na bsgrub par bya ba yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang ci'i phyir gtan tshigs yod na bsgrub par bya ba yod ce na /
translated: why is it that if the reason exists, the object of affirmation exists?

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa med na ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa med na ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf there is no natural relation,‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de'i rang bzhin gyis 'brel pa gang yin pa de med na bsgrub par bya ba cig shos log pas sgrub par byed pa gzhan nges pa dang ldan zhing nges pa can du log pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i rang bzhin gyis 'brel pa gang yin pa de med na bsgrub par bya ba cig shos log pas sgrub par byed pa gzhan nges pa dang ldan zhing nges pa can du log pa ma yin no //
translated: because if there is no natural relation between them, then if the object of affirmation is reversed, the means of affirmation is not definitely reversed.

original: 'brel pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin 'brel pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te gang la de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid rgyu mtshan du yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin 'brel pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te gang la de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid rgyu mtshan du yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: All relations are natural relations, and that is of two types: that which has the characteristic of its nature as a reason is so-called,

original: gang la de las mtshan nyid yod pa de la de skad bya ste /
analyzed: gang la de las mtshan nyid yod pa de la de skad bya ste /
translated: and that which has the characteristic of that as a reason is so-called.

original: gang zhig gang du 'brel pa'i yul gyi don de ni rang bzhin nam rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang du 'brel pa'i yul gyi don de ni rang bzhin nam rgyu yin te /
translated: That object which is related to that is either its nature or its cause.

original: gzhan du 'brel pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'brel pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because otherwise, the relation itself would be untenable.

original: de bas na rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes bsgrub par bya ba'i don rtags 'brel pa de yang zhes bya ba der bshad zin to //
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes bsgrub par bya ba'i don rtags 'brel pa de yang zhes bya ba der bshad zin to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the probandum, ‚Äúit is of two kinds,‚Äù and the reason, ‚Äúbecause of the existence of the relation,‚Äù have already been explained.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù means ‚Äúsince.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa yod na bzlog par bya ba dang ldog par byed pa yod pa yin pa de bas na bsgrub par bya ba log na sgrub par byed pa ldog par brjod pas ni zlog par byed pa gnyis kyi 'brel pa bstan par byaüîΩba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa yod na bzlog par bya ba dang ldog par byed pa yod pa yin pa de bas na bsgrub par bya ba log na sgrub par byed pa ldog par brjod pas ni zlog par byed pa gnyis kyi 'brel pa bstan par bya ba yin te /
translated: Since, when there is a relation of intrinsic nature, there is the probandum and the probans, therefore, when the probandum is negated, the probans is said to be negated. By this, the relation of the two negations is shown.

original: ci ste sgrub par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa yin pa de lta na ni bsgrub par bya ba la log pa na nges par ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste sgrub par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa yin pa de lta na ni bsgrub par bya ba la log pa na nges par ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the probans is related to the probandum, then, when the probandum is negated, the probans is certainly negated.

original: gang gi phyir 'brel par bya ba yin pa de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba log na sgrub par byed pa log pa'i tshig gang yin pa de 'brel pa bstan pas bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'brel par bya ba yin pa de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba log na sgrub par byed pa log pa'i tshig gang yin pa de 'brel pa bstan pas bsdus pa yin la /
translated: Because it is related in that way, the statement ‚Äúwhen the probandum is negated, the probans is negated‚Äù is included in the demonstration of the relation.

original: gang yang des ba sdus pa 'brel pa bstan pa de nyid rjes @67b su 'gro ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gang yang des ba sdus pa 'brel pa bstan pa de nyid rjes @67b su 'gro ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: And that which is included by that is the statement of the pervasion.

original: 'brel pa yang nges pa bstan par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa yang nges pa bstan par bya ba yin te /
translated: The relation also must be demonstrated,

original: de ltar na brjod par bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na brjod par bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: and in that way the probandum is pervaded.

original: gang yi phyir dpe la tshad mas 'brel pa bstan pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang yi phyir dpe la tshad mas 'brel pa bstan pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba yin gyi /
translated: Because the demonstration of the relation by means of an example is itself the pervasion,

original: gzhan ni gang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni gang yin te /
translated: what else could it be?

original: de bas na bzlog par bya ba dang zlog par byed pa dag 'brel bar byed par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bzlog par bya ba dang zlog par byed pa dag 'brel bar byed par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the probandum and the probans should be understood to be related.

original: de ltar na yang rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyang shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyang shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, the pervasion is also understood.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu'i don te /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu'i don te /
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúthus‚Äù has the meaning of cause.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba la yang ldog pa rtogs la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba la yang ldog pa rtogs la /
translated: Because when there is concomitance, the opposite is understood,

original: ldog pas kyang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa de bas na tshig gcig gis kyang mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pas kyang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa de bas na tshig gcig gis kyang mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga bstan pa yin no //
translated: and when there is the opposite, concomitance is understood, therefore, even with a single statement, both existence and nonexistence in similar and dissimilar cases are indicated.

original: 'di brjod byar yin pa'i phyir na rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo ste /
analyzed: 'di brjod byar yin pa'i phyir na rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo ste /
translated: Since this is what is to be expressed, it is the door of concomitance.

original: thabs gang la yod pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo can te dag go //
analyzed: thabs gang la yod pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo can te dag go //
translated: That which has a method is one that has the door of concomitance.

original: de bzhin du ldog pa'i sgo ste thabs gang yod pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du ldog pa'i sgo ste thabs gang yod pa zhes bya ba /
translated: Similarly, it is the door of the opposite, that which has a method.

original: bas zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i don te /
analyzed: bas zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù has the meaning of cause.

original: gang gang gi phyir gcig gis kyang gnyi ga rtogs pa de bas na sgrub par byed pa'i tshig gcig la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i tshig gi sbyor ba gnyi ga nges par bya ba med de /
analyzed: gang gang gi phyir gcig gis kyang gnyi ga rtogs pa de bas na sgrub par byed pa'i tshig gcig la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i tshig gi sbyor ba gnyi ga nges par bya ba med de /
translated: Since both are understood by one, therefore, in a single statement of proof, both the application of the words of concomitance and the opposite are not to be ascertained.

original: don rtogs par byed pa'i phyir sgra sbyor bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: don rtogs par byed pa'i phyir sgra sbyor bar byed pa yin la /
translated: Because the meaning is to be understood, the words are applied.

original: don kyang rtogs zin na sbyor bas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: don kyang rtogs zin na sbyor bas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: If the meaning is already understood, what is the use of the proof?

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig gcig po zhig sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i tshig gcig po zhig sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: One should employ only the term ‚Äúpervasion.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa la yang ldog pa bstan pa'i sgo nas rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la yang ldog pa bstan pa'i sgo nas rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa yin te /
translated: In the case of non-apprehension, one should understand the pervasion by means of the teaching of the contraposition.

original: gang yod pa la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid log ba'i rang bzhin bltar rung ba yod pa nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang yod pa la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid log ba'i rang bzhin bltar rung ba yod pa nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is existent and is the object of apprehension‚Äù indicates the existence of the nature of the opposite of the suitability of the expression of the absence of the probandum.

original: de ni dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa log pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa log pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid brjod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat would be the very object of apprehension‚Äù indicates the non-apprehension of the nature of the opposite of the non-apprehension.

original: des na 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba log pa la sgrub par byed pa log pas khyab pa bstan to //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba log pa la sgrub par byed pa log pas khyab pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, this teaches the pervasion that the absence of the probandum is necessarily the absence of the proof.

original: ci ste sgrub par byed pa yod kyang bsgrub par bya ba ldog par 'gyur na ni sgrub par byed pa med pas khyab pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste sgrub par byed pa yod kyang bsgrub par bya ba ldog par 'gyur na ni sgrub par byed pa med pas khyab pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the probandum were absent even when the proof is present, then the pervasion by the absence of the proof would not occur.

original: de bas na khyab pa bstan ba khong du chud par byed pas sgrub par byed pa yod pa la ni bsgrub par bya yod pas khyab pa bstan par bya'o //üîΩde bas na de 'dra ba mi dmigs pa @68a * //
analyzed: de bas na khyab pa bstan ba khong du chud par byed pas sgrub par byed pa yod pa la ni bsgrub par bya yod pas khyab pa bstan par bya'o // de bas na de 'dra ba mi dmigs pa @68a * //
translated: Therefore, since the pervasion is being taught, the existence of the proof must pervade the existence of the probandum.

original: ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúthe non-observation of such and such . . .‚Äù

original: snang ba med do zhes bya bar yid ches pa la rjes su 'gro ba sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med do zhes bya bar yid ches pa la rjes su 'gro ba sgrub pa'o //
translated: The proof is the ascertainment that ‚Äúit does not appear.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir sgrub par byed pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang / de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba gnyis kyi 'brel par rtogs par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgrub par byed pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang / de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba gnyis kyi 'brel par rtogs par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because the proof must be understood as the relation between the property of the probandum and its nature or its effect, therefore

original: sbyor ba gnyi ga la yang phyogs bstan par bya ba nges pa med do //
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyi ga la yang phyogs bstan par bya ba nges pa med do //
translated: in both syllogisms the subject is not necessarily taught.

original: bsgrub par bya ba nges par rtogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de nyid chos can la mthong ba las bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nges par rtogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de nyid chos can la mthong ba las bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The proof that ascertains the probandum is that very proof that is seen in the subject, because it is understood from the proof.

original: des na bsgrub par bya ba bstan pas ni ci yang byar med do //
analyzed: des na bsgrub par bya ba bstan pas ni ci yang byar med do //
translated: Therefore, there is nothing to be done by teaching the probandum.

original: de bas bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa'i dgos pa med do //
analyzed: de bas bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa'i dgos pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no need to state the probandum.

original: don 'di nyid mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba la ston to //
analyzed: don 'di nyid mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba la ston to //
translated: This very point is taught in the application of non-apprehension.

original: chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la shugs kyis phyogs 'di ni bum pa med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la shugs kyis phyogs 'di ni bum pa med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the application of similarity, it is implied that this place is devoid of pot.

original: shugs de ci zhe na /
analyzed: shugs de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that implication?

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa gang yang ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa gang yang ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: The statement whatever is characterized by being apprehensible is not apprehended is a reference to non-apprehension.

original: de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin pa la zhes bya ba de ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin pa la zhes bya ba de ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid sgrub pa'o //
translated: The statement that is the object of the convention of non-existence establishes the suitability of the convention of non-existence.

original: de lta yin dang snang ba mi dmigs pa la ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid kyis khyab par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang snang ba mi dmigs pa la ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid kyis khyab par bstan pa yin no //
translated: If that were the case, it would be taught that in the non-apprehension of appearance, there is pervasion by the suitability of the convention of non-existence.

original: 'di na yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la rtags yod par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di na yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la rtags yod par bstan to //
translated: Here too, by whatever is characterized by being apprehensible and so on, the presence of the reason in the probandum subject is taught.

original: ci ste bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the probandum, the subject, does not have the probandum, the property, then the probans, the property, also does not exist.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shugs yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shugs yin no //
translated: Because the probans, the property, is ascertained in the probandum, the property, this is the implication.

original: chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la ji lta ba bzhin du chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la yang shugs nyid kyis 'dir yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul bum pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la ji lta ba bzhin du chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi sbyor ba la yang shugs nyid kyis 'dir yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul bum pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as in the case of a syllogism with a similar instance, in the case of a syllogism with a dissimilar instance, by implication, it would follow that the object of the expression ‚Äúexists‚Äù is not a pot that exists.

original: shugs bstan pa'i phyir yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shugs bstan pa'i phyir yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to show the implication, he says, ‚Äúthe object of the expression ‚Äòexists.‚Äô‚Äù

original: yod pa'am dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni snang ba zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yod pa'am dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni snang ba zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúExists‚Äù or ‚Äúhas the characteristic of being perceived‚Äù is what is meant by ‚Äúappears.‚Äù

original: 'di bsgrub par bya ba la log pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di bsgrub par bya ba la log pa yin no //
translated: This is the opposite of what is to be established.

original: dmigs pa kho nar gyur na zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa log pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa kho nar gyur na zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa log pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf there were only the object‚Äù is the negation of the proof.

original: 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba log pa la sgrub par byed pa log pas khyab pa @68b bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba log pa la sgrub par byed pa log pas khyab pa @68b bstan to //
translated: This shows that the negation of the probandum entails the negation of the proof.

original: 'di na de 'dra ba'i bum pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gzhan na snang ba mi dmigs pa de ltar phyogs 'di na snang ba de 'dra ba'i bum pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di na de 'dra ba'i bum pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gzhan na snang ba mi dmigs pa de ltar phyogs 'di na snang ba de 'dra ba'i bum pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHere, such a pot is not perceived‚Äù means that just as it is perceived elsewhere, such a pot is not perceived here.

original: 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba log pa'i khyab par byed bsgrub par byed pa log pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba log pa'i khyab par byed bsgrub par byed pa log pa med par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the negation of the probandum on the subject entails the negation of the proof.

original: ci ste bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyang med par 'gyur na sgrub par byed pa'i chos can ni yod do zhes bya ba ni shugs yin no //
analyzed: ci ste bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyang med par 'gyur na sgrub par byed pa'i chos can ni yod do zhes bya ba ni shugs yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the probandum does not exist on the subject, then the probandum would not exist, but the proof does exist‚Äù is the implication.

original: de bas na shugs kyis 'di na bum pa / de do zhes bya bar khong du chung par 'gyur bas phyogs mi bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na shugs kyis 'di na bum pa / de do zhes bya bar khong du chung par 'gyur bas phyogs mi bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is understood by implication that ‚Äúhere there is a pot‚Äù and ‚Äúthere it is not,‚Äù the position is not stated.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la yang de khong du chung bar 'gyur bas phyogs mi bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la yang de khong du chung bar 'gyur bas phyogs mi bstan to //
translated: Similarly, in the case of an effect reason and a nature reason, since it is understood by implication, the position is not stated.

original: phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis don ji lta bu zhig bstan par bya ba yin brjod par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis don ji lta bu zhig bstan par bya ba yin brjod par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning that the term ‚Äúposition‚Äù is to teach?

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nar zhes smos te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nar zhes smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúin its own nature alone.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i kho nar ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i kho nar ro //
translated: It is in the probandum alone.

original: bdag nyid dang zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own‚Äù refers to the opponent.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni smras pa 'ga' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni smras pa 'ga' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúDesired‚Äù means not just any statement,

original: 'dod pa yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but what is desired.

original: de lta bu de yang mngon sum la sogs pas ma bsal ba'i don gang yin pa de phyogs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de lta bu de yang mngon sum la sogs pas ma bsal ba'i don gang yin pa de phyogs zhes brjod do //
translated: That is also called a ‚Äúposition‚Äù if its meaning is not refuted by perception and so on.

original: ci ste phyogs bstan par bya ba ma yin na go ji ltar mi bstan par bya ba'i mtshan nyid brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste phyogs bstan par bya ba ma yin na go ji ltar mi bstan par bya ba'i mtshan nyid brjod ce na /
translated: If it is not to be established, then how can one state the definition of what is not to be established?

original: sgrub par byed pa'i rang gi yan lag yin pa'i phyir 'di'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i rang gi yan lag yin pa'i phyir 'di'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The definition of the thesis is not stated because it is a part of the proof.

original: 'on kyang kha cig bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa la ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba la yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par shes te /
analyzed: 'on kyang kha cig bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa la ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba la yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par shes te /
translated: But some think that what is to be established is not to be established, and what is to be established is not to be established.

original: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba dang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa de la log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba dang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa de la log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the definition of the thesis is stated in order to eliminate that misconception about what is to be established and what is not to be established.

original: rang gi ngo bor 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúthat which is asserted as its own nature‚Äù is:

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa yin gyi zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa yin gyi zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: ‚Äúthat which is asserted as the property to be established.‚Äù

original: phyogs la ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ngo bo gzhan med do //
analyzed: phyogs la ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ngo bo gzhan med do //
translated: The thesis is not a different nature from the property to be established.

original: de bas na rang gi ngo bo ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang gi ngo bo ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, its own nature is what is to be established.

original: kho na'i sgra'i bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kho na'i sgra'i bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the word ‚Äúonly,‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bo kho na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúonly its own nature.‚Äù

original: kho na'i sgra'i logs shig tu bshad par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: kho na'i sgra'i logs shig tu bshad par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù explained as something else?

original: ci'i phyir rang gi ngo bo'i sgra dang 'brel par bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang gi ngo bo'i sgra dang 'brel par bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it explained as connected with the word ‚Äúown nature‚Äù?

original: @69a * // brjod pa kho na'i sgra ni gsal bar byed pa'i tshig gi phrad yin pas tshig gzhan gyis brjod par bya ba'i don gyi khyad par gsal bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: @69a * // brjod pa kho na'i sgra ni gsal bar byed pa'i tshig gi phrad yin pas tshig gzhan gyis brjod par bya ba'i don gyi khyad par gsal bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is a verbal particle that clarifies, so it clarifies the meaning of a different word.

original: des na khyad par can brjod pa'i tshig gzhan dang lhan cig gcig tu bstan to //
analyzed: des na khyad par can brjod pa'i tshig gzhan dang lhan cig gcig tu bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught as one with the word that expresses the qualifier.üîΩIt is not that it is established,

original: sgrub pa nyid yin yang rung ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: sgrub pa nyid yin yang rung ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa yin la /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIt is not that it is established,‚Äù because it is asserted to be the means of establishing.

original: ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir na bsgrub par bya ba nyid du yang 'dod pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir na bsgrub par bya ba nyid du yang 'dod pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is not established, it is also asserted to be what is to be established. In order to eliminate that,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúIt is not that it is not established.‚Äù

original: kho na'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: kho na'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is mentioned.

original: de'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir dper na sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs mig gis gzung ba nyid sgra la ma grub pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin na ni zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa
analyzed: de'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir dper na sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs mig gis gzung ba nyid sgra la ma grub pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yin na ni zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa
translated: In order to demonstrate that example, it says, ‚ÄúFor example, in the proof of sound as impermanent, if the reason, perceptible by the eye, were not established with respect to sound, then it would be the thesis.‚Äù This demonstrates that it is asserted as the thesis.

original: bstan to // de zhes bya ba ni mig gis bzung ba nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: bstan to // de zhes bya ba ni mig gis bzung ba nyid la bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to perceptible by the eye.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni sgra la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni sgra la bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú Here‚Äù refers to sound.

original: bsgrub par bya ba kho nar ni mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i nges pa med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba kho nar ni mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i nges pa med par ston pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú It is not asserted as only the thesis‚Äù demonstrates that there is no certainty that it is asserted as the thesis.

original: sgrub pa kho nar brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sgrub par byed pa nyid du yang 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sgrub pa kho nar brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sgrub par byed pa nyid du yang 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: ‚Äú Because it is stated as only the proof‚Äù means that because it is asserted as only the proof,

original: bsgrub par bya ba kho nar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba kho nar ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not asserted as only the thesis.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni rang nyid kyi sgra bshad byar bkod nas de'i don bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩrgol bas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni rang nyid kyi sgra bshad byar bkod nas de'i don bstan pa'i phyir / rgol bas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The word himself is a compound word that is to be analyzed as his own self. In order to explain its meaning, he says the disputant.üîΩThe word himself is a compound word that is to be analyzed as his own self. In order to explain its meaning, he says the disputant.

original: rang nyid ces bya ba'i tshig phrad kyi sgra ni bdag nyid kyi zhes drug pa'i don dang / bdag nyid ces gsum pa'i don la 'jug go //üîΩdes na 'dir ni rang nyid kyi sgras gsum pa'i mtha' can gyi rang nyid kyi sgra'i don la 'jug pa yin no //üîΩbdag nyid kyi sgra ni 'brel ba can gyi sgra yin la /
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba'i tshig phrad kyi sgra ni bdag nyid kyi zhes drug pa'i don dang / bdag nyid ces gsum pa'i don la 'jug go // des na 'dir ni rang nyid kyi sgras gsum pa'i mtha' can gyi rang nyid kyi sgra'i don la 'jug pa yin no // bdag nyid kyi sgra ni 'brel ba can gyi sgra yin la /
translated: The word himself is a compound word that is to be analyzed as his own self. In order to explain its meaning, he says the disputant.üîΩThe word himself is a compound word that is to be analyzed as his own self. In order to explain its meaning, he says the disputant.üîΩThe word himself is a compound word that is to be analyzed as his own self. In order to explain its meaning, he says the disputant.üîΩThe word himself is a compound word that is to be analyzed as his own self. In order to explain its meaning, he says the disputant.

original: nye ba yang rgol ba yin pa de'i phyir rgol ba gang gi bdag nyid gsum pa'i don du brjod pa de nyid rgol bas zhes gsum pa'i don dang ldan par bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nye ba yang rgol ba yin pa de'i phyir rgol ba gang gi bdag nyid gsum pa'i don du brjod pa de nyid rgol bas zhes gsum pa'i don dang ldan par bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: The word himself is a compound word that is to be analyzed as his own self. In order to explain its meaning, he says the disputant.

original: rgol ba'i zhes bya ba 'di rang nyid kyi sgra'i rnam grangs ni ma yin no //üîΩrgol ba de yang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgol ba'i zhes bya ba 'di rang nyid kyi sgra'i rnam grangs ni ma yin no //üîΩrgol ba de yang yin zhe na /
translated: The word himself is a compound word that is to be analyzed as his own self. In order to explain its meaning, he says the disputant.üîΩThe word himself is a compound word that is to be analyzed as his own self. In order to explain its meaning, he says the disputant.üîΩThe word himself is a compound word that is to be analyzed as his own self. In order to explain its meaning, he says the disputant.üîΩThe word himself is a compound word that is to be analyzed as his own self. In order to explain its meaning, he says the disputant.üîΩThe word himself is a compound word that is to be analyzed as his own self. In order to explain its meaning, he says the disputant.

original: de'i tshe bsgrub pa smra ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bsgrub pa smra ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: At that time, it is the proponent of the thesis.

original: rtsod pa'i tshe na bsgrub pa smras pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i tshe na bsgrub pa smras pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the proponent of the thesis at the time of the debate.

original: 'dis ni rgol ba du ma yod pa'i las rang nyid sgras brjod par bya ba'i rgol ba'i khyad par du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgol ba du ma yod pa'i las rang nyid sgras brjod par bya ba'i rgol ba'i khyad par du byas pa'o //
translated: This shows that the opponent himself, who has many functions, is specified as the proponent.

original: gal te de ltar na rgol ba'i 'dod pa bsgrub bya yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na rgol ba'i 'dod pa bsgrub bya yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur na /
translated: If that is so, then the thesis is the desired object of the proponent.

original: brjod pa de @69b nyid kyis ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩ'dis rtsod pa'i dus de'i tshe rgol ba 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du rang 'dod pa'i chos gang yin pa de kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: brjod pa de @69b nyid kyis ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / 'dis rtsod pa'i dus de'i tshe rgol ba 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du rang 'dod pa'i chos gang yin pa de kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: How is that expressed?

original: chos cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: chos cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: This shows that at the time of the debate, the proponent himself, who desires the property to be proven, is the one who proves it, and not the other party.

original: tshig 'di'i 'bras bu ni rgol bas mi 'dod pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba nyid bkag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshig 'di'i 'bras bu ni rgol bas mi 'dod pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba nyid bkag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The result of this statement is that the proponent's desire to prove the property is refuted.

original: 'on te bsgrub par bya ba nyid du srid pa'i chos gzhan gang na yod pa de bsal ba'i phyir 'di brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te bsgrub par bya ba nyid du srid pa'i chos gzhan gang na yod pa de bsal ba'i phyir 'di brjod ce na /
translated: But if you say that it is stated in order to eliminate any other possible property that is a probandum, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna addresses this:

original: bstan bcos de byed pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bstan bcos de byed pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The author of the treatise.

original: rgol ba des bstan bcos de byed pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can de la chos du ma khas blangs pa na chos gzhan bsgrub par bya ba nyid du srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgol ba des bstan bcos de byed pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can de la chos du ma khas blangs pa na chos gzhan bsgrub par bya ba nyid du srid pa ma yin no //
translated: When the author of the treatise asserts many properties of the subject, it is not possible that another property is a probandum.üîΩBecause there is the misconception that whatever is asserted in a treatise is a probandum, even though many properties are asserted, the probandum is

original: 'di ltar gang gis bstan bcos gang zhig khas blangs pa de las bsgrub pa'i chos de thams can de bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes log par rtog pa yod pas na chos mang po zhig khas blangs su zin kyang rgol ba'i 'dod pa gang yin pa deüîΩnyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis bstan bcos gang zhig khas blangs pa de las bsgrub pa'i chos de thams can de bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes log par rtog pa yod pas na chos mang po zhig khas blangs su zin kyang rgol ba'i 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: only that which is the opponent‚Äôs thesis.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ba yin no //
translated: It is not another.

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rtags ni bstan bcos la mi ltos pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rtags ni bstan bcos la mi ltos pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that a reason that engages through the power of the thing does not rely on a treatise?

original: de lta bas na ltos bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos la gnas te btsad par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na ltos bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos la gnas te btsad par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since it is not a basis for debate, it is not a topic of the treatise.

original: bden mod kyi /
analyzed: bden mod kyi /
translated: This is true,üîΩbut if one were to take a stand on some treatise out of recklessness,

original: gal te yang gzu lums kyis bstan bcos 'ga' zhig la gnas par 'gyur bas na bstan bcos 'ga' zhig khas blangs nas /
analyzed: gal te yang gzu lums kyis bstan bcos 'ga' zhig la gnas par 'gyur bas na bstan bcos 'ga' zhig khas blangs nas /
translated: then even though one were to accept some treatise and speak of proof,

original: sgrub par smra ba de lta na yang de'i 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir 'di smos so //
analyzed: sgrub par smra ba de lta na yang de'i 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir 'di smos so //
translated: this would be irrelevant, because whatever one asserts is what is to be proven.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'dod pa'i sgras blangs nas 'chad pa'i don bdag gang la 'gal ba'i rtsod pa rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'dod pa'i sgras blangs nas 'chad pa'i don bdag gang la 'gal ba'i rtsod pa rtsom pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúassertion‚Äù is that which is taken up by the term ‚Äúassertion‚Äù and explained.

original: bdag med do zhes bdag 'gog par smra ba ni bdag yod par smra ba dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag med do zhes bdag 'gog par smra ba ni bdag yod par smra ba dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: The topic of the debate is the self, because the statement ‚ÄúThe self does not exist‚Äù is a contradiction of the statement ‚ÄúThe self exists.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa dang 'gog pa gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang 'gog pa gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because proof and refutation are contradictory.

original: rtsod pa'i rgyu des sgrub pa bkod pa'i don bdag de sgrub pa ste ;
analyzed: rtsod pa'i rgyu des sgrub pa bkod pa'i don bdag de sgrub pa ste ;
translated: The topic of the debate is the self that is the object of the proof.

original: nges par 'dod pa'i rgol bas ni don de bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'dod pa'i rgol bas ni don de bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The disputant who definitely desires to establish the meaning of the word ‚Äúis‚Äù will establish that meaning.

original: brjod par ro zhes mthar smos pa'i 'gyur ro'i sgra 'dir 'brel pa dag brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par ro zhes mthar smos pa'i 'gyur ro'i sgra 'dir 'brel pa dag brjod par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúis‚Äù at the end of the passage should be connected with the word ‚Äúexpresses.‚Äù

original: gal te yang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la smras pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba rigs @70a * //
analyzed: gal te yang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la smras pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba rigs @70a * //
translated: If the meaning of the word ‚Äúbut‚Äù is to be established in the inference, then it is reasonable to establish it.

original: mod kyi ; 'on kyang tshig gis ma smras su zin kyang de ni shugs kyis smras pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: mod kyi ; 'on kyang tshig gis ma smras su zin kyang de ni shugs kyis smras pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: However, even though it is not expressed by the words, it is still to be established because it is expressed by implication.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Why is that?üîΩHe says, ‚ÄúBecause it is the basis of the dispute.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni don de'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni don de'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt‚Äù refers to the meaning.

original: gang gi gzhi rten yin pas de'i rtsod pa'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: gang gi gzhi rten yin pas de'i rtsod pa'i gzhi yin no //
translated: Since it is the basis of the dispute, it is the basis of the dispute.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de de bas na'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de de bas na'o //
translated: Its nature is that itself. Therefore, it is that.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gang gi phyir rtsod pa bsal bar 'dod de rgol bas sgrub pa bkod pa de bas na rtsod pa'i zhi gang yin pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtsod pa bsal bar 'dod de rgol bas sgrub pa bkod pa de bas na rtsod pa'i zhi gang yin pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since the respondent has set forth a proof in order to remove the dispute, therefore, the very pacification of the dispute is the probandum.

original: 'di ltar 'gal ba'i rtsod pa bsal ba'i don du bsgrub pa bkod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gal ba'i rtsod pa bsal ba'i don du bsgrub pa bkod de /
translated: Thus, the proof is set forth for the purpose of removing the contradictory dispute.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma yin na da bsgrub par bya bar rigs nges pa gzhan 'di ci zhig yod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma yin na da bsgrub par bya bar rigs nges pa gzhan 'di ci zhig yod ces bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not the probandum, then what is this other definite object of proof?

original: dper na 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don byed de zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa lam smras su zin kyang sgrub par bya ba yin par snang ba'i dper byed do //
analyzed: dper na 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don byed de zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa lam smras su zin kyang sgrub par bya ba yin par snang ba'i dper byed do //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúThe eye, etc. function for the sake of another because they are composites,‚Äù although the inference for the sake of another has been stated, it is used as an example of what appears to be the probandum.

original: mig la sogs pa gang dag yin pa rnam pa la sogs pa de ni mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste chos can no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gang dag yin pa rnam pa la sogs pa de ni mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste chos can no //
translated: The eye, etc. that are the subject are the eye, etc.

original: 'di gzhan gyi ched yin pas gzhan gyi don zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di gzhan gyi ched yin pas gzhan gyi don zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since this is for the sake of another, it is called ‚Äúfor the sake of another.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The purpose is to accomplish the benefit of others.

original: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is ‚Äúbecause of being a collection.‚Äù

original: mal cha dang / stan la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'i yul ston to //
analyzed: mal cha dang / stan la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'i yul ston to //
translated: The example is ‚Äúlike the parts of a bed and seat, etc.‚Äù

original: mal cha dang stan de dag la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni mal cha dang stan la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mal cha dang stan de dag la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni mal cha dang stan la sogs pa ste /
translated: The parts of a bed and seat, etc., are the parts of a bed and seat, etc.

original: skyes bu nye bar longs spyod pa'i yan lag 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pa de bzhin du tshad ma 'dir gal te yang mig la sogs pa ni bdag gi don byed pa yin no zhes bdag gi don nyid mi brjod mod kyi /
analyzed: skyes bu nye bar longs spyod pa'i yan lag 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pa de bzhin du tshad ma 'dir gal te yang mig la sogs pa ni bdag gi don byed pa yin no zhes bdag gi don nyid mi brjod mod kyi /
translated: Just as they are the parts of a bed and seat, etc., which are the collection of the parts that are the means of enjoyment for a person, in the same way, although it is not stated that the eye, etc., are for the benefit of the self,

original: ma brjod kyang bsgrub par bya ba ni bdag gi don nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma brjod kyang bsgrub par bya ba ni bdag gi don nyid yin no //
translated: the purpose is for the benefit of the self, even though it is not stated.

original: 'di ltar grangs can rnams kyis ni bdag yod par smras la /
analyzed: 'di ltar grangs can rnams kyis ni bdag yod par smras la /
translated: Thus, the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the self exists.

original: de dang mi mthun pa sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis ni bdag med do zhes smras so //
