analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis ni bdag med do zhes smras so //
translated: The Buddhists, who disagree with them, say that the self does not exist.

original: de bas na grangs can rnams kyis rang gi smra ba dang mi mthun pas sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis smra ba gang yin rgyur byas nas mthun par smra ba bsal ba'i phyir dang / rang gi sgra gzhag pa'i phyir sgrub pa bkod de de bas na ma smras su zin kyang bdag di don nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na grangs can rnams kyis rang gi smra ba dang mi mthun pas sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis smra ba gang yin rgyur byas nas mthun par smra ba bsal ba'i phyir dang / rang gi sgra gzhag pa'i phyir sgrub pa bkod de de bas na ma smras su zin kyang bdag di don nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, because the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas do not agree with their own statements, they set forth a proof in order to refute the statements of the Buddhists, which are based on what they consider to be the cause, and in order to establish their own terminology. Therefore, even though it is not stated, the meaning of the self is what is to be established.

original: de ni rtsod ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtsod ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the basis of the dispute.

original: @70b mal cha dang stan la sogs pa skyes bu la mkho ba'i yan lag rnams ni 'dus pa nyid bdag gi don nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa la gzhan gyi don tsam dang ni grub pa de bas na /
analyzed: @70b mal cha dang stan la sogs pa skyes bu la mkho ba'i yan lag rnams ni 'dus pa nyid bdag gi don nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa la gzhan gyi don tsam dang ni grub pa de bas na /
translated: The limbs that are necessary for a person, such as clothing, bedding, and so on, are a collection. The meaning of self is not established as being a mere collection. The meaning of other is not established as being a mere collection.

original: gzhan gyi don zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the meaning of other.

original: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'dir sogs pa smras pa ni rnam par shes pa yang gzhan gyi don byed pa grub par 'dod de //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'dir sogs pa smras pa ni rnam par shes pa yang gzhan gyi don byed pa grub par 'dod de //
translated: Here, the statement ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in ‚Äúthe eye and so on‚Äù also refers to consciousness, which is accepted as being established as performing the function of other.

original: rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa ni bdag kho na yin pas rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi don byed do zhes grub pa'i shugs kyis mig la sogs pa bdag gi don nyid du grub par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa ni bdag kho na yin pas rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi don byed do zhes grub pa'i shugs kyis mig la sogs pa bdag gi don nyid du grub par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Since the self is just another name for consciousness, it is established by implication that the eye and so on are for the sake of the self.

original: gzhan gyi don byed ces smos pa byas so //üîΩ'dod pa bsgrub byar brjod pa des na smras pa tsam kho na bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don byed ces smos pa byas so // 'dod pa bsgrub byar brjod pa des na smras pa tsam kho na bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, he says, ‚Äúfor the sake of another,‚Äù thinking that the eye and so on are for the sake of the self.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe object of the thesis is what is to be proven,‚Äù means that the object of the thesis is not merely what is stated but is what the proponent wishes to prove.

original: 'on kyang phyir rgol gyi rtsod pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir na rgol bas bsgrub byar 'dod par skabs kyis rtogs par bya ba ni smras sam ma smras kyang rung bsgrub bya yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyir rgol gyi rtsod pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir na rgol bas bsgrub byar 'dod par skabs kyis rtogs par bya ba ni smras sam ma smras kyang rung bsgrub bya yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: However, since it is the basis of the opponent‚Äôs dispute, it is understood from the context that what the proponent wishes to prove is what is to be proven, whether it is stated or not.

original: ma bsal ba zhes bya ba ni bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ma bsal ba zhes bya ba ni bshad par bya'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúWhat is not refuted,‚Äù is to be explained.

original: mtshan de dag ces bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid smras pa gang yin pa thal ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan de dag ces bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid smras pa gang yin pa thal ma thag pa'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThose characteristics,‚Äù refers to the characteristics of what is to be proven that were just stated.

original: mtshan nyid de dag dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang phyogs ma yin du zin pa'i phyir khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ma bsal ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dag dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang phyogs ma yin du zin pa'i phyir khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ma bsal ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Even though it may possess those characteristics, it is not a logical possibility. In order to make that understood, the term ‚Äúnot eliminated‚Äù is stated.

original: sgrub par 'dod du zin kyang phyogs ma yin pa ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: sgrub par 'dod du zin kyang phyogs ma yin pa ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of thing is not a logical possibility even though it is desired to be established?

original: sgrub par 'dod pa'i don mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang grags pa dang rang bzhin tshig rnams te /
analyzed: sgrub par 'dod pa'i don mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang grags pa dang rang bzhin tshig rnams te /
translated: The desired object of establishment is direct perception, inference, what is commonly recognized, and nature.

original: de dag gis sel ba'i phyin ci log tu sgrub pa de ni phyogs ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis sel ba'i phyin ci log tu sgrub pa de ni phyogs ma yin no //
translated: The establishment of that which is eliminated by those is not a logical possibility.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs bzhis bsal ba de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs bzhis bsal ba de la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to what is eliminated by the four, direct perception and so on.

original: mngon sum gyis bsal ba ci 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bsal ba ci 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: What kind of thing is eliminated by direct perception?

original: dper na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For example, it is said:

original: dper na 'di mngon sum gyis bsal ba yin pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dper na sgra'i don rna bas gzung du rung ba ni nyan du rung ba'o //
analyzed: dper na 'di mngon sum gyis bsal ba yin pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dper na sgra'i don rna bas gzung du rung ba ni nyan du rung ba'o //
translated: For example, just as this is eliminated by direct perception, so it should be seen in other cases as well. For example, the meaning of the word ‚Äúaudible‚Äù is suitable to be apprehended by the ear.

original: mnyan du rung ba ma yin pa ni mnyan du mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: mnyan du rung ba ma yin pa ni mnyan du mi rung ba ste /
translated: That which is not fit to be heard is unfit to be heard.

original: rna bas gzung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa'i don to //üîΩsgra rna bas gzung bar mi rung ba ni sgra rna bas gzung bar byar rung mngon sum du grub pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: rna bas gzung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa'i don to // sgra rna bas gzung bar mi rung ba ni sgra rna bas gzung bar byar rung mngon sum du grub pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: The meaning of the thesis is that it is not apprehended by the ear.üîΩThe thesis that sound is not fit to be apprehended by the ear contradicts the direct perception that sound is fit to be apprehended by the ear.

original: rjes su dpag pas bsal ba ni sgra rtag go zhes bya ba lta bu ste sgra rtag pa nyid du dam bca' ba ni mi rtag pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas grub pa @71a * //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas bsal ba ni sgra rtag go zhes bya ba lta bu ste sgra rtag pa nyid du dam bca' ba ni mi rtag pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas grub pa @71a * //
translated: The thesis that sound is permanent is refuted by inference.

original: bsal to // grags pas bsal ba ni ri bong can ni zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: bsal to // grags pas bsal ba ni ri bong can ni zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'i don yin no //
translated: The thesis that the rabbit-bearer is not denoted by the word moon is refuted by common sense.

original: 'di ni grags pas bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni grags pas bsal ba yin te /
translated: This is refuted by common sense.

original: grags pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul te don la brjod do //
analyzed: grags pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul te don la brjod do //
translated: Common sense is the object of a conceptual consciousness, and it is applied to the object.

original: grags pa ste rtog par bya ba nyid ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul du brjod pa yin la rtogs par bya ba'i rang bzhin rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul nyid de sa ni ri bong can gyi zla ba'i sgras brjod parüîΩbya ba nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: grags pa ste rtog par bya ba nyid ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul du brjod pa yin la rtogs par bya ba'i rang bzhin rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul nyid de sa ni ri bong can gyi zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúmoon‚Äù expresses that which is the object of the conceptual consciousness.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni sgra'i rnam pa dang 'drer rung ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni sgra'i rnam pa dang 'drer rung ba yin la /
translated: That which is the object of the conceptual consciousness is suitable to be mixed with the aspect of the word.

original: sgra'i rnam pa dang 'drer rung ba gang yin pa de yang brda las byung ba'i sgras brjod par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i rnam pa dang 'drer rung ba gang yin pa de yang brda las byung ba'i sgras brjod par nus pa yin no //
translated: That which is suitable to be mixed with the aspect of the word is able to be expressed by a word that arises from a sign.

original: de bas na grags pa'i rang bzhin rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid kyis grub pa zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ni zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la gnod par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na grags pa'i rang bzhin rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid kyis grub pa zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ni zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la gnod par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúmoon‚Äù expresses that which is the object of the conceptual consciousness, the nature of the object of expression, which is established by the word ‚Äúmoon.‚Äù This contradicts that which is not to be expressed by the word ‚Äúmoon.‚Äù

original: grags pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang yin te /
analyzed: grags pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang yin te /
translated: It is also a natural reason.

original: gang gi phyir brda las byung ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brda las byung ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Because the mere fact of being the object of a conceptual consciousness is related to the fact of being expressed by a word that arises from a convention.

original: de bas na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ni dam bcas pa'i don bdag nyid kyis rjod par byed pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ni dam bcas pa'i don bdag nyid kyis rjod par byed pa'i sgra'o //
translated: Therefore, a natural reason is a word that expresses the meaning of the thesis by itself.

original: des bsal ba'i dam bcas pa'i don ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des bsal ba'i dam bcas pa'i don ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the thesis that is refuted by that is not the probandum.

original: dper na rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúInference is not a valid means of knowledge.‚Äù

original: 'dir dam bcas pa'i don ni rjes su dpag pa tshad mas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dam bcas pa'i don ni rjes su dpag pa tshad mas 'gog pa'o //
translated: Here, the meaning of the thesis is that inference is refuted by a valid means of knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rang gi tshig gi ngag 'dis de bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rang gi tshig gi ngag 'dis de bsal ba yin no //
translated: By this statement of his own words, ‚ÄúInference is not a valid means of knowledge,‚Äù he refutes that.

original: 'di ltar sbyor ba'i ngag 'di ni smra ba po sgra las byung ba'i shes pa don yod pa nyid du 'dod par ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyor ba'i ngag 'di ni smra ba po sgra las byung ba'i shes pa don yod pa nyid du 'dod par ston par byed de /
translated: In this way, this statement of reasoning shows that the speaker accepts that the consciousness that arises from a sound is meaningful.

original: 'di ltar nga'i las khyod la don gang las rtog pa skyed de don bden pa yin no zhes ston par mi byed na smra ba po ngag brjod pa nyid du mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: 'di ltar nga'i las khyod la don gang las rtog pa skyed de don bden pa yin no zhes ston par mi byed na smra ba po ngag brjod pa nyid du mi 'gyur te ;
translated: Thus, if the meaning of your statement does not generate understanding in others, then your statement does not express anything.

original: brjod pa'i don bden par gzhan gyis shes par bya ba ma yin na ni brjod pa'i don med do //
analyzed: brjod pa'i don bden par gzhan gyis shes par bya ba ma yin na ni brjod pa'i don med do //
translated: If the meaning of your statement is not understood by others as true, then the meaning of your statement is nonexistent.

original: gang yang ngag smra ba thams cad brdzun pa yin no zhes brjod pa de yang ngag 'di'i don bden pa nyid ston pas ngag brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang ngag smra ba thams cad brdzun pa yin no zhes brjod pa de yang ngag 'di'i don bden pa nyid ston pas ngag brjod pa yin no //
translated: Also, if you say, ‚ÄúAll statements are false,‚Äù then this statement expresses its meaning as true.

original: gal te ngag 'di'i don bden par bstan na de lta na ni bdag nyid @71b kyi ngag kyang gzhan mi bden par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te ngag 'di'i don bden par bstan na de lta na ni bdag nyid @71b kyi ngag kyang gzhan mi bden par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the meaning of this statement is shown to be true, then your own statement is not false.

original: gal te 'di nyid kyi don mi bden na ni gzhan mi bden pa'i don can du bstan par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te 'di nyid kyi don mi bden na ni gzhan mi bden pa'i don can du bstan par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If the meaning of this statement is not true, then it is not shown to have a meaning that is not true.

original: de lta na yang smras pa'i 'bras bu ci yang med pas mi smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang smras pa'i 'bras bu ci yang med pas mi smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, since the result of your statement is nonexistent, you would not make a statement.

original: de bas na ngag las byung ba ngag gi don la dmigs pa'i shes pa bden pa'i don can du bstan pa kho nas smras pa po dag brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ngag las byung ba ngag gi don la dmigs pa'i shes pa bden pa'i don can du bstan pa kho nas smras pa po dag brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the speaker is indicated by the mere fact that the cognition which has as its object the meaning of the sound that has arisen from the sound has a real object.

original: de lta yin dang sgra'i phyi'i dngos po med na mi 'byung bar bstan pa sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa bden pa'i don du bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang sgra'i phyi'i dngos po med na mi 'byung bar bstan pa sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa bden pa'i don du bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the cognition that arises from the sound is indicated as having a real object by the indication that the external thing, the sound, does not occur without it.

original: de bas na phyi'i don gyi 'bras bu sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa bden pa'i don can du ston pas ni 'bras bu shing las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa sgra las byung ba tshad mar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na phyi'i don gyi 'bras bu sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa bden pa'i don can du ston pas ni 'bras bu shing las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa sgra las byung ba tshad mar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the inference that arises from the tree, which is the result of the external object, is indicated as valid knowledge by the indication that the cognition that arises from the sound has a real object.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma yin no zhes bya bas ni sgra las byung ba'i shes pa gzung bar bya ba med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma yin no zhes bya bas ni sgra las byung ba'i shes pa gzung bar bya ba med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by saying that inference is valid knowledge, the cognition that arises from the sound is indicated as having no object to apprehend.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa ni don med pa nyid la brjod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa ni don med pa nyid la brjod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Invalidity is said to be the absence of an object, not anything else.

original: sgra brjod pa'i shugs kyis kyang rang gi sgra don med par mi 'byung ba yin par bstan pa yin zhing /
analyzed: sgra brjod pa'i shugs kyis kyang rang gi sgra don med par mi 'byung ba yin par bstan pa yin zhing /
translated: The force of the expression of the word also teaches that its meaning does not occur without the word.

original: de lta na yang don yod par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang don yod par bstan pa yin no //
translated: And in that case, the meaning is taught to exist.

original: de bas na don gyi 'bras bur brtags pa'i sgra las byung ba'i don yod par dam bcas pas med pa las gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don gyi 'bras bur brtags pa'i sgra las byung ba'i don yod par dam bcas pas med pa las gnod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning that is imagined to be the effect of the word is established to exist. The thesis that it exists refutes that it does not exist.

original: de bas na 'dir de ltar rang gi tshig gis dpag pa'i yod pas med pa la gnod pas rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir de ltar rang gi tshig gis dpag pa'i yod pas med pa la gnod pas rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, here the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúIt contradicts your own words‚Äù is that the existence that is inferred from your own words contradicts the nonexistence.

original: gzhan dang ni bsal ba'i 'bras bu sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa ni bsal ba la dmigs shing don yod par 'dod de sgra sbyor ba ni des tshad ma ma yin pas dam bcas pa la gnod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dang ni bsal ba'i 'bras bu sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa ni bsal ba la dmigs shing don yod par 'dod de sgra sbyor ba ni des tshad ma ma yin pas dam bcas pa la gnod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The effect of the object is the consciousness that arises from the word. It observes the object and asserts that the object exists. The application of the word is not a valid means of knowledge. Therefore, the thesis that the object exists is undermined.

original: de ni dmigs te 'di ltar 'dir grags pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: de ni dmigs te 'di ltar 'dir grags pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: That is observed. In this way, what is renowned is a reason based on nature.

original: rang gi tshig ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs nyid du brtags par 'dod kyi dngos su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi tshig ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs nyid du brtags par 'dod kyi dngos su ni ma yin no //
translated: The words of the opponent are considered to be a reason based on effect, but not in reality.

original: bsams pa'i 'bras bu'i sgra ni dngos kho nar 'dod de /
analyzed: bsams pa'i 'bras bu'i sgra ni dngos kho nar 'dod de /
translated: The word effect in the opponent‚Äôs statement is accepted as being in reality.

original: de bas na de 'dir mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na de 'dir mi gzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not accepted here.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar rjes su dpag par mi 'dod pa ni du ba med pa mi 'khrul bar mi tshol ba de bzhin du sgra bsam pa la mi 'khrul par mi tshol te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar rjes su dpag par mi 'dod pa ni du ba med pa mi 'khrul bar mi tshol ba de bzhin du sgra bsam pa la mi 'khrul par mi tshol te /
translated: Moreover, just as one does not seek the non-erroneous absence of smoke, in the same way one does not seek the non-erroneous absence of intention in sound.

original: sgra sbyar ba ni phyi'i 'bras bu rtogs pa'i don du yin no //üîΩde bas na sgra bsam pa med na mi 'byung ba nyid khas blangs sngon du @72a * //
analyzed: sgra sbyar ba ni phyi'i 'bras bu rtogs pa'i don du yin no // de bas na sgra bsam pa med na mi 'byung ba nyid khas blangs sngon du @72a * //
translated: The use of the word is for the purpose of understanding the external effect.

original: btang nas sgra sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: btang nas sgra sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the use of the word is not preceded by the acceptance of the non-erroneous arising of sound from intention.

original: gzhan yang rang gi bsam pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sgra brjod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi bsam pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sgra brjod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the word is not uttered for the purpose of understanding one‚Äôs own intention,

original: 'on kyang phyi'i dngos po yod par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi'i dngos po yod par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but rather for the purpose of understanding the existence of external things.

original: de bas na sgra sbyor ba ni phyi'i dngos po med na mi 'byung ba nyid du khas blangs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sgra sbyor ba ni phyi'i dngos po med na mi 'byung ba nyid du khas blangs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: Therefore, the application of the term ‚Äúfallacious‚Äù is based on the premise that the external thing does not occur.

original: de ltar na bshad pa snga ma nyid skyon med do //
analyzed: de ltar na bshad pa snga ma nyid skyon med do //
translated: Thus, the former explanation is not faulty.

original: de lta yin dang ma bsal ba zhes smos pas phyogs lta bur mngon pas na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang ma bsal ba zhes smos pas phyogs lta bur mngon pas na /
translated: If that is so, then the term ‚Äúunproven‚Äù is like a position, since it appears to be a position.

original: phyogs ltar snang ba ste bshad ma thag pa bzhi po bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs ltar snang ba ste bshad ma thag pa bzhi po bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the four just explained are like positions.

original: de ni phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gis ngag dag rnam par gcod par byed pa de dag rnam par gcad pas phyogs kyi don ci 'dra ba zhig thob pa de bstan pa'i phyir rnam par gcad par bya ba bsdus nas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gis ngag dag rnam par gcod par byed pa de dag rnam par gcad pas phyogs kyi don ci 'dra ba zhig thob pa de bstan pa'i phyir rnam par gcad par bya ba bsdus nas bstan to //
translated: In order to show what kind of meaning of position is obtained by excluding those exclusions by the words that define a position, he includes the exclusions and explains them.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means in the manner just explained.

original: grub ba las bzlog ste phyin ci log tu 'dug pa'i rgyus bsgrub par bya ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: grub ba las bzlog ste phyin ci log tu 'dug pa'i rgyus bsgrub par bya ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The proof should be seen as the opposite of the established, i.e., as the reverse of the established.

original: grub pa las bzlog pa'i don gang yin pa de ni phyogs yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: grub pa las bzlog pa'i don gang yin pa de ni phyogs yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the counter-correlate of the established is the unestablished.

original: grub pa las phyin ci log kyang ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: grub pa las phyin ci log kyang ma grub pa yin te /
translated: The counter-correlate of the established is also the unestablished.

original: de bas na ma grub pa ni bsgrub par bya ba yin yang thams cad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na ma grub pa ni bsgrub par bya ba yin yang thams cad ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the unestablished is the probandum, but not everything.

original: 'on kyang sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa'i ma grub pa las kyang bzlog pa dang / rgol ba bdag nyid kyis bsgrub par mi 'dod pa'i ma grub pa las bzlog pa dang / de bzhin du smras pa tsam ma grub pa las bzlog pa dang /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa'i ma grub pa las kyang bzlog pa dang / rgol ba bdag nyid kyis bsgrub par mi 'dod pa'i ma grub pa las bzlog pa dang / de bzhin du smras pa tsam ma grub pa las bzlog pa dang /
translated: However, the counter-correlate of the unestablished that is taught as the proof, the counter-correlate of the unestablished that the proponent himself does not wish to establish, and similarly, the counter-correlate of the unestablished that is merely stated,

original: de bzhin du bsal ba las bzlog pa ni sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsal ba las bzlog pa ni sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: and the counter-correlate of the unestablished that is refuted, are the proof.

original: rnam par gcad pa lnga dang 'bras bu'i don gang yin pa 'di ni ma grub pa dang / grub par byed pa ma yin pa dang / rgol ba bdag nyid bsgrub par 'dod pa dang / skabs kyis smras pa'am ma skyes pa dang / ma bsal ba ni bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par gcad pa lnga dang 'bras bu'i don gang yin pa 'di ni ma grub pa dang / grub par byed pa ma yin pa dang / rgol ba bdag nyid bsgrub par 'dod pa dang / skabs kyis smras pa'am ma skyes pa dang / ma bsal ba ni bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: The five exclusions and the meaning of the result: that which is not established, that which is not a proof, that which is the proponent‚Äôs own thesis, that which is stated out of context, and that which is unarisen or unexcluded is the thesis.

original: don ni de nyid ni ngo bo kho nar bdag nyid 'dod pa ma bsal ba zhes bya ba'i tshig de dag gis brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don ni de nyid ni ngo bo kho nar bdag nyid 'dod pa ma bsal ba zhes bya ba'i tshig de dag gis brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of that is stated by the words ‚Äúthe nature itself is not excluded by the proponent‚Äôs own assertion.‚Äù

original: phyogs zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni sgrub par byed pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: phyogs zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni sgrub par byed pa 'di yin no //
translated: That which is called ‚Äúposition‚Äù is the proof.

original: de ltar na gang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
analyzed: de ltar na gang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù

original: de bas na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba nyes pa med pa gang yin pa de ni kha na ma tho ba med par bstan pa bshad pa @72b yin no ;
analyzed: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba nyes pa med pa gang yin pa de ni kha na ma tho ba med par bstan pa bshad pa @72b yin no ;
translated: The definition of a position is ‚Äúthat which is free from fault.‚Äù That which is free from the fault of being a fault is taught to be free from fault.

original: / tshul gsum pa'i rtags bshad pa rdzogs te /
analyzed: / tshul gsum pa'i rtags bshad pa rdzogs te /
translated: The explanation of the trimodal conditions is complete.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid brjod nas /
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid brjod nas /
translated: Having discussed the topic of the definition of a part,

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba brjod par 'dod de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba brjod par 'dod de /
translated: he now wishes to discuss the fallacious reasons.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag gi skabs 'byed bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag gi skabs 'byed bar byed do //
translated: He opens the discussion with the statement, ‚ÄúThe trimodal conditions are the reason in an inference for the sake of others.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan te /
translated: He teaches as follows.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags 'chad par 'dod pas rjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags 'chad par 'dod pas rjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: The trimodal conditions are to be stated by one who wishes to state a reason.

original: ci ste de nyid dang de dang cha 'dra ba yang brjod na ni spang bar bya ba shes pa de dang bral ba'i blang bar bya ba bde blag tu shes par 'gyur ba de ltar na de bsal bar smras pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste de nyid dang de dang cha 'dra ba yang brjod na ni spang bar bya ba shes pa de dang bral ba'i blang bar bya ba bde blag tu shes par 'gyur ba de ltar na de bsal bar smras pa yin no //
translated: If one states what is to be avoided and what is similar to it, then one will easily understand what is to be adopted that is free from that. In this way, he states that the reason is eliminated.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa brjod pa ste zhes sngar smras zin to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa brjod pa ste zhes sngar smras zin to //
translated: He previously stated, ‚ÄúThe trimodal conditions are the reason in an inference for the sake of others.‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba ni de ltar yin pa na ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni de ltar yin pa na ste /
translated: In that case means if that is so.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa yin pas na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa yin pas na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because it is the expression of a reason having the three modes that is an inference for the sake of others.

original: tshul gsum pa'i nang nas gcig ma smras na yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i nang nas gcig ma smras na yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even if one of the three modes is not stated,

original: yang gi sgras gnyis kyang rung ste /
analyzed: yang gi sgras gnyis kyang rung ste /
translated: or even if two are not stated,

original: bsgrub pa ltar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub pa ltar snang ba yin te /
translated: it is a pseudo-proof.

original: sgrub pa dang 'dra ba yin gyi sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang 'dra ba yin gyi sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is: it is similar to a proof, but it is not a proof.

original: tshul gsum las sgrub pa ma rdzogs pa'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul gsum las sgrub pa ma rdzogs pa'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: This is the fault of not completing the proof from the three modes.

original: ma smras pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: ma smras pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is there a failure to state something,

original: smras kyang ma grub pa'am the tshom za na yang ngo //
analyzed: smras kyang ma grub pa'am the tshom za na yang ngo //
translated: but even if it is stated, if it is not established or is doubted, it is also a pseudo-reason.

original: su'i zhe na ;
analyzed: su'i zhe na ;
translated: Whose?

original: smras pa / go bar byed pa slar rgol ba dang / go bar byed pa rgol ba gnyis kyi gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / go bar byed pa slar rgol ba dang / go bar byed pa rgol ba gnyis kyi gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: It is said: It is a pseudo-reason for both the proponent and the opponent.

original: 'on te tshul gang ma grub pa'am the tshom za ba yin /
analyzed: 'on te tshul gang ma grub pa'am the tshom za ba yin /
translated: Or, is it that one of the modes is not established or is doubted?

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'i ming ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'i ming ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the name of a pseudo-reason?

original: chos can dang 'brel pa'i tshul gcig ma grub pa'am zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: chos can dang 'brel pa'i tshul gcig ma grub pa'am zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe non-establishment or doubt regarding the relation to the subject‚Äù means

original: chos can dang lhan cig tu 'brel pa ni chos can dang 'brel ba yin te /
analyzed: chos can dang lhan cig tu 'brel pa ni chos can dang 'brel ba yin te /
translated: that the relation to the subject is the relation to the property-possessor.

original: gtan tshigs chos can la yod pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs chos can la yod pa la bya'o //
translated: The reason is the presence in the subject.

original: de ma grub pa'am the tshom za na ma grub pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ma grub pa'am the tshom za na ma grub pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe non-establishment or doubt regarding the reason‚Äù means

original: chos can la ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: chos can la ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: that the reason is not established in the subject.üîΩThe reason is not a cause of non-understanding,üîΩbut it is a cause of doubt regarding the contradiction with the probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang 'gal bar rtogs pa'am the tshom gyi rgyu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang 'gal bar rtogs pa'am the tshom gyi rgyu ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not a cause of doubt regarding the reason.

original: 'on kyang mi rtag pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang mi rtag pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: But it is a cause of doubt regarding impermanence.

original: 'di las don 'ga' yang mi rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di las don 'ga' yang mi rtogs so //
translated: Nothing is understood from this.

original: don 'di yang ma grub par ming btags pa nyid las rtag par bya'o //
analyzed: don 'di yang ma grub par ming btags pa nyid las rtag par bya'o //
translated: This meaning is also to be understood as permanent, just from the designation of non-establishment.

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the example,

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says ‚Äúfor example,‚Äù and so on.

original: sgra mi rtag @73a * //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag @73a * //
translated: Sound is impermanent.

original: pa'o zhes bya ba sgra mi rtag pa nyid kyis bye brag can du bsgrub par bya ba la mig gis gzung ba nyid mig gi yul nyid ni sgra la rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis ka yang ma grub pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: pa'o zhes bya ba sgra mi rtag pa nyid kyis bye brag can du bsgrub par bya ba la mig gis gzung ba nyid mig gi yul nyid ni sgra la rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis ka yang ma grub pa lta bu'o //
translated: The example of sound is a specific proof of the impermanence of sound. The fact that it is perceived by the eye is not established for either the proponent or the opponent in the proof that sound is an object of the eye.

original: shing rnams la sems yod par zhes bya ba ni shing sems yod par bsgrub par bya ba la ;
analyzed: shing rnams la sems yod par zhes bya ba ni shing sems yod par bsgrub par bya ba la ;
translated: The example of trees is the proof that trees have consciousness.

original: shun pa thams cad ni shun pa thams cad yin te /
analyzed: shun pa thams cad ni shun pa thams cad yin te /
translated: The example of all bark is the proof that all bark is the bark of trees.

original: de bshus par gyur na 'chi bar nam mkha'i gos can dag gis smras pa ni phyir rgol ba sangs rgyas pa rnams la ma grub po //
analyzed: de bshus par gyur na 'chi bar nam mkha'i gos can dag gis smras pa ni phyir rgol ba sangs rgyas pa rnams la ma grub po //
translated: The example of the sky-clad is the statement by the sky-clad that if the bark is removed, the tree dies. This is not established for the Buddhist opponent.

original: ci'i phyir ma grub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma grub ce na /
translated: Why is it not established?

original: bshad pa / de ni rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang / tshe zhes zlas dbyi ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / de ni rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang / tshe zhes zlas dbyi ba'o //
translated: It is explained: That is a compound of consciousness, sense faculty, and life force.

original: de la rnam par shes pa ni dmigs par skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa ni dmigs par skyed pa'o //
translated: Among those, consciousness is the producer of the object.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa las dpag tu yod pa gang yin pa lus kyi nang du 'dus pa mig gi 'bras bu la sogs par gnas pa'i ngo bo de ni dbang po yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa las dpag tu yod pa gang yin pa lus kyi nang du 'dus pa mig gi 'bras bu la sogs par gnas pa'i ngo bo de ni dbang po yin no //
translated: The sense faculty is that which is inferred from the consciousness of form, etc., and which is located within the body, in the eye, etc., and has the nature of the primary elements.

original: tshe zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams srog zer ro ;
analyzed: tshe zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams srog zer ro ;
translated: Life is what worldly people call ‚Äúlife force.‚Äù

original: / lung las grub par 'dir brjod par 'os pa ma yin pa de bas na 'dir srog gi ngo bo la tshe zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / lung las grub par 'dir brjod par 'os pa ma yin pa de bas na 'dir srog gi ngo bo la tshe zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is not proper to discuss what is established by scripture here, therefore, here the nature of life is called ‚Äúlife force.‚Äù

original: de 'gags shing nub pa'i mtshan nyid de kho na gang yin pa de la de skad ces smos so //
analyzed: de 'gags shing nub pa'i mtshan nyid de kho na gang yin pa de la de skad ces smos so //
translated: That which has the characteristic of cessation and disappearance is called that.

original: de lta bu'i 'chi ba yin pa ni sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'chi ba yin pa ni sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted by the Buddhists that there is such a death.

original: de ltar yin du zad mod ;
analyzed: de ltar yin du zad mod ;
translated: Even if that is so,

original: 'on kyang ci'i phyir ma grub ce na /
analyzed: 'on kyang ci'i phyir ma grub ce na /
translated: why is it not established?

original: smras pa / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'gags pa'i bdag nyid da yang shing dag la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'gags pa'i bdag nyid da yang shing dag la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: because it is not possible for the nature of consciousness, etc., to cease in trees.

original: 'gags pa ni yod pa sngon du song ba yin te /
analyzed: 'gags pa ni yod pa sngon du song ba yin te /
translated: Cessation is preceded by existence.

original: des na gang zhig shing dag la rnam par shes pa 'gags par 'dod pa de rnam par shes pa mi 'dod par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na gang zhig shing dag la rnam par shes pa 'gags par 'dod pa de rnam par shes pa mi 'dod par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could one who asserts that consciousness ceases in trees not also assert that consciousness does not exist in trees?

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa shing la yod par mi 'dod na ni de 'gags par yang mi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa shing la yod par mi 'dod na ni de 'gags par yang mi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if one does not assert that consciousness exists in trees, then one should not assert that it ceases in trees.

original: skam pa yang 'chi ba zhes brjod la /
analyzed: skam pa yang 'chi ba zhes brjod la /
translated: Moreover, drying up is called death.

original: de ni shing la grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de ni shing la grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it established that this is so in the case of trees?

original: bden te / 'on kyang rnam par shes pa yod pas khyab pa'i shi ba gang yin pa de 'dir gtan tshigs su byed la /
analyzed: bden te / 'on kyang rnam par shes pa yod pas khyab pa'i shi ba gang yin pa de 'dir gtan tshigs su byed la /
translated: It is true, but here we use as the reason death, which is pervaded by the existence of consciousness.

original: de yod pas khyab pa yang rnam par shes pa 'gags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de yod pas khyab pa yang rnam par shes pa 'gags pa yin gyi /
translated: And the existence of consciousness is pervaded by the cessation of consciousness.

original: skam pa tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skam pa tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not pervaded by mere drying up.

original: de bas na gtan tshigs 'chi ba gang yin pa de ni shing lam grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs 'chi ba gang yin pa de ni shing lam grub pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the reason, death, is established in trees.

original: skam pa'i bdag nyid 'chi ba grub pa gang yin pa ni gtan tshigs ma yin no //
analyzed: skam pa'i bdag nyid 'chi ba grub pa gang yin pa ni gtan tshigs ma yin no //
translated: But the establishment of death in the form of drying up is not the reason.

original: nam @73b mkha'i gos can gyis ni bsgrub par bya bas khyab pa 'am ma khyab pa'i 'chi ba ma brtags par 'chi ba tsam gtan tshigs su smras pa yin no //
analyzed: nam @73b mkha'i gos can gyis ni bsgrub par bya bas khyab pa 'am ma khyab pa'i 'chi ba ma brtags par 'chi ba tsam gtan tshigs su smras pa yin no //
translated: The one who is clothed in the sky, i.e., the naked ascetic, has stated as the reason ‚Äúdeath alone,‚Äù without examining whether death is pervaded by or not pervaded by the probandum.

original: des na rgol ba 'dis ni gtan tshigs su gyur pa'i 'chi ba de ni ma shes la /
analyzed: des na rgol ba 'dis ni gtan tshigs su gyur pa'i 'chi ba de ni ma shes la /
translated: Therefore, this disputant does not know that death is the reason.

original: ma shes pa'i phyir grub pa yin te /
analyzed: ma shes pa'i phyir grub pa yin te /
translated: Because he does not know, he is refuted.

original: skam pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'chi ba shing la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skam pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'chi ba shing la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he sees death, which is of the nature of drying up, in a tree.

original: phyir rgol bas ni shes pas de'i phyir ma grub bo //
analyzed: phyir rgol bas ni shes pas de'i phyir ma grub bo //
translated: The opponent knows, and therefore he is not refuted.

original: gang gi tshe rgol bas kyang shes pa de'i tshe ni rgol ba la yang ma grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgol bas kyang shes pa de'i tshe ni rgol ba la yang ma grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: When the disputant also knows, then it is reasonable to say that he is not refuted by the disputant.

original: bde ba la sogs pa sems pa med par sgrub pas zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang bor byas pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa sems pa med par sgrub pas zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang bor byas pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The proof of pleasure, etc., as nonmental is as follows: Pleasure, etc., are those that begin with pleasure and end with suffering.

original: de dag sems pa med par bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag sems pa med par bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: They are to be proven as nonmental.

original: skye ba can nam mi rtag pa yin pa de bas na sems med pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba can nam mi rtag pa yin pa de bas na sems med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is without mind.

original: gang skye ba can nam mi rtag pa yin pa de ni sems pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang skye ba can nam mi rtag pa yin pa de ni sems pa med pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is produced or impermanent is without mind,

original: dper na gzugs la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like form, etc.

original: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa yang skye ba can nam mi rtag pa yin pa de bas na sems med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa yang skye ba can nam mi rtag pa yin pa de bas na sems med pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, pleasure, etc., are produced or impermanent, therefore, they are without mind.

original: sems can ni skyes bu'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: sems can ni skyes bu'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: A sentient being is the nature of a person.

original: 'dir yang skye ba can dang mi rtag pa nyid ni gtan tshigs kyi rnam grangs yin gyi cig car ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang skye ba can dang mi rtag pa nyid ni gtan tshigs kyi rnam grangs yin gyi cig car ma yin no //
translated: Here, the reason is a variant of the reason ‚Äúbecause of being produced‚Äù or ‚Äúbecause of being impermanent,‚Äù but not a variant of ‚Äúbecause of being simultaneous.‚Äù

original: de gnyi ga yang grangs can rgol ba la ma grub bo //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang grangs can rgol ba la ma grub bo //
translated: Both of those are not established for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya opponent.

original: gzhan gyi don du gtan tshigs smra ba des ni gzhan la grub pa gang yin pa de gtan tshigs su brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du gtan tshigs smra ba des ni gzhan la grub pa gang yin pa de gtan tshigs su brjod pa yin la /
translated: When one states a reason for the sake of another, whatever is established for the other is stated as the reason.

original: gzhan la yang med pa las skye ba'i skye ba can nyid dang / yod pa gtan nas 'jig pa'i mi rtag par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la yang med pa las skye ba'i skye ba can nyid dang / yod pa gtan nas 'jig pa'i mi rtag par grub pa yin no //
translated: For the other, the reason ‚Äúbecause of being produced‚Äù is established as ‚Äúbecause of arising from what does not exist previously,‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause of being impermanent‚Äù is established as ‚Äúbecause of the complete destruction of what exists.‚Äù

original: de 'dra ba nyid gnyi ga yang grangs can rnams la ma grub bo //
analyzed: de 'dra ba nyid gnyi ga yang grangs can rnams la ma grub bo //
translated: and that is not established for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: 'dir yang mi rtag pa nyid dang skye ba can gyi grub par byed pa mi shes pa'i phyir rgol ba la ma grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir yang mi rtag pa nyid dang skye ba can gyi grub par byed pa mi shes pa'i phyir rgol ba la ma grub pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, the reason is not established for the opponent because he does not understand the establishment of impermanence and having an origin.

original: ci ste mi rtag pa nyid dang skye ba can gnyis kyi tshad ma rgol bas kyang shes na ni rgol ba la yang grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste mi rtag pa nyid dang skye ba can gnyis kyi tshad ma rgol bas kyang shes na ni rgol ba la yang grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the opponent understands the valid knowledge of both impermanence and having an origin, then it would be established for the opponent.

original: des nas tshad ma yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir 'di rgol ba la ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des nas tshad ma yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir 'di rgol ba la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the valid knowledge is not fully understood, this is not established for the opponent.

original: the tshom za na ma grub par bstan ba'i phyir de bzhin du bdag nyid dam zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: the tshom za na ma grub par bstan ba'i phyir de bzhin du bdag nyid dam zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To show that it is not established if there is doubt, it says ‚Äúin the same way, with regard to the nature of the reason,‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs kyi bdag nyid la the tshom za na ma grub pa yin no //üîΩde'i gzhi la zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs de'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi bdag nyid la the tshom za na ma grub pa yin no // de'i gzhi la zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs de'i gzhi ste /
translated: if there is doubt with regard to the nature of the reason, it is not established.üîΩ‚ÄúWith regard to its basis‚Äù means with regard to the basis of that reason.

original: 'di la gtan tshigs brten pas na gzhi yin te /
analyzed: 'di la gtan tshigs brten pas na gzhi yin te /
translated: It is a basis because the reason depends on it.

original: gtan tshigs las gzhan gzhir gyur pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos @74a * //üîΩcan la bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs las gzhan gzhir gyur pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos @74a * // can la bya'o //
translated: The basis is the subject of the probandum, which is other than the reason.

original: de la gtan tshigs gnas pa na rtogs par byed pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs gnas pa na rtogs par byed pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: When the reason is present, it is present in the mode of making known.

original: gzhi de la the tshom za ba ni yid gnyis za ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi de la the tshom za ba ni yid gnyis za ba'o //
translated: Doubt about that basis is called ‚Äúhaving doubt.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid la the tshom za ba'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag nyid la the tshom za ba'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate doubt about oneself, he says:

original: dper na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For example,

original: rlangs pa thog mar byas pa gang yin pa de ni rlangs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rlangs pa thog mar byas pa gang yin pa de ni rlangs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: that which is initially vapor and so on is vapor and so forth.

original: de'i dngos po rlangs pa la sogs pa nyid du the tshom za ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po rlangs pa la sogs pa nyid du the tshom za ba'o //
translated: There is doubt about its entity as vapor and so on.

original: 'byung ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i tshogs 'dus pa'i 'dus pa bsags pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i tshogs 'dus pa'i 'dus pa bsags pa'o //
translated: The collection of elements is the collection of the elements such as earth.

original: me grub par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni me grub par bya ba'i ched du bzung na ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: me grub par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni me grub par bya ba'i ched du bzung na ma grub pa yin no //
translated: If it is grasped for the sake of establishing fire, it is not established.

original: 'di skad bstan te gang gi tshe du ba yang rlangs pa la sogs pa nyid du the tshom za bar gyur na de'i tshe ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te gang gi tshe du ba yang rlangs pa la sogs pa nyid du the tshom za bar gyur na de'i tshe ma grub pa yin te /
translated: This is taught: When smoke is doubted to be steam, etc., then it is not established.

original: rtogs par byed pa'i ngo bo ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa'i ngo bo ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the proof is uncertain.

original: du ba nyid du nges pa ni mes bskyed par bya ba'i phyir rtogs par byed par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: du ba nyid du nges pa ni mes bskyed par bya ba'i phyir rtogs par byed par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: When smoke is ascertained, it becomes the proof because it is to be produced by fire.

original: gang gi tshe the tshom za ba de'i tshe rtogs par byed pa ma yin pas ma grub pa zhes bya ba'i nyes pa yod do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe the tshom za ba de'i tshe rtogs par byed pa ma yin pas ma grub pa zhes bya ba'i nyes pa yod do //
translated: When there is doubt, then it is not the proof. Therefore, the fault of non-establishment exists.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni gzhi ma grub pa'i dper byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni gzhi ma grub pa'i dper byed pa yin no //
translated: For example is the example of the unestablished basis.

original: ri sul 'di na zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: ri sul 'di na zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: This mountain ravine is the subject.

original: ri mthon po'i phan tshun bsnol ba'i sa phyogs kyi ri sul na rma bya yod do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ri mthon po'i phan tshun bsnol ba'i sa phyogs kyi ri sul na rma bya yod do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the mountain ravine of a place where high mountains are intertwined, there is a peacock, is the statement of what is to be proven.

original: sgra grag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: sgra grag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: Because of the sound, is the reason.

original: sgra grag pa ni rma bya ba'i sgra grag pa'o //
analyzed: sgra grag pa ni rma bya ba'i sgra grag pa'o //
translated: The sound of the peacock is the sound of the peacock.

original: ci ltar na gzhi ma grub pa yin zhe na //
analyzed: ci ltar na gzhi ma grub pa yin zhe na //
translated: How is it that the reason is unestablished?

original: de grag pa'i yul mi rtogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de grag pa'i yul mi rtogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúlike the non-apprehension of the place where the sound is heard.‚Äù

original: rma bya'i sgra de grag ste 'ongs pa'i yul de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: rma bya'i sgra de grag ste 'ongs pa'i yul de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The place where the sound of the peacock comes from is called that.

original: rma bya'i sgra yul gang na grag pa de mi rtogs te rmongs par gyur na 'di ni gzhi ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rma bya'i sgra yul gang na grag pa de mi rtogs te rmongs par gyur na 'di ni gzhi ma grub pa yin te /
translated: If one does not understand the place where the sound of the peacock is heard, and becomes confused, this is an unestablished reason.

original: ri sul mang po phan tshun bsnol bar 'dug pa la /
analyzed: ri sul mang po phan tshun bsnol bar 'dug pa la /
translated: In a mountain valley with many intersecting ravines,

original: ci ri sul 'di kho na sma bya'i sgra grag gam /
analyzed: ci ri sul 'di kho na sma bya'i sgra grag gam /
translated: one wonders, ‚ÄúIs the sound of the peacock heard only in this ravine,

original: 'on te gzhan na zhes gang gi tshe rma bya'i sgra grag pa'i ri sul la rmongs pa de ni tshe 'dir ni gzhi ma grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan na zhes gang gi tshe rma bya'i sgra grag pa'i ri sul la rmongs pa de ni tshe 'dir ni gzhi ma grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: or in another?‚Äù When one is confused about the ravine where the sound of the peacock is heard, this is called an unestablished reason in this life.

original: dper na zhes bya ba na chos can ma grub na yang ma grub pa'i dper byed pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba na chos can ma grub na yang ma grub pa'i dper byed pa'o //
translated: For example, even when the subject is not established, it is used as an unestablished example.

original: yul thams cad na gnas shing 'dug pa ni thams cad na gnas pa ste /
analyzed: yul thams cad na gnas shing 'dug pa ni thams cad na gnas pa ste /
translated: One who dwells and abides in all places is one who dwells in all places.

original: khyab pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyab pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúpervades‚Äù is ‚Äúis present in all.‚Äù

original: bdag khyab pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag khyab pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: In the proof that the self pervades,

original: yon tan nyid thams cad na dmigs pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni rtags yin te /
analyzed: yon tan nyid thams cad na dmigs pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni rtags yin te /
translated: the reason is ‚Äúbecause pleasure, etc., are perceived everywhere, just as qualities are.‚Äù

original: bdag @74b gi yon tan bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dod pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa yul kun na dmigs pa de'i dngos po de nyid do //
analyzed: bdag @74b gi yon tan bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dod pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa yul kun na dmigs pa de'i dngos po de nyid do //
translated: The fact that the qualities of the self, such as pleasure, pain, desire, hatred, etc., are perceived everywhere is the reason.

original: yon tan ni yon tan can med par yod pa med de /
analyzed: yon tan ni yon tan can med par yod pa med de /
translated: The qualities do not exist without a possessor of qualities,

original: yon tan rnams ni yon tan can dang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir dang / bdag g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rnams ni yon tan can dang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir dang / bdag g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the qualities exist in relation to a possessor of qualities, and the self is not a mover.

original: de bas na ci ste khyab pa ma yin na lho phyogs na dmigs pa'i bde ba la sogs pa ci ltar yul dbus na dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na ci ste khyab pa ma yin na lho phyogs na dmigs pa'i bde ba la sogs pa ci ltar yul dbus na dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, if the self does not pervade, how can the pleasure, etc., perceived in the south be perceived in the center?

original: de ltar na bdag thams cad na gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag thams cad na gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus the self is present everywhere.

original: de la 'dir sangs rgyas pa rnams la bdag ma grub pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: de la 'dir sangs rgyas pa rnams la bdag ma grub pa kho na yin na /
translated: Here the Buddhists say that the self is not established at all.

original: de'i yon tan nyid thams cad na dmigs pa ci zhig grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i yon tan nyid thams cad na dmigs pa ci zhig grub par 'gyur te /
translated: What is established as the object of the quality of that?

original: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: It is a nonestablished reason that appears to be a correct reason.

original: 'di gnyis kyi bye brag ni snga ma ni gzhi la the tshom za ba'i sgo nas chos can la the tshom za bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi bye brag ni snga ma ni gzhi la the tshom za ba'i sgo nas chos can la the tshom za bar bstan to //
translated: The difference between these two is that the former is taught as a doubt about the subject through doubt about the basis.

original: 'di ni chos can ma grub par bstan pa yin no //üîΩde ltar na tshul gcig gi chos can dang 'brel par ma grub pa yang ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni chos can ma grub par bstan pa yin no // de ltar na tshul gcig gi chos can dang 'brel par ma grub pa yang ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: This is taught as a nonestablished subject.üîΩThus, a nonestablished connection with a subject that has one mode is a nonestablished reason that appears to be a correct reason.

original: de bzhin du gzhan mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa zhes bya ba'i tshul gcig ma grub na yang nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa zhes bya ba'i tshul gcig ma grub na yang nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin te /
translated: Similarly, a nonestablished one mode called ‚Äúnot existing in the discordant class‚Äù is a nonestablished correct reason.

original: nges pa ni gcig kho nar nges pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa ni gcig kho nar nges pa ste /
translated: Certainty is ascertained as only one.

original: dgos pa ste 'di la yod pas na nges pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ste 'di la yod pas na nges pa'o //
translated: It is necessary, and since it exists in this, it is certain.

original: nges pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: nges pa med pa yin te /
translated: It is not certain.

original: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba la nges pa yang ma yin bzlog pa la nges pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba la nges pa yang ma yin bzlog pa la nges pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, it is not certain that it is to be established, nor is it certain that it is to be rejected.

original: 'on kyang phyin ci log tu the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyin ci log tu the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: But it is doubtful that it is erroneous.

original: nges pa ni gcig kho nar cig shos pa yid gnyis za ba'i gtan tshigs na ma nges pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nges pa ni gcig kho nar cig shos pa yid gnyis za ba'i gtan tshigs na ma nges pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Since certainty is only one, and doubt is the opposite of that, the reason is called uncertain.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs bas ni dper byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs bas ni dper byed pa yin no //
translated: The example is given by for example, etc.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos so //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos so //
translated: Whatever is permanent, etc. is the property of the permanent, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras btsal ma thag ba 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid dang / rtsol ba las byung ba nyid dang rtag pa nyid du gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras btsal ma thag ba 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid dang / rtsol ba las byung ba nyid dang rtag pa nyid du gzung ngo //
translated: The word etc. includes the immediately following not arisen from effort, not arisen from causes, and permanent.

original: gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos so //
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos so //
translated: Whatever is the object of knowledge, etc. is the property of the object of knowledge, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras mi rtag pa nyid dang ; yang mi rtag pa nyid dang / lus can ma yin pa nyid gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras mi rtag pa nyid dang ; yang mi rtag pa nyid dang / lus can ma yin pa nyid gzung ngo //
translated: The word etc. includes impermanent, not impermanent, and non-embodiment.

original: chos can sgra la rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba na /
analyzed: chos can sgra la rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba na /
translated: When proving the property of the subject, sound, is permanent,

original: gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos can bzhi char yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par ma grub pa ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa'i chos can bzhi char yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par ma grub pa ma nges pa yin te /
translated: all four subjects, such as being an object of knowledge, are not established as nonexistent in the discordant side.üîΩThey are not ascertained.

original: 'di ltar sgra rtag ste /üîΩgzhal bya @75a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra rtag ste / gzhal bya @75a * //
translated: For example, sound is permanent

original: nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin dang bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin dang bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it is an object of knowledge, like space, like a pot.

original: gzhal bya nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs khyab pa yin no //üîΩsgra brtsal ma thag tu byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs khyab pa yin no // sgra brtsal ma thag tu byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Being an object of knowledge pervades the similar and dissimilar sides.üîΩSound is not produced by effort because it is impermanent, like a flash of lightning, like space, like a pot.

original: mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir glog bzhin dang / nam mkha' bzhin dang / bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa 'di ni glog la sogs pa yod la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir glog bzhin dang / nam mkha' bzhin dang / bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa 'di ni glog la sogs pa yod la /
translated: Impermanence exists in a flash of lightning, etc.,

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa la med bas na mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig yod pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa la med bas na mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig yod pa yin no //
translated: but does not exist in space, etc., so it exists in one part of the similar side.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ni khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ni khyab pa yin te /
translated: It pervades the dissimilar side.

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in all that is produced immediately upon the operation of its cause.

original: sgra brtsal ma thag tu byung ba yin te /
analyzed: sgra brtsal ma thag tu byung ba yin te /
translated: Sound is produced immediately upon the operation of its cause,

original: mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin du /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin du /
translated: because it is impermanent, like a pot,

original: glog bzhin du /
analyzed: glog bzhin du /
translated: like lightning,üîΩlike space.

original: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba'i mi rtag pa nyid ni glog la sogs pa la yod la /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba'i mi rtag pa nyid ni glog la sogs pa la yod la /
translated: Impermanence exists in lightning, etc.,

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa la med ba yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa la med ba yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod pa yin no //
translated: but not in space, etc., so it exists in one part of the dissimilar class.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la ni khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la ni khyab pa yin te /
translated: But in the similar class, it is pervasive,

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in all that is produced immediately upon the operation of its cause.

original: sgra rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra rtag pa yin te /
translated: Sound is permanent,üîΩbecause it is not corporeal, like space, like a subtle particle, like karma, like a pot.

original: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin dang / rdul phra rab bzhin dang / las bzhin dang / bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i lus can ma yin pa nyid ni gnyi ga'i phyogs gcig la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin dang / rdul phra rab bzhin dang / las bzhin dang / bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i lus can ma yin pa nyid ni gnyi ga'i phyogs gcig la yod pa yin te /
translated: Noncorporeality exists in one part of both classes,

original: gnyi ga'i phyogs gcig nam mkha' dang las la ni yod pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i phyogs gcig nam mkha' dang las la ni yod pa /
translated: Space and karma are the two that exist in both the similar and dissimilar classes.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig rdul phra rab dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig bum pa la sogs pa la med pa yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig rdul phra rab dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig bum pa la sogs pa la med pa yin te /
translated: The atom is the one that exists in the similar class, and the pot, etc. are the ones that exist in the dissimilar class.

original: bum pa dang rdul phra rab la sogs pa lus can yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bum pa dang rdul phra rab la sogs pa lus can yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The pot, etc. and the atom, etc. are corporeal.

original: / bye brag pa dag rdul phra rab rtag par khas len pa de bas ma mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nang du gtogs so //üîΩchos rnam pa 'di bzhi char yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par ma grub par de bas nam nges pa yin no //
analyzed: / bye brag pa dag rdul phra rab rtag par khas len pa de bas ma mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nang du gtogs so // chos rnam pa 'di bzhi char yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par ma grub par de bas nam nges pa yin no //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas accept that the atom is permanent, so it is included in the dissimilar class.üîΩSince these four attributes are not established as not existing in the dissimilar class, they are not ascertained.

original: ji ltar tshul 'di ma grub ba'i ma nges ba yin pa de bzhi na du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa zhes bya ba tshul de nyid la the tshom za na yang ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar tshul 'di ma grub ba'i ma nges ba yin pa de bzhi na du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa zhes bya ba tshul de nyid la the tshom za na yang ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Since this method is not established, it is uncertain. If one doubts this very method, saying, ‚ÄúIt is not ascertained as not existing in the dissimilar class,‚Äù it is also uncertain.

original: de'i dper byed pa ni dper na brjod par 'dod pa'i mi la zhig thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i dper byed pa ni dper na brjod par 'dod pa'i mi la zhig thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The example of that is, for instance, ‚ÄúThe person who is being spoken about is not omniscient.‚Äù

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa ni bsgrub bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa ni bsgrub bya'o //
translated: Not omniscient is the probandum.

original: brjod par 'dod pa ni smra bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa ni smra bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The person who is being spoken about is the one who is being spoken about, the one who is being discussed.

original: mi ni chos @75b can no ;
analyzed: mi ni chos @75b can no ;
translated: A person is the subject.

original: /'dod chags la sogs pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa gang yin pa de 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa ste bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: /'dod chags la sogs pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa gang yin pa de 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa ste bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second probandum is ‚Äúhe is endowed with attachment and so on, and with aversion and so on.‚Äù

original: 'am zhes smos pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ba tha dad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'am zhes smos pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ba tha dad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù is stated to indicate that the probandum is different from being endowed with attachment and so on.

original: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba'i skabs ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid dam 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba'i skabs ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid dam 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the context of the probandum is either not being omniscient or being endowed with attachment and so on.

original: smra ba ni tshig gi nus pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba ni tshig gi nus pa'o //
translated: Speaking is the power of words.

original: de la sogs pa dang yin pa de ni mig 'dzums pa dang 'byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa dang yin pa de ni mig 'dzums pa dang 'byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which is like that and so on is the closing and opening of the eyes and so on.

original: smra ba la sogs pa'i chos de mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i ma nges pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: smra ba la sogs pa'i chos de mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i ma nges pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That is called ‚Äúuncertain‚Äù when there is doubt about the reversal of the property-possessor from the discordant side.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The probandum is not omniscience, but omniscience is the discordant side.

original: de la tshig la sogs pa yod dam med the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: de la tshig la sogs pa yod dam med the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: There is doubt about whether or not the words, etc. exist there.

original: de bas na smra ba thams cad mkhyen pa yin nam /
analyzed: de bas na smra ba thams cad mkhyen pa yin nam /
translated: Therefore, is speech omniscience?

original: 'on te thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin zhes bya bar mngon pa med pas smra ba nyid ni ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin zhes bya bar mngon pa med pas smra ba nyid ni ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Or is it not omniscience? Since there is no ascertainment, speech is uncertain.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa smra ba mi dmigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa smra ba mi dmigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt omniscience not observed in speech?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la tshig de ji ltar the tshom za zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la tshig de ji ltar the tshom za zhe na /
translated: How can there be doubt about the words of omniscience?

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa smra ba ma dmigs so zhes bya bar mngon par mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i rigs can de lta bu ni the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa smra ba ma dmigs so zhes bya bar mngon par mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i rigs can de lta bu ni the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that the non-apprehension of the omniscient one is of that kind, which is the cause of doubt.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yul bltar mi snang ba'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de'i dngos po ni yul bltar mi snang ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: yul bltar mi snang ba'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de'i dngos po ni yul bltar mi snang ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The state of the object that is not seen is the state of the object that is not seen.

original: 'di ltar yul bltar mi snang zhing mi dmigs pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul bltar mi snang zhing mi dmigs pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the object that is not seen and not apprehended is the cause of doubt.

original: nges pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang smra ba nyid dang ldog pa ni the tshom du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang smra ba nyid dang ldog pa ni the tshom du gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is not the cause of certainty. Therefore, the negation of the omniscient one, which is the opposite of the non-omniscient one, and the negation of the speaker, are doubtful.

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa la smra ba nyid med do zhes ni mi smra'i /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa la smra ba nyid med do zhes ni mi smra'i /
translated: We do not say that the speaker does not exist in the omniscient one because of non-apprehension.

original: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang smra ba nyid lhan cig 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na ;
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang smra ba nyid lhan cig 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na ;
translated: But omniscience and speech are contradictory, because they are mutually exclusive.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang smra ba nyid gnyis la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang smra ba nyid gnyis la 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction between omniscience and speech.

original: 'gal ba med pa'i rgyu'i phyir yang ldog pa ma grub bo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa'i rgyu'i phyir yang ldog pa ma grub bo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: And because there is no contradiction, the pervasion is not established.

original: khyab pa dang ldan pa'i ldog pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: khyab pa dang ldan pa'i ldog pa ston pa ni /
translated: The demonstration of the pervasion that is possessed is as follows:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa zhes bsgrub bya med pa'i rang bzhin thams cad mkhyen par rjes su brjod @76a * //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa zhes bsgrub bya med pa'i rang bzhin thams cad mkhyen par rjes su brjod @76a * //
translated: Having restated the probandum, the absence of omniscience, as ‚Äúomniscience,‚Äù

original: nas ; de smra ba ma yin no zhes sgrub par byed pa smra ba nyid med par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: nas ; de smra ba ma yin no zhes sgrub par byed pa smra ba nyid med par sgrub pa'o //
translated: he proves that ‚Äúhe is not a speaker,‚Äù thereby proving the absence of speech.

original: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni sgrub par byed pa med pa la nges pa yin pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa med pas khyab pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni sgrub par byed pa med pa la nges pa yin pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa med pas khyab pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, because the absence of the probandum is ascertained in the absence of the proof, the pervasion by the absence of the proof is demonstrated.

original: ldog pa'i khyab pa 'di 'dra ba ni smra ba nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gnyis 'gal ba yod na 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ldog pa'i khyab pa 'di 'dra ba ni smra ba nyid dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gnyis 'gal ba yod na 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: This kind of pervasion of the contrapositive is established when there is a contradiction between being a speaker and being omniscient.

original: 'gal ba yang yod pa ma yin pa de bas na mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'gal ba yang yod pa ma yin pa de bas na mi 'grub bo //
translated: But there is no contradiction, therefore it is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: the tshom za ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of doubt.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'gal ba med pa de bas na the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gal ba med pa de bas na the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Because there is no contradiction, therefore there is doubt.

original: the tshom za ba'i phyir ldog pa mi grub bo //
